Note: Deep Ruby with aromas of blue and red fruits with herb floral spice. On the palate, plum, blackberry and raspberry flavors with notes of licorice and black pepper. Medium+ finish, fine tannins ending with fruit and spicy herb character.

4.2
It’s a really nice Syrah. Not as structured as it probably would be a few years from now but still great tannins and a nice wine.
Red and blue fruit with a medium body. Lightly tanic and easy drinking. Smooth and elegant. It's not as big and bold as some other Washington syrah.

Blackcurrant, oak, red cherry, earthy on the nose.
M+ acidity and tannins.
Blackberry, blackcurrant, oak, dark cherry, plum on the palate.
Dark fruit, plum, BlackBerry and a bold mouthful of good wine. Another K vinter winner. Ready to drink immediately no decanting no fuss pure enjoyment.
No doubt an exceptional Syrah. Rich in aroma of blackberry and vanilla. The palate enjoys a tart beginning cranberry and finishing with blackberry, tobacco, oak & vanilla. An #Empingated Syrah.

blackberry blueberry pepper vanilla oak dark fruit plum cherry smoke chocolate black cherry minerals earthy tobacco licorice black fruit raspberry stone dark fruit dark chocolate blueberry boysenberry jam

Medium to medium + body with medium tannin and a medium to medium + acidity. Notes of black cherry, cassis, black pepper, tree coal and spices. Shows a big personality, with lot of dark fruit, but still with a precise and tight structure. Will drink beautifully over the next decade.

2017 vintage. Opaque with a slight ruby rim. Nose of blue fruit and ash, a little olive? Mmuted fruit and mineral on the 2nd/3rd days. Medium+ alcohol (14.5%) and medium acidity. Medium bodied, off-dry, with subtle blue fruit. Fine tannins and a medium length finish. Hmmm... I’ve always been pleased with all the K-vintners Syrahs, but this was a little underwhelming to me. Pretty closed and one dimensional to me. Easy drinking and pleasant but not overly impressive. I’ll sit on my other bottle. 3.8 stars

Another great budget Syrah from K Vintners, and I personally prefer it to their MKC this year.  It’s medium to full bodied, perhaps a bit more bold than last year, with blueberries,pepper, earth, and less of the typical olive note which I appreciate.  Will definitely look to secure a few more bottles!

Easter dinner wine with leg of lamb.14.5% abv. Inky eggplant in color with a bit of a brownish tint.  Nose of vanilla, blackberry, licorice, smoke and leather.  Full bodied. Long slow grippy legs. Medium plus tannins. Pallet of BlackBerry, black cherry, pepper and bitter coffee. Well balanced with a long finish.

Enjoying Easter Lamb dinner with Lori. Deep Violet color with a hint of brownish. Black cherry, Black Pepper and Oak nose. Black cherry, Black Currants, dark plums and Oak Flavors. Full body with medium high tannins.

4.2 Bottle #3 from my fall allocation.  I’ve had the 2016 Milbrandt, taken from the Northridge and Clifton Hills vineyards, named after Butch Milbrandt, one of the founders of the Wahluke Slope Ava.  Great wine.  This is a very young and light Syrah.  A little too light.  A light nose of lavender, ripe cherry, chocolate and sage.  Very light floral and herbal notes.  Nice light acidity and tannins.  Very easy to drink.  Needs more oomph and personality.  Almost too drinkable and approachable.
4.2 Spicy blackberry liqueur on the nose.  Dark cherry on the palate.  Well oaked, nicely balanced.  Enjoyed!
Blue fruits, vanilla, black olive, savory, aromatic, slight of perfume, lavender on nose. silky tannic. worth it!
All the ripe blue fruit, with a savory black olive back end, good structure, chalky tannins, and moderate length. Really liked this.
On the nose there is ash, ripe cherry and olive and juice hits the palate with a tasty minerality
Another wonderful wine that is smooth right from the start
Minerals, game, salt,  blackberry pepper smoke leather plum
Dark fruit, plum, game, floral, leather, oak.
Well aged american syrah. Beautiful brick rim. Full of black pepper, violet. Riped raspberry, blueberry. Silky. Cinnamon, chocolate finish.
pepper blackberry plum dark chocolate
Pale ruby. Smells of blackberry and vanilla. Medium+ tannins and balanced. Earthy flavors with a bit of black cherry. Very good. Thought it was French Cabernet Franc.
Lots of great berry notes up front like blueberry and black currant. Lots of baking spice and pepper notes hit next and some earthy, slate, and minerals hit last. Solid
Hay and earthy smell on opening,  blackberry, Currant, cherry.

Gave this 4.5 because of the PQR. Stone, herb, and dark fruit on nose. Dry tannic fruity mouth. Reminiscent on some of the other Walla Walla syrahs that have a stone mouth, but this one goes down a bit easier / isn’t quite as complex (though still very well balanced, I’m comparing against $60-100 bottles.)

It seems that this wine is true classic of American Syrah, which has creamy texture with very strong pepper flavor. It has a deep ruby color and beautiful notes of blackberries and raspberries. It has medium to full-bodied and flavorful finish. James Suckling gave 92 points for this 2017 vintage.

This is so very very good. Notes of vanilla, blackberry, chocolate, leather (on the nose). dry, tannins are present. Full body yet enough acidity.
Had it with a home made chili con carne.
Will definitely buy again.
More like a 3.7 or 3.8. But- there are other K Vintner syrahs that we prefer. A good wine, but in this price range I have others I like more. Maybe 3.9.
My first petit syrah and it was a nice surprise for me. I would like to try and pair with the appropriate meal and think it would then really shine.
Great medium body Syrah.
Nose is dark and smoky, sharpie, leather, pepper, and tannins. Lots of “tears” on the glass. Taste is high alcohol, medium structure, lots of dancing and lingering pepper.

Medium bodied, light tannins. Hints of raspberry, subtle vanilla, slight strawberry. Trending towards lighter fruits as opposed to stone fruit. 
Definitely worth a try.
Perfectly balanced, succulent, mouth filling dark extracted, can’t get enough!
Excellent! Had with pork chops.
Light, smooth, fruity Annie’s March 21
This is a nice syrah! I give 3.75 stars. Tastes of black cherry and dark chocolate. It’s pretty dry for my liking, but overall tasty and I’d definitely drink it again.

Medium + Ruby 

Pronounced black cherry, mint, cream, coconut, cedar, black plum, slight pepper, red plum, fruit forward 

Medium + body, high abv, high grippy Unripe tannin, medium, abv is quite obvious, medium length

Good quality, abv is too obvious, medium acid, so balance is a bit off, the palate can’t catch up to the nose.  Complexity and length is also lacking. 

Drink now, can age for a few years, the tannin and abv can help a bit.

Very tight and took several hours to open up. Once opened, faint nose of cherry, blueberry, vanilla and olive. Medium bodied with fresh acidity and fine grained tannins. Not my favorite K syrah that I've opened this year, but maybe it will improve with time.

Medium ruby in color. Pronounced intensity on the nose with aromas of blueberry, blackberry, black plum, boysenberry, blueberry danish/pastry, brioche, cloves. On the palate, some of those black fruits but also more earthy notes like forest floor and wet leaves with some pepper. Dry, high tannin, medium acid, medium alcohol. Balanced, medium length, medium+ intensity, medium complexity. Good to very good.
blueberry, blackberry, pepper, leather, vanilla, chocolate, tannins on the hefty side—could use some time/air
Medium-full bodied, medium+ acidity, moderate tannin, dry. Black olive, meaty/savory, smoky, dark fruits
Starts slow then unfurls some spice and power without getting too big. ~29
Not too heavy but rather delicate syrah
Chewy and dry, but disappointing.

3.7
Lots of purple notes. Decent for the price.
Solid Syrah. Needs more time
Easy to drink, soft.
Good not worth the price. Dry and smooth
Delicious. Chocolate tasting and nice.
A little spice hut, followed by licorice
Plum, dark cherry, earth, gravel
It tastes good. Deep ruby color and blackberry flavor.
Full bodied fruity, amazing.
Solid
Good Shiraz
Young so will revisit but this is fruit forward cherry is overpowering.
solid washington state syrah!!
Needed a lot of time to open up. High alcohol until it did, but gradually blackberries, raisins, black pepper, and cloves came into play.

This has all the tastes that I associate w wines from the PNW. Pepper & earthy are the flavor notes. Black fruit curves the brassy mineral tastes that dominate this wine. Overall great experience. Best Syrah I’ve had recently.
Fantastic

Perhaps you are indifferent? Thus today you wish to know what this bottle is about. 

Plum, pepper, berries. Smooth like jazz, the balance of flavor and depth is skill in a glass. As you sip,  please don’t shrug at what will be, but rather shout. 

K Syrah Syrah!
Dry and oaky, left you wanting more.
start with sweet berry and chocolate, vanilla , coffee and change to deep dry , dark berry, peper
Almost tastes like cherry medicine on the tongue and balances out with earthy tones. Not my favorite.
Anise, dark fruit, vanilla, blueberry, leather. Strong alcohol on the nose. Nice, but a little pricey.
Awesome gamey aroma and very rich fruit . Young and closed right now, but my bet is that  with time and air it will unfurl with flavor.
Dry full bodied

Elated to pay way too much for this in BC!
It was $30usd and almost $60cad 
But I had to, because Charles Smith knows what's up with Syrah, rich, full bodied, and nuanced.....that's what he does.
Angel really really liked this. This is a lively wine with real personality.  Nice berry flavors with good acidity. Will try to find more.

4.2

Blind tasting led by @[1|24963514|Kevin Ware]. It had been a while since I’ve had K Vitners Syrah and it never disappoints
90/100. The 2018 may need more time to develop. As of now, the complexity and harmony of previously reviewed vintages is absent. Still good juice.
Full fruit, a bit jammy, pairs well with spicy sausage.
Big and bold, rich dark fruit, white pepper, strong finish

Sample Exchange with @Gino Snoeck #2. Syrah from The States, new for me, nice! Let it breathe for 2h to get rid of the alcohol. Smoky nose with toasted accents & garrigue like herbs. Cassis, blueberries, some plums on alcohol, oak, eucalyptus whiff with touch of wet grass. Powerful palate loaded with herbs, packed black fruit & good acidity. Quite the finish with some sharp edges & some drying tannins. Feels young, but already very nice! 4.0.

After being underwhelmed with the last K I purchased (a 2011 vintage of The Deal) this was a very pleasant surprise...especially given I found this for <$40 in a private store. I was prepared to decant it for awhile, but it really didn't need it. Popped and poured it was very approachable - smooth oak & rich dark fruits. As it opened up more complex notes of smoked meat, licorice & spice appeared. Med acidity/med finish. It paired very nicely with pulled pork.

92 Points - K Vintners is producing some great stuff out of Washington State. I’m not sure this is one of my favourites, but nonetheless it showed exactly what Washington Syrah is supposed to be.

Evergreen pine needles, thistles, with raw cocoa and light roast coffee, green cocoa, red plums, and fresh herbs. Stem tannins give the wine some bite, but with age should integrate.Overall this is quite an underripe style, but complex and well made.

Entry level wine from K Vintners,
Nice nose with dark berries fruit, plums, spices, dark chocolate, medium to full bodied palate, same black fruit flavors, spice, powerful but not overdone, coffee and herbs, fairly acidity and good tannin structure for balance, nice but still young Syrah. 90 DSP

One of my first higher end 2015 Washington vintage wines and it is a beauty.  Concentrated.  Grilled meats, black olives, black berries, pepper and big glorious tannins.  Great nose and finish.  For my friend Chad, this is one serious QPR gem at $30.
Had this wine with steak. Lighter in the glass than I expected, but full bodied with lots of juicy tannins. Would highly recommend if you are looking for a big red.

On the nose 👃: blackberry leather with a touch of oak. On the tongue 👅:  
plum blackberry oak pepper leather. 

This is a very nice wine 🍷 from Washington state 🇺🇸🥂‼️
A nice rich Syrah. It's deep ruby in color and has a nice complexity to it. I get pepper and blackberries with a smoky quality. The tannins are bright without being overwhelming.
blueberry blackberry tobacco on the nose. oak smoke leather ash mushroom developed on the palate. stiff tannin proves it's young and has potential for more years to come.
Good enough
Complex, dark berry nose with peppery and roasted notes. Very elegant and creamy, punchy, dense with wonderfully round tannins on the finish.
Very solid Syrah. These guys don’t seem to make a bad one, even at this lower price point. Super peppery upfront, raspberry jam behind it.
This is dark rich wine in both aroma and flavor. Aromas of blueberry, licorice and smoke. Flavors of blueberry, blackberry and mild peat.
Lovely Syrah, with balance of tannin, deep red fruit, and touch of acidity. Still too young; should get even better with age.

Solid Washington syrah. Will likely get even better with some more cellar time. Medium plus body tannins and acidity.  Tastes of blackberry plum blueberry vanilla oak leather smoke pepper and a touch of stone minerality

A great complex Syrah. Deep dark red in color. Very tannic wine framed with a higher acidity. Rich aromas of dark fruit. Tastes of blackberry and black cherry balanced with a leathery , pepper and earthy finish. Full body. A drier wine with spice on the finish.

Tasted blind in a lineup of some pricey Charles Smith wines. Wow. This wines sucks you in and spins your mind grapes with its complexity. Typical blueberries, oak, vanilla, earthiness, sage, with great balance. This will last forever. Well, at least until the glaciers melt.

Single vineyard fruit from a premier region in the hands of a master like Charles Smith can only mean one thing, and that’s terrific wine, which this truly is. There’s a reason people love Washington Syrah and this is a great example. Big black fruit, plum, inky density, complimented with mile oak, white pepper, earthy notes and more, this wine is full bodied and rich and enjoyable all at once. I’m a fan of Smith, also Leighton, and all that their great minds and skill sets have to offer. Cheers all! 🍷

A great entry level Syrah from Smith!

100% Syrah sourced from 2 vineyards on the Wahluke Slope, one of the hottest spots in the Columbia Valley AVA.

Nose with spicy floral/red fruit, pretty aromatic. Full body, med+ tannins/acidity.
Flavors focus on spicy floral and red fruit notes, leading to black olives and earth. Long finish.

A very good Syrah.

What the fuck it’s perfect. 
I can feel taste like very deep grapefruit and not source. full body
Fog and black berries on nose...cherry profile and cola taste combined with a zippy acidity ... It has a nice medium to full body ... Lighter in fruit but nice tannins.
3.75, but I rounded up. It's tight, for sure, but has powerful flavors of black currant, carmelized meats licorice, and spice.
Deep ruby color. Blackberry, pepper and some oak on the nose. Black fruits and spice on the palate. Good QPR on this one.
Love love love it
Deep earthy leather with strong spice and subtle undertones of dark fruit. Started excellent and got better as it opened over dinner.

Good.
Perfect balance.
Good for price.
Smooth and nice.

2017vintage 3.8points
 vanilla oak pepper cherry earthy minerals raspberry savory blueberry
Juicy red fruits cherry, plum, blackberry, vanilla. Full bodied.
Very nice soft flavor. It definitely has to open up to enjoy the full range of flavor. I tasted fruit forward with rich finish. Worth a go for sure.

4.0
Flavorful Syrah with blueberries and oak. Long burning finish. At this price point you can get better balanced and elegant wine.
Delicious big, fruit forward Syrah. Was excellent with a simple roasted sirloin.
Deep, smooth, earthy, smoky.
Dark fruit- blueberry, blackberry, and plum. White pepper, leather, and smoke. Very good wine.
Blackberry cobbler and chocolate, with supporting flavors of oak and spices

Medium ruby with a complex and quite expressive nose of blackberries, ripe blueberries, blackcurrant, leafs, game, sleet, minerality, salt, smoke, tobacco, leather, sweet licorice, green olives and vanilla pie. So much going on! Medium bodied, dry to off dry, firm tannins, medium acidity, with richness and flavors of tart red cherries and blueberries. Finishes medium long, juicy, with blackberries, tobacco leafs, slightly spicy with peppery notes. Wonderful Syrah yet still young and on the sweet side.

This is great Syrah for the money if you can find it.  A lot of berries and dark fruit coming through, as well as a kiss of oak, but you never lose sense of the varietal.  Cooler climate comes through as well.

Very nice QPR syrah. Slightly more tannic and olive-y than their similarly priced Motor City Kitty. 

Medium+ tannin. Medium+ body. Medium acidity. Dark, nearly opaque black in color. 

Olive, meat, blue/black fruit.

Delicious and rich. Syrah is not my favorite grape but this vine offered good sight to new world style syrah. Long and rich palate, all the normal characters that you could find in carefully made wine. A bit expensive in Finland but happy that had possibility to taste it.

100% Syrah from their Clifton Hill and Northridge vineyards in the Columbia Valley AVA. Fermented on ambient yeast. 39 days on the skins. 18 months in French oak (35% new). Under ripe stewed fruit. Cherry, plum, blackberry, tomato, aged balsamic, herbs, dark chocolate, baking spice, and pepper. Savoury. Mouth drying angry tannins. Med+ acidity, med+ body. Dry.
Beautiful color. Cope with medium body / intense but exquisite grapes - a tannin note'ish - if that makes sense - [american] delightful and elegant.

I had this wine over two years ago and it developed a bit but there is still more aging potential. I still go for 3.7 stars!👍🏻
Aged for 15 months in 30% new and 70% used oak Puncheons.

A medium ruby red with purple shades and many legs.

Medium aromas of cherries, black raspberries, black olives, violets, eucalyptus, black pepper and herbs.

The red has a medium and juicy acidity, medium still youthful tannins.

It’s medium+ bodied with 14.5%.

Medium+ flavors of black raspberries, cherries, violets,
~~~~>>
I loved this, another home run from K! Bright fresh fruit but with notable complexity too. Notes of plum, blackberry, licorice, black pepper and fragrant bell pepper.
Just as solid overall as the ‘16, not as smoky out of the gate so didn’t need as much as a decant to let the berry notes stand out. Just a tad more dry.

Amazingly fragrant wine! Pretty light to medium bodied, but with a strong acidity. High alcohol, kept making me cough even after letting the wine breath alittle. Bright red fruits, rose, & eucalyptus on this wine. Loved it
Unique smell which throws off flavor. Good wine. Smooth and solid but ranked 3rd out of 3 for wine tasting
Dark fruit, black cherries, cuberdons, gingerbread, hints of nuts, and pepper. Film bodied, nice and long finish.
Dark fruit
Awesome truly
Still amazeballs!

Strong 4.2. Will be even better in a year or two. 

Red raspberries. Blackberries. Smoke. Spice. Smoked meats. Pepper. 

Moderate tannins. Great on the palate. 

I am really becoming a fan of Charles Smith and this Syrah is a champion. Maybe not the WS95 of its cousin. And still damn good. 

Paired nicely (duh) with a big juicy 🥩! Even better with chocolate.

Probably the greatest vintage of the cuvée to date, the 2014 Syrah Milbrandt Vineyard is 100% Syrah, fermented with 100% whole clusters, that spent 15 months in 20% new French oak barrels and puncheons.  This beauty is overflowing with notes of cassis, caramelized meats, licorice and spice, which give way to a full-bodied, concentrated superbly textured Syrah that can be enjoyed today, or cellared for a decade.  94 points Wine advocate. 15% alcohol.

Vegetal with fresh bell peppers, rosemary, violets, and soft blueberry tart on the nose and palate. Great focus on blue fruit and black currant, with fresh cool beef in the middle. Wet earth and rock, and a tinge of spice at the end with great minerals that replace biting tannins. This is a nice, quite velvety Washington Syrah that will develop well for several years ahead.

Great fruit-forward, ripe Syrah. Deep ruby color. Blackberry, black raspberry, black cherry, black pepper, and savory. Baking spices, cedar, and vanilla. Medium acid, high tannins, high alcohol, full body, pronounced intensity, and a long balanced finish. It's not terribly elegant and doesn't evolve much, but it has plenty of complexity and it's smooth and ready to drink, despite its age-worthy structure.

Very dark and opaque as expected from a syrah. Nice nose of brambly, jammy, intense blackberry along with some wood and earth. Full bodied dark fruit but not intensely fruity on the palate. Medium tannins on the long enjoyable finish. Very good for the price.

Big, bold and beautiful.  Syrah is such a favorite of mine.  This one has an overtly jammy blackberry foundation that also brings a cherry cola to the party followed by coffee, vanilla, and herbs.  The palate also brings an overt smokiness and some of that meaty bacony thing finishing with pepper.  lls young and time will be kind,  If I have one criticism it would be that at 15 percent abv this one burns a bit.  All said a big and beautiful Washington state syrah with a great depth and a little attitude.

Deep garnet color with blueberry, violets and spice nose. Smooth balanced open, full bodied and big acidity with notes of pepper and blackberry with silky tannins and a dry long finish. This is 4.2*. CS is a Syrah wizard.
Impressed with the freshness here, blackberry, plum, bloody, iron, pepper, vanilla, a little kalamata olive, roasted green pepper, fruit is a little raisinated on the palate, savory as it opens
Chocolate thick texture, almost a sweetness about it. Smooth, simple but elegant finish. Some dried cherry and other deep fruits. Love how it stays on the tongue. Had with pork tenderloin. Would buy!
Syrah! It’s like visiting an old friend and you just click. Velvet and yet potent nose AND taste. A true pleaser but without getting boring due to a certain level of complexity as well.
Pretty cool Syrah from Washington. Ripe black fruits plum fig licorice and clove
Big black fruit, blackberry. Chocolate, coffee

Medium + intensity 
Vanilla and Milky note and palette
Batter scotch taste
Silky medium tannin  
blackberry plum dark fruit pepper sage chocolate
Needed a day open
Very complex, dark cherries, spice, strong through the mid palette
Barnyard and peppercorn nose, acidic, plum and blueberry. Very pleasant to drink!
Wow liked this american a lot. 200%syrah. Dark red colour long aftertaste
Blackberry, vanilla and earthy smokey tones.  Really nice Syrah and lovely as it opens!
Strong, dark chocolate with good end.
Earthy clay nose with a light red cherry. Body is smokey with red fruit and balanced minerality. Medium body with smooth cherry finish.
The nose is dominated by licorice and red berry. The palate is dry herbaceous and cherry with spicy acidity. It has just enough tannin and has a comfortable rustic charm. Delicious
Big and dark but smooth finish, likely prime time for this one, dark and not really brooding but very satisfying sipper.
Bigger than most WA syrahs I’ve had, big dark berry punch up front with moderate tannins and a relatively short finish.
Very nice. Nose has fresh red fruit. Palate: Bright lovely dark fruit. Low acid. Medium tannins. Bit of pepper.  Nice wine

4.0 - I didn’t realize until I purchased this bottle that it was so young—most K-Vintner offerings are ‘13 or older and it makes a huge difference in the character and body of these WA Syrahs. Make sure you decant for hours to loosen things up. After some oxygen you are rewarded with aromatics of violet, potpourri, blueberry and subtle green pepper with flavors of savory blackberry, plum and fig. This is my least favorite K Syrah and it still comes in at a solid 4 stars. Not bad!

Beautiful deep dark ruby red color, Slight acidic notes on the nose, Wild blackberries, deep rich flavors, blackberry jam, plum, chocolate, bold full bodied, expressive flavors.. some acidic mineral aspects, earthy tones … nice mature fruit

In our house, February is red wine month. This year we’re exploring Syrah around the world.  First up, Washington State. 

Finishing Washington State with three by K Vintners.  Aromas of blackberries, chocolate, oak and black olive.  Similar flavors with smoke and earthy tannins.  Powerful for an entry level wine from this producer.

Medium ruby purple in the glass.

Black fruit, blackberry, blueberry, seashells, black pepper. Nice minerality. Medium to full bodied. Complex for the price point of $25 at Costco. An evolving finish of herbs and spices. This paired beautifully with an experimental burger i made from ground lamb with melted  tete de moine, bread and butter pickles, and dijonaise. Grilled broccoli for the side. Delightful.

Deep ruby red colour. Blackberries, black cherry, blueberries, blackcurrant, licorice, black pepper and vanilla on the nose. Taste of blackberries, black cherry, blueberries, blackcurrant, licorice, black pepper, vanilla, leather and chocolate. Long and dry finish. A juicy wine. Goes well with beef, game or lamb.

Dark ruby with lots of salumi meats/charcuterie board aromas along with plum jelly/black ripe currants and some toasted marcona almonds. Palate is tons of black ripe fruit and French vanilla beans with a stick of salami playing fiddle in the background! High alcohol, tannins, med plus acid, very balanced. Not as old world style as I prefer but this has a lot of time left on it (7+yrs). 93/93+ solid
The guys brought over some Okinawa beef. Would have been a high grade so this deserved a nice drop of red.  The Syrah was perfect. Definitely recommended.

What a wine......

Huge dark fruit notes on the nose, with the promise of a full long lasting taste.

Aromas of tobacco and slice (white pepper).

The taste is full on with a big initial hit, you are greeted with dark berry flavour with a mild yet noticeable pepper taste.

A long yet smooth finish really makes this wine stand out.

Simply stunning

Liquefied blueberry pie. This was pretty easy to point out as a WA Syrah in a blind tasting. In fact my buddy guessed exactly what it was-an entry level K Vintners. For me, quite a mouthful. There’s alcohol burn that I couldn’t get over. Needs time but just not for me.
Vanilla and some heat.
Ruby color. Beautiful chocolate , strawberry , leather nose. Thick tannin with fit acidity palate. The finish is soft and last than I expected. It pairs well with my mushroom risotto.
Aroma: chalk, sweet smoke, dried cherries. Palate: charred venison, black cherry, fine tannins.
Very tasty. Great up front taste with slight tannins and good finish.
Black fruit, cherry, smoke. Pretty tannic bet mellowed after breathing. Went well with split pea soup.

Nice smooth berry flavors nice tannins 
Surprised me
Like it more than I expected
Black cherry, raspberry, cola, caramel, coffee and clay finish.
Dark red colour. Cassis, licorice and spices. Good depth and very well balanced. Northern Rhone rather than American style. Still young. Will be aging very well until 2025. 90-92 pts.
Great color. Intense aromas of red fruits and smoke. Very well balanced.
Excellent Syrah, more refined than fruity, more elegant than spicy although the usual notes show up.  Nice long finish
BlackBerry. Cassis. Leather. Tobacco. Cocoa. Pepper. This a slightly bold Syrah with good structure and a worthy finish.
Plus an additional 1/4 star. Dark plum, all of, spice cake, along with the dark Cherries, rose petals and forest floor.
Leather and minerals vanilla and spice
Solid Syrah from Washington, dark cherry and smokey notes with a soft finish. Drink now or hold
Long and rough taste, dark fruits, chocolate, tobacco, smoky charcuterie. Simply wonderful!
Oaky, vanilla, full body. Very nice wine. Lingers on the pallet. Big wine.
Nice texture and balance
Generous fruit, not so peppery but a smooth feeling in the palate. Fantastic wine together with a Moroccan buffet dinner.
Extremely full body. In your face, knock your teeth out kinda wine. Love it ... but eat meat with this if you're a virgin.
This is really good stuff. Powerful but with grace. Still has many years ahead of it. A bit expensive though.
B+/A- (dark purple, big, bold, jammy, oaky, excellent fruit, crazy long finish)
Another winner from Charles Smith. Great price. Great wine. Opaque.  Wet concrete on the nose. Palate is multilayered. More concrete, wet leather. Blackberries.
Just what I'm looking for in a US Syrah. Full bodied with deep inky purple. Smokey and meaty with a core of plum, cooked blueberries, and other dark fruits

A good wine. Dark berries, spices, herbs, vanilla, oak and fresh fruits. It's very powerfull with hard tannins. This could stay in the cellar for many years. Good balance and nice structure. It's full bodied amd the finish is long! Good value!

Bright ruby ​​red. In the nose intense fruit flavors of blackberries and cassis, with hints of leather and Asian spices. The palate is silky smooth and incredibly dense.  Minerality and tannins are wonderfully balanced and thus ensure long drinking pleasure.

Purple, high concentration with medium viscosity and med. + intensity. Aromas of black currant, blackberries, smoke, leather, and earth, with a bit of oak.  Medium-bodied with med.+ alcohol (14%), med. tannin and med. finish. Med.+ complexity.

Deep garnet with aromas of blueberry and strong molasses

Blueberry, molasses, licorice, milk chocolate, cayenne pepper, green peppercorn, tobacco and char

So great!

Note: my wife grew up on a cattle farm and the first thing she said on the nose was “cattle feed!”. We look up the major ingredients of cattle feed...... MOLASSES!!! She’s a future somm for sure.

Excellent year for K Syrah and it’s drinking great with further aging potential. Cheers!!
Should have waited on this one. A bit young, and almost bubbly. Blackberries, green cocoa, spice, slightly bitter finish. Medium tannins and body.
This syrah is drinking a little tight and young but will develop into a great wine, just needs time. Black fruit, strong minerality.
Nice Washington State syrah. Moderate body and tannins. Nice finish.
Red plum, black cherry, cigar and chicory. Mellows out after awhile. Nice!
Fruity, earthy, vanilla note
blackberry pepper vanilla oak leather

3.7@Home. My 1st Syrah from Washington state of USA. Unique character vs Syrah from France, Aussie, Chilie etc. Fruity, earthy, balanced, yet constraint, which probably was from cool weather. It displayed aroma of blackberry, plum,  pepper, spices, smoke, oak, slight minerality. Medium+ tannin & acidity. Lush, dry, earthy, not jammy at all. Medium+ body. Probably still too young. Fenale lingering spices.

3.7⭐️ for this C. Smith Syrah! Still a long way to go and way to young! On the nose are aromas of black raspberries, strawberries, black pepper, herbs, wet earth, laurel, cloves and turf. The dry red has medium+ acidity and medium, velvety tannins which are still drying. On the palate are flavours of ripe plums, black raspberries, crushed pepper, flowers and juniper. A long and complex finish, but still a bit unbalanced. Cheers 🍷

This is still relatively young and took some time to open. A few years will help. Black cherry, fresh tobacco, cigar, and mild dried herbs. Medium plus tannin that does not stick long. Medium acidity. A lot of potential.

Solid wine that opens to oak and chocolate with a dark, thick purplish robe. Strong tannins dominate the initial experience, followed by orange peel, vanilla, and plum.  We paired it with morrocan-spiced chicken. The intensity of the wine worked well with the spices but did not augment the overall experience. Would recommend.

Decanted for almost four hours, dark red in the glass and too young to show any aging.  Two thirds red fruit one third black fruit for me.  Cherry, raspberry and blackberry.  Medium alcohol, medium tannins, medium acidity and well balanced.  Mid length finish and on a night with a lot of great wines this one came in 5th.

Soft lasting fruit with lasting tannins. Dark Cherry and plum without the acidity. Soft finish. 
Have loved this producer from my first taste and still do!
Ruby in color. Cherry, a little raspberry and oak. Mellow tannins with a long finish. An excellent wine!
Wonderful. Leather, tobacco leaves, licorice, violet and spices in a silky wine with a prolonged mouthful finish.
Completely exceeded expectations. Was my first 2010 Brunello so I am really excited about what this vintage has to offer. Full, plush fruit and body, and soft tannic structure.
Decant this for sure. But I give this amazing wine a few more years to age. It was a beautiful glass.

Bouquet of Raspberries and vanilla. Palate full of raspberries and cherry with a beautiful acidity. A long mineral aftertaste with licorice and hints of orange zest. Mid bodied, bright acidity and soft round tannins. Ready to drink now, well balanced. But it could hold for a couple more years

Good, fruity nose, a bit shy though. Good dark colour with long legs, the palate is full and rounded with ripe fruit and blackberry noted. Strong lasting flavour. We had it in Barga with underdone steak done over the coals. Recommended!
Really nice BDM, great structure and flavour.  Nice dark fruit flavours, cigar box, cedar, and vanilla.  Tannins are nice, good grip but not overly aggressive. Long long finish, great wine.

Nice smooth and very pleasant brunello. Dark fruit, bit tobacco, vanilla. Medium bodied.Its what i suspected of a brunello

Nice drink!

One of the better 2012 Brunello’s I have drunk but definitely some bottle variation.  Most of the case was a medium bodied very drinkable Brunello after an hour or more of air, not typical of the vintage.
The last bottle was however more syrupy with high alcohol tones and more typical of the hot vintage. Maybe we got lucky with most of the case…..

This wine was interesting and I’m sure that it will get better with age. This wine still packs the cranberry and raspberry notes with hint of oak and honeysuckle. This wine was #5 in the lineup against 7 Brunello’s this evening.

Garnet red with nose of riped cherry, plum, floral, chocolate and leather. Not much breathing, but the tannins were silky. Quite balanced between the fruity/nutty favour & acidity. Long finish. 

Enjoyed with roasted chicken in black truffle sauce.
Rich, dark fruit with a long finish.
Dark fruit, porcini, red stone, tea bark, oak, bit of vanilla. Nice!

Heavy alcohol taste 15% ABV but kind of harsh.
Well structured, big wine. Earthy flavors of red fruit - cherry, raspberry, notes of plum and leather.
Big, open but can keep longer for optimal potential. Lovely ripe plums and black fruits, rounded, full bodied and long finish.
Super-ripe, almost porty, with mature tannins that grip and don’t give up. Sweet then sour. Lots of power, low on subtlety. Born for Brie!
cherry tobacco oak raspberry leather

Surprisingly delicate for a modern producer know for powerful wines.  The oak waved off quickly with a decant, and this wine ends up giving some pretty classic aromas and flavors of red fruits and leather.  Every thing is fairly muted though, and the body is more reminiscent of a Rosso.   I wouldn’t hold this for long, as the tannins and acidity are both low.  Still, everything is in balance, and this is a very pretty wine.

This bright Brunello is accented by a few sharp points of acidity that will soften with more years of bottle aging. On the nose, the wine shows layers of wild berry, bramble, white mushroom, moist earth and pressed violets. Drink 2020.
95/100 (18.5/20) Medium (+) intensity ruby. Deep and elegant aroma of cherries, dried meat, spices. Nice structure with medium acidity and velvet tannines. Great!

Ten years old but still going strong 💪 Ripe red fruit, leather, smoke, earthy, forest floor, mushrooms, tobacco, oak and vanilla. Tannins are well integrated and together with the acidity, both medium plus, makes a fine wine in good balance 🍷🇮🇹👏  think it is at its top now unless you like the tertiary notes to be the main flavor 🍷🍷

The day I met my wife, I knew I would marry her. It took me 7 years to convince her to say yes. I've never been happier after 9 years of marriage and love her even more now. I still would not share this wine with her. It's delicious.
Super good
Had at home with dinner very good a little strong

Dark red, distinct nose
Smooth, silky taste, black fruit cherry prune tobacco
Nice wine, 91-2 pts
Big expectations which did not disappoint. Lovely super Tuscan. Very cherry mellowed tannins ideally balanced. Yum,yum,yum!

While certainly an excellent Brunello, this price point is a very competitive range, and I find that San Felippo's lower and higher offerings shine a little more. A solid wine, and it's certainly a textbook example of the style (although perhaps a tad less rich).

Try many times just wanted to make sure how I felt...

I've tried it both direct out from a bottle, through Vinturi aerator, and decanted via decantor for hours... I did prefer one right out from a bottle the most.. which not happened to me so often.

It was complex, with Mocha, Toast and some red berries. It didn't show much aroma as expected, and aftertaste was shorter than anticipated.

Paired with steaks was fine, while not the best choice.

I do love Brunello, mostly better than this one in my opinion.

Very consistent brunello. Crunchy red fruits blended with more matured dark berries and herbs. Caramel, raisins and vanilla. Everything continues through the mouth. Quite friendly acidity and tannins. It will probably soften even more over the next few years. Not so much special, a real working horse, ready and pleasant pairing for today's tagliata di manzo.

Quite light in colour, like a dark Pinot. Dark cherries and intense sweet aromas with a touch of sour (light lime). On the palate, surprising robust tannins, fruit and fresh acidity almost a sour fruit finish.

4.1⭐ and a Happy Sangiovese Friday treat.  Glad to be drinking from my cellar once again.  This Brunello at a good place right now, already showing some bricking but the fruits still very fresh and vibrant.  Well integrated tannins.  Cherry, mushroom tobacco , bramble on the palate.   Reading reviews from 4 or 5 yeats ago confirm how much better is this wine.  Not sure this one will have as long of a drinking window as other 2010's.  If you have it it's very enjoyable now!

30 min decant. Nose was a little muted, with red berry and mushroom. Gorgeous rich body filled with cherries and raspberries. Balanced  I'm acidity and silky tannins mesh well with the fruit with some licorice mingled in. A good 20+ second finish.
From barrel at the estate. This should get better as the wine puts on more weight.
Excellent wine, recognisably brunello and yet a very unique style natural wine. Loved it with F @ Portfolio The Hague.
Ripe red fruit, plums, soft tannins. Has a ton of potential; but worth checking back in 5 years.

Garnet red in color.  Good on the nose with rounded taste of plums, black currants and spice. A bit light on the tannins and light on aftertaste.  However, value for money.  We matched it with a roast goose.
Good  Brunello.   Still needs more time.  Fruit will hold a while longer.  It's the dried light red fruit style
Top
Great Brunello!
Very tannic
Yes light dry fruit style

Solid BdM from the precious '10 harvest.

Deep purple color throughout with thin even legs.

Nose of pomegranate with wet earth, cocoa, and a fade of black tea.

Opening of red fruit favoring raspberries with milk chocolate, leather and spice.

Medium bodied and medium acidity with complex tannins that emerge and fade quickly.

Brunello tasting #3
Aromas of earthy minerality, sour cherry, raspberry, vegetal character, mushroom, liquorice. 
Dry, medium intens, medium acidity, medium body, medium tannins, medium finish. 
Assessment: very good wine.  Potential for aging.

Brunello 🇮🇹. Grown on eocene, clay, and calcareous soil with shale at 240-300 MASL. NE exposure. Fermented in temperature controlled stainless steel. Malolactic occurs in vats of cement, stainless steel and wood. Aged 24-28 months. Refined for 10 months in bottle. Organic. Fresh for this style. Silky tannins. Cherry, raspberry, violet, perfume, baking spice, and vanilla. 14% ABV. 15,000 bottles produced. 4.1 ⭐️✌️

3.7/5. Very subtle bouquet of wild flowers and red cherries. Rich palate, firm structure and grainy tannins balanced with acidity and hints of sweetness. Palate is un-evolving over 3 hr of drinking and short length.
Delightful brunello that represents everything Toscana. Wonderfully rounded and up there with the best as a support act.
Needed about an hour to open, after that very smooth, fruity wine. Really enjoyed this wine.
Yummy after a little breathing with a visas porterhouse
Very full but fruity. I like the after taste but the  lucere has to be better.
Damn good ..probably 4.25
Excellent wine.
Great and silky
I love it.
Nice, smooth, full bodied...
Nice brunello, needs some time though
Enjoyed it on the vineyard. You can also spend some beautiful days of holiday relaxing there ! Nice accomodation, a pool and beautiful surroundings.

Medium brownish colour. A very smooth and balanced BdM. Sweet tobacco, dark fruits, leather with some spicy. Medium finish, fine sweet tannins. 
ABV 14%
A good Brunello
Nice, it slows down, good for to chill with
Nothing special
Tasting @ Four Season.
Fruity nice taste

Another example of why I love BDM ... First taste, deep tannins and full body; heavy alcohol on the nose.  After an hour in the decanter opens up to that great aroma of port wine, leather, oak and backed with that fruit.  Drinks perfectly .. Tannic, but nice body and great finish of fruit.   Overall, for this price point (<$50), this is a steal.  I can see why the Riserva is priced where it is.  Solid producer and will look to buy more of this vintage.

Decanted for an hour. Crimson in color, with emergent bricking along the rim.
Somewhat reserved aromatics, and not overpowering of alcohol. Tart black cherries and stewed plums on the palette, with some vegetal undertones that present as a distracting sharpness on the back of the tongue. Everything is in balance, though the acidic structure and tannic backbone is still quite prominent - enough stuffing to keep this going for another decade, at least. I’ll try to wait until 2022 to have my next bottle.
Light with soft tannins.  Off-Dry.  Mild expressions of spice, vegetables, oak, truffle, and spice.  A wonderful Sangiovese.
wow. great Brunello!
Very suttle wine. Red fruit, nuts and vanilla
Nice balance & flavor. Juicy (in a dry way) & wonderful.

Aromas of ripe, dark-skinned berry, baking spice , tobacco, grilled herb and a whiff of leather unfold on this smooth, structured red. The juicy, polished palate doles out fleshy wild cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon, candied orange zest, iron and nutmeg framed in velvety tannins that impart a silky mouthfeel. It's already delicious but will continue to develop complexity over the next decade. Drink through 2027.
Disappointing Brunello. No length. Brettanomyces.
Tea dry floral pedal with quite timid fruits good structure but getting astringent in the end
raspberry tobacco red fruit leather black fruit oak mushroom
Excellent wine! Very smooth and fruity.
Aromas of dried cherries with flavors of sour cherry and some prune. 13% alcohol. Cork. Abit past prime but fun to drink up.
Delicious 😋
Lovely
Dry vine, rich and good mature
Wonderful old Brunello
Awesome
Outstanding wine. Smooth and juicy. One of the best brunello I have had
Great taste, so well balanced
Light on body.  Lacks richness. I need a wine like this every once in awhile to remind myself an expensive wine isn't necessarily a good wine.

Hammerwein,
Great taste...
I really love this wine. You do have a fruity taste in the finish with a smoothness.
Taste great with meat!
Excellent value for money.
Not bad, needed a fair bit of time to decant. Not the best Brunello but great with a big, hearty meal.
Full body
Amazing wine
Worn out. Didn't last the years. Very disappointing
Medium bodied, fruity, lots of aroma. Really nice!
Dry and delicious !
Needed more time to open, so probably an error on my part. But disappointed in this Brunello
Fruity, dry, strong body yet less aroma than expected due to cold weather.
Very fruity, slightly overriped but good, full mouth feeling and smooth tannins.
Smooth
A perfect Tuscan Rosso.
Full body, very dense with high level of tannins. Dark fruit (blueberry), meat, blood, pepper, granit, Firestone. Amazing aging potential. For Syrah lovers

2016 Cornas vintage of 100% syrah from northern Rhône, France. Biodynamic and organically farmed old vines in steep granite soil. Aged 20% new oak. Deep ruby-purple. Roasted meaty nose of charcuterie, black raspberries, blackberries, olive, dried herbs, violets, and barnyard. Dry. Medium bodied, medium to medium+ acid. Balanced oak. This is a very elegantly restrained and traditional northern Rhône syrah

After a memorable 2015 a few weeks ago, I found this 2016 very enjoyable too. Powerful yet elegant, displaying silky dark fruits, black peppercorn, roasted meat, olive, herbs, earth and noble vanilla oak. Harmonious and ready for a good rest.
dark red need more air  blueberry blackberries. Taste blackberries some minerals tannin rich need more time great species good length

Very elegant Cornas from one of the masters of the appellation Alain Vosge.
Rather showing complexity and finesse than power.
Lovely black cherry and blackberry nose infused with spice, pepper, and tobacco. Full and lush in the mouth with earthy undertones.

Scent: Very typical aromas of Syrah. Dark fruit, blackberries, plum, bay leaf, smoke and green pepper. Medium+ intensity. Enjoyable but I wished for something more original with more character I guess.

Looks: Dense purple.

Mouth: Dry. ABV is 14%. High acidity. Medium plus body. Would have liked a bit more concentration, feels a bit thin.  

100% Syrah. Hand harvested grapes. 20% de-stemmed. Natural fermentation in stainless steel tanks. Maturation for 20 months in oak barrels of which 18% were of new oak.
Tasting portion. Quite elegant for a Cornas. Plum and blackberry, sweet vanilla oak and slight black pepper. Prefer less oak and let the grapes showing more.
Impenetrably dark garnet. Aromatic nose of dark fruits and violets. Satiny palate with loads of dark fruits, garrigues, spices, quite elegant and restrained, good balance, subtle but very long finish
This offers a mix of red and black cherry paste flavors, infused with a range of bay leaf, savory, tobacco, olive and chalk notes. Shows a grippy feel through the finish, with the chalky minerality

Biodynamic winery, around 60 years old vines on granite rock. Handpicked grapes, wine has aged 20 months in mainly used oak barrels.

Dark ruby red colour with violet reflexes and thick tears. Juicy red cherries, plums, earthy tones, some raspberries and nice spicy tones, nice minerality, well integrated tannins and leaving a long, velvety finish.

A dense, well structured wine. Still a bit tannic. A cool, clean nose revealing blueberry, violet and black pepper. Medium-long. On the palate it’s flint, black olives, ripe blueberry jam, and a touch of beef jerky. Needs more time.

Cornas with great potential. Already very approachable with aromas from blackberries, blueberries, cassis, violet and quite some oak. Medium bodied with great structure, fine acidity and tannins. Pepper and fruit on the palate. Think the oak will integrate with age.

4,2. Nose of oak, raspberry and cherry. On the tongue, you notice that the wine is young yet well balanced, and that it would benefit from a few years in the cellar. High tannins and medium high acidity.
This is a delicious wine. Really tastes like a northern Rhône. Full bodied. Very good. Wii i you drink again.
Almost black. Blackberry, blueberry, violet and mint. Young, but very powerful.  Thought it was a super premium malbec.

Dense young purple robe, aromas of plum, cassis, fruity middle taste at first, then the chalky, tannic grip finish grows as it warms. Aroma turns creamy. Can drink now a little chilled but will improve for 5+ years. Perfect with Roast Duck curry from Jim Thompson’s.
Perfection. Could be in the cellar for a couple of years, but doesn’t have to.
Singapore July 2020. Gift to the Coopers for dinner party
One of the lost iconic producers of north rhone. Great structure but has 10-15 years to go

Very nicely balanced with structure, acidity and fruit. There’s a richness to the complexity that’s interesting and full where I get flavors of leather tobacco and dark berries in a balanced acid bath.

big wine
mild tannin firm
wild flavour like cherry blackberry pepper
Perfect balance of dark fruit and tannins.

nose of mushroom sea and chestnut grassy and crabby like a blues song dark green silk hankerchief flint rice lettuce leather 

leathery dry cranberry bitter white pepper 
mahogany piano in a dusty high ceiling library
Deep cherry woody taste
Easy. Light. Fruity.

Served blind. Deep ruby. Ripe black and blue fruit core, woodsmoke aromas, fleshy tannins, fresh acidity, savoury texture, lengthy finish. Its ripeness led me to New World Syrah. Somewhat surprised this was a Cornas by one of its renowned producers.

A Matter of Taste in Zurich. 97 Points, drink from 2020 until 2040. Dense purple coloured, no rim. Dense nose of black berries and chocolate, spices and cherry. Great Syrah notes and this masterpiece absorbed the significant amount of oak very well. Good minerality and well balanced and decent long finish.
Very fine: oak ageing gives leathery, cedary notes layered over blackberry crumble. Rich, velvety, soft tannin and long finish. Concentrated and powerful wine.

Deep purple and intense. Concentrated and rich. Blueberry, blackberry, cassis, pepper, thyme, violet. Well integrated and pretty smooth tannins. Good acidity. Long finish 
4,25
92p
Really deep and intense cherry and spice on the nose, with a wonderful mix of ripe tree fruit and peppercorn on the palate. Beautifully balanced full body with a long finish.

Vivino does not want to admit this is the 2015...
En primeur wine, massive concentration, massive tannins, massive wine, BUT massively good. It will only ask you to wait 10 years of patience...
blackberry earthy oak vanilla cherry black fruit blueberry plum smoke violet raspberry cassis blackcurrant minerals savory graphite cedar

The oily texture is spontanously broken by a plesant vibrant harshness like a web of black olives and violet filters the vegetation of a coniferous forest, bergamot, blackberry, herbs then those subtle hints of wild raspberry, blackberry and smoke which can be hard to pinpoint in Syrah. I like Cornas. Paired with lamb. Bon apetite!

🎯 93/100 pts 4.3 ⭐️

🇫🇷 Happy Rôhne-style Tuesday 🇫🇷

🎨 Dark blue-purple color that almost turns black.

👃🏼 A wonderfully powerful nose with a sweet palette of fresh delicious and ripe dark berries. A textbook Cornas with spices, white pepper and with clear traces of minerals and raw meat.

👄 Partly developed at the palate, this wine shows a powerful and complex body, beautifully layered and nuanced, refreshing and elegant mouthfeel. Great silky and soft tannins with a dry long finish. An excellent vintage.

Deep ruby colour. Aromas of blackberry, licorice, leather, black cherry, mineral. Palate is high acidity, full body, high alcohol, balance is good, finish is long. Lots of character, very concentrated. This is excellent with lamb and potatoes.

At Jancis Robinson Wine Tasting at 57 Pall Mall. 
Bright red coloured. Licorice, mushroom, leather on the nose. 
 leather raspberry dark fruit tobacco licorice on the palate.long finish with mushroom, licorice

4.3. Voge again stealing the scene. Deep red, emering purple in the glass. Nose is classic Voge Cornas - fleshy, meaty, spicy - blackberries and black cherries. Non-decanted, it is forcefully full-bodied, profoundly tense tannic, palpably deep, yet juicy and cool. Long, peppery and tannic finish. 

Mêlée, Copenhagen, February 2022

Blackberry, black cherry, black plum, cracked peppercorn, cedar, dry earth, leather and even some cocoa. Perfectly balanced acidity and soft but still chewy tannins. Superb. I wish I had more in the cellar.

9/20. Decanted three hours. Dark purple. Grape soda, garrique and hint of smoke on nose. Round buttery stewed plums, blackberry jam and savory bay leaf. Beautiful tannins and balanced acidity. Lots of layers and complex.

Woohoo! Toffee coffee cappuccino and black stone mineral and sponge cake vanilla kinda round nice smell and taste. A bit of blue berry... it is very elegant yet heavy at the same time...nice acid and tannin...

I drank one glass of this right after opening and it was fantastic. I vacuum sealed the bottle and the next day this wine became glorious. So smooth and just an incredible Syrah from the Northern Rhône.

Rhônevember. From 30-50yo vines this is a fine vintage for this wine but too young now.

Med ruby. Pronounced aroma intensity w. a seriousness & depth. Rich black cherry, blackberry & creamy violet. Cassis, pepper, liquorice, raspberry & earthy granitic ‘crunch’. Youthful.

Dry. Very intense w. pleasing dried floral perfume above the powerful fruit of sour cherry, black cherry & raspberry. Chewy oak spice & peppercorn. High acid, m+ alc, high structural tannins & a long finish w. power & class. Needs time.
Nose of leather and barnyard. Numbing Dark fruit. Blood. Pine needle and forest floor. Implacably balanced. Long aromatic finish. Remarkable wine. Wife loves it too.
Great wine! Typical northern Rhone styled red with complex flavours that does very well despite being young. Should be even better in a few years.
My previous bottles have been a little underwhelming but the strawberry and cherry fruit really shines through with perfectly balanced tannin. Drinking perfection!!
This is a meaty wine but still fruity on the aftertaste. It needs to open up still and could do with a few years. The potential is there for a fabulous wine!
blackberry pepper vanilla leather
Lovely. Opens up with nice vanilla flavor. Will definitely explore more Cornas
Near perfect wine

Dark cherry earth luster. Strawberry, cherry, tannin ring, tobacco leaf, low pepper smell, spring flower and mineral slate. Raspberry, cherry, light mushroom, medium body, and forest floor finish. Let it breath for the bigger fuller blackberry structure. Buying more to age.

94
fresh dark berries, blueberry, cassis, dark plum, cocoa powder, just a bit earthy, slight notes of leather and dried fruit, smoke.
fresh mouthfeel, young acidity, quite rich, juicy & refreshing.
dark small berries, blackberry, gooseberry, green & vegetal notes, black pepper, smoke, firepit.
intense finale, quite rich & heavy, some finesse & mineralic elegance, fine tannin structure.

Dreamy to nose, floral, black fruit, plum, leather, mild earthy, stem,and slate, med+acidity, full body, refined tannin (med+), finish with spice (sweet and pungent), floral all the way through.  Lovely

At Manila's Blackbird resto last night. Popped and poured. From the start you could tell it's excellent potential due to the intensity. Couldn't coax much out of the nose initially.  On the palate, black fruits, very primary. Black pepper, spice and distinct olive notes. Fresh tannins coat the mouth nicely. Excellent structure. I'd say a classic Cornas that needs lots of time. Same league as Clape or Allemand? Hmmm.

Very close to pure velvet, young and stupidly good already. You feel like this wine has been filtered and polished to such an extend you barely notice any alcohol here, despite the 14.5%. Juicy raspberries, blueberry pie, cacao, graphite, spices, vanilla, smoked game, pepper, red licorice, flowers...Dynamic, agile and graceful, almost New World in style with refinement, weightless and tons of youth. Juventud, divino tesoro.

17/20. Of course way too young, but what a great wine! Tannins still all over, but unexpectedly quite a subtle wine. Spicy, little bit of cough syrup, liquorice and black fruit. Next bottle will not openend in the next 5-10 years if I can resist the temptation to do it next week.
Dense, dark fruit. Ripe and structured. Big in the mouth, smoky, spicy. Earthy but plenty of bright acidity. Good intensity and a long finish.

Cannot get enough of these at the moment. Drinking perfectly. 

Yes strong tannins but almost an earthy finish. Strawberry clear light red. Nose of redcurrant and tabacco

Dried fruits nose. Young and dry, but tannins are even throughout palate hinting at this wines' s age worthy quality.  Unripen plum on the palate at the moment, but with due time this will unfurl itself and take flight.
Dark cherry, pepper, very rich and vibrant nose. Smooth mouth. Blackcurrant, vanilla and a quite strong finish. A perfect accompany to the deer tonight.
Ripe plum, rounded nose, quite animalistic and wild, points to a Cornas, interesting layers on the nose. Quite a big wine too, plush, meaty and expressive
Dark intense ruby colour, dark plum, herbs and oak in this tannin rich high quality Cornas from Alain Voge, new label not as pretty as the old. Buy and wait 10 years.

Nose is complex, different aromas, i got perfumed flowers, meaty tones, but also earthy granite, some fine oak and plums. Palate is pretty bold, dry, big, cassis, violet, some smoke. A great wine that needs red meat!

Really intense aromas of blackberry and blueberry, milk chocolate with some anise and licorice spices. Very aromatic and expressive! 20% new barrels used and aged for 20 months, 60 year old vines. Really great depth and length with persistent tannins. Acidity and alcohol are really well balanced. This is a great wine! Could age it for 10 years more and have incredible tertiary notes (I hope!)

Tar, leather, sweat, smoke and even some carbernet sauvgnon esque must. Subtle black fruit backing up these notes, with heavy mouthfeel, dark robe and classy acidity. Tannins are noticeable but not gripy at all.
Dark ruby color, with aromas of black fruit and forest floor. Wonderful tannins, nice acidity, and nice blackberry, tobacco, truffle notes. Will only get better for those who wait.
From mag, incredible pure nose. Voge is one the lighter side of Cornas and had this been blind, no way I would have guessed 15. So fresh and long. Really like the Voge style 👌👌
Deep purple color. Pepper and baking spices on the nose. Also dark fruit. Med+ tannin, med acid, med+ alcohol. Actually a pretty good wine. A bit too young for my taste, but has potential
A very young and great Syrah. It’s full of leather saddle, smoke, hay, tar and dark fruits in a mature tannic frame. With time it’s flattens out and the dark fruits steps up. Lovely

#67PallMall TV: SA Syrah

Big name from 🇫🇷 vs 🇿🇦 top guns
Great wine in its own right
Serious challenge but 🇿🇦 up to the task
Superbly pleasurable VV Cornas, from several plots. Structured. Earthy, minty with nice black cherry and fascinating length.
Drinking beautifully right now.  An elegant yet voluptuous wine.  It’s a full bodied wine but it’s deceptive in that you don’t feel its weight.

This marries old-school Cornas notes of dark bramble, charcoal, olive and bay leaf to more modern-styled and vivid flavors of blackberry, raspberry and boysenberry. Everything flows together seamlessly through the long, detailed finish.

Crafted from 60 year-old biodynamically farmed Syrah, Alain Vogue's Les Vieilles Vignes Cornas 2014 is expressive, yet restrained. Blueberries and blackberries wind 'round earth, black olive, and pink peppercorn. As its opens, secondary aromas emerge: clove, cinnamon bark, cardamom, lanolin, spice, violets, incense. It’s poised, with all of the power Syrah commands, but there is freshness too. It ends on a decidedly mineral note, an arc of volcanic granite, long since decomposed. 13.5% ABV | Sample
Something fresh on the nose, like a waft of pine or menthol or something, along with moist earthy woodland. Plum and warming spice and dried fruit and slightly grippy tannins. A lasting finish.
Turn it up!  Rustic masterpiece. A whack in the nose of brambles, violets, sweet smoked meat, truffle and pungent spice. Tannin - acid - length! It is a guest idyl thing!
Lovely ripe fruit, blackberries, pepper, hints of vanilla and light meat notes. This is really lovely. One of the best Syrah I've drunk and the best cornas I've ever had. 95
OMG. This paired so well with steak. Bold, dry, black fruit, pepper. Yum!

N: Salami, blackberry, old spice, Grand Marnier
P: Good length, a bit sweet, well balanced, ox blood. Blueberry jam. Terrific!
Everything you expect from a Cornas, but need some aging
Blueberry aroma with strong dark fruit finish and smoke leather finish
Pepper and spice, blackberries and plums. Would be awesome with steak. Drinkable now, the 2019 needs time to age and open. Decante before serving.
Beautiful nose on paeonia, just ripe black fruits, sweet spices. Very structured on the palate with ample freshness, a super “well behaved” wine!
Smoky, black fruit, black pepper, leather, cedar, vanilla, cocoa powder. Very intense and complex Syrah.

Inky, deep purple coloured Syrah. Massive nose of blueberries and blackberries, tar and barnyard. Dirty and deep. On the palate more tar and banyard. Very blue fruited, very typical Syrah taste. Strong acidity, heavy tannins but good promise for the future. I dont have experience with Voge but I think this will be great in 10 years! 92++ GP

Took a risk with this young Cornas but it's drinking well with almost no decant. 

Savoury notes dominate: smoke tobacco, garrigue, forest floor, ripe dark cherry and blackcurrant, floral notes. Laced with a bit of vanilla and cocoa. 

On the palate, very approachable. Fleshy body with good structure, cherry and dark plums, even fig. Tannins are well integrated. Finish a bit short. Can only improve with time.

4.0 90p. Deep and velvety nose with layers of blackcurrant, cherry stone, vanilla, lavender and underbrush. 

Surprisingly raw and young palate with dark fruit, lavender and a whiff of green stalks or herbs. Medium acidity and medium tannins. Long, slighly raw finish. 

Further ageing potential for another 5 years in order to balance the palate. 

14 % abv. 
40+ year old vines. 15-18 months on partly new barrels. 
10(+)

Northern Rhone gem !
I am a big fan of Northern Rhone wines and when I want something a bit more fruity and with less farmyard than Hermitage or Cote-Rotie, I go with Cornas. This wine is very well crafted, top of class. Dark crimson with purple color, a powerful nose of black fruit, cassis and back cherry, pepper, spices, balsamic. On the palate it is wonderful, the fruit coming first, lasting long enough to slowly reveal the spicy notes. Balanced with an eternal finish. Will age well to drink even better

Blackberry, licorice, violet, 70 year old vines, oak, stable, earthy. Stores on pieces 20-22 months, non destemmed grape bunches. Austere now with high concentration and deserve maturation of 10 years even though sympathetic now.
Just delicious. Oaky rounded red fruit. Good vanilla integration. Lovely richness and great acidity to stand up to roast beef. Just a tad behind the Jaboulet
Clearly northern rhone with robust stewed fruit white papper, maybe some stewed tomato and beef. Palate is silky and yet robust/composed. This is great stuff. 94

Deep burgundy color, very expressive nose of cranberry, nutmeg, dark cherry, and black pepper, full body with firm tannin, massive and bold, tastes of black cherry jam, black plum, dig, blueberry and raspberry, long and smooth finish, definitely needs a good 5-8 years to truly shine.

Cornas 🇫🇷

Syrah 🍇
Comes from 8-9 different parcels 
Aged for 20 months in 15% new French oak 
Pepper , raspberry , underbrush , spice

RP Matter of Taste - Napa: charcoal embers, pork belly fat, and crushed violets on the nose, with an incredibly rich, velvety black fruit palate. This struck me one of the most paradoxical wines between smell and taste at the walkthrough tasting. This had more structure and minerality than the 2011.

High acidity and medium plus/high tannins. Tannins are firm but not underripe.  More smoke and earthy than black fruit.   Some floral violet notes running through.  Would like a bit more fruit but very drinkable
Earth, grassy nose.  Black pepper.  Very well balanced with nice medium finish and great tannin content.  Excellent!
Vanilla and pepper on the nose. On the pallet, more intense pepper, powdery granularity, and grippy tannins on the back of the pallet
Inky black, red opaque. Huge complex nose. Palate is silky and there is a weightlessness to it that is remarkable for such a bi wine. This is really special Syrah and worth the hype!!! Amazing.
On the riper side but absolutely banging.
Made from old vines, this is richly flavours and finely balanced. Still has space to develop even further
A recap from earlier this month. Really good red and dark berry palate, smooth tannins, some mild spices and a pleasant, lengthy finish
Smooth, full-flavored. Buy again.
Have to admit - it's a style that I love and this is no disappointment, quite the opposite.
92/100 youthful wine with vibrant palate and juicy red and black fruits
Lovely, smooth, wonderful.
What a wine! Very balanced and fruity, lacks a but of tannin.overall very nice, extreme blackberries on the nose

Light breakfast 😁
Cornas pairing Manchego, Edam, Goat cheese and bread...mmmm😋
Black fruits, medium+ acidity, mild earthy, plum, refined tannins, long finish👌
Big cheers my friends🍷🍷
More fruit forward Northern Rhône. Still has some of the more savory flavors but those are definitely in the background. Slight pepperiness and earthiness to keep it interesting.
Solid but not my favorite vintage. You can taste the northern Rhone Syrah, almost has a hermitage characteristic but feels like it could use some age.

Medium purple, very elegant nose, medium plus intensity, with intense mushroom aromas, blackcurrant, tree bark, wet earth, and black pepper makes me  think of australian shiraz. In mouth medium plus acidity, integrated tannins, medium flavours of black berries, tobacco and spices. Medium long finish. Will develop for couple more years. Great

Not a region I have much experience with yet. Very interesting expression of the grape. Medium bodied. Ripe fruit, leather. You can taste the terroir on this one. Not a big wine but rather delicate. Paired perfectly with a slow cooked beef tenderloin. 4.2

I love this producer and as I’m away to Spain tomorrow I think I’ll be away from the french juice so a safe bet tonight! I’ve not had one from this producer this old but this feels very spritely and actually not very french. Primarily red fruit good combination of fresh and aged, lovely spice and a rich peppery finish. Dry, velvety tannin, med + acidity and finish. I think in general the VV is preferred to le chailles, never disappoints. 4+

compared to the 2013 this one showed nicely resolved tannins and acidity, well balanced, great structure, spices, olives, smooth black pepper with well integrated fruit components which were not dominating... @Studer's Weinwelt - tasting
Blackberry, black currant, leather and chalk. Elegant Syrah. Would benefit from a couple of years though. Still a bit tight. 3.7 points
Very good! Nice fruits, powerfull
Cherry and strawberry notes.  Well balanced wine.
Dry, subtle mouthfeel, smoky, raspberries, oak, blackberries, gentle tannins.
Knock out Cornas.  Probably drank a few years early but got a few hours to open.  Leather base, some firm herbs, red fruit

Still very young for my liking. Half dark colour and intense fruity smell. Taste is really good although still young but balanced: blackberry, plum, cherry, leather, earthy, oak, and vanilla. Delicious finish. Too young, but great wine.

87 points. Vintage 2015 opened in 2021.
👀The color is medium ruby.
👃The nose is offering shed, blueberries, marzipan and coffee.
👅The palate is offering blackberry, cocoa, chocolate and tobacco.
Medium tannins and medium plus acid.

Vinea wineclub average score is 7,07 out of 10 points.

Alain Voge tasting note #4

3.9. 100% syrah. Purple color. On the nose hints of gun powder, vanilla. Taste of blueberry and earthy. A quite sharp wine that needs at least 2h decanting. Medium/full body, high tannins and acidity and dry. Buy and store for 5 years and it will be amazing.

Cornas is always 100% SY! Full body w young tannin structure. Hand-harvested from 60-year-old plantation at South-East slope w 200 m elevation. Aging is 20 month in barrel where 20% new. Aromas of black plum, cassis, blueberry, black cherry, violet w licorice, cedar, white pepper, black pepper, barbecue meats, leather and game! Long finish - young but at least 20 yrs potential!

Deep ruby colour, this cornas is a close match to its bigger brother, fragrant bouquet of blackberries and blackcurrant,  complex flavours of smoke, leather,  mushroom,  and black olives, with a hint of vanilla and burning herbs, paired very well with pigeon

Notes from a previous world (last month). More complex nose with blueberries, blackberries and more savoury black pepper spice. Silky and pure fruit (raspberries and blueberries) on palate with smooth tannins, good concentration, soft mouthfeel and good length. Excellent stuff.

All signs point to this one needing a couple more years in the bottle, but what the hell do I know about mature wine? This was beautiful with Christmas dinner, and it really evolved from when I opened (1pm) through late night at the fireplace. Sumptuous nose of dark fruit, tobacco, leather. Palate is rich and complex--sous bois, bramble and cassis, pepper--with a long finish. Quite tannic but in all the right ways. Paired with a nice rib eye

Deep ruby colour, blueberry, mulberry, blackberry, pepper notes combined with some vanilla and wet forest floor (20% new oak was used). Hints of smoke and tobacco. It is still very young and a bit closed, but good depth of flavour, some grippy tannins, medium+ body. All in all a good wine, but still young and overpriced at the moment. Let it rest 3-5 years and it should be more approachable by then.

L&W Rhone Tasting. 1y6m.
C: Deep purple
N: Intense ripe blackcurrant, blueberry, plum, violet, apricot, honey, elderflower, cream, mocha, pepper, clove, exotic spices & chocolate. Complex, high clarity. Fragrant, floral & rich, charming.
P: plum, cassis, pepper -> licorice, mocha, exotic spices, violet, apricot -> blueberry, minerals & cream. Med+ length & acid, high conc & silky tannins, full bod. An alluring wine, blind would have guessed cote rotie. Slight bitter finish rn. Unique. Best 2025-2032. 90p.
An acidic slap in the face that dissipates quickly only to turn into a dark purple velvety joy that’ll make you happy Putin didn’t spark WWIII!
Blackberries on the nose, red, earthy tones. A powerfull mouth with the promise for more in five to ten years. Nice expression of the Cornas terroir.
Very very nice... bring the funk, bring the fruit, bring the smokiness/leather... loving this!!!
Very good wine. Fruits spices on the nose. Palate prpvides the same with very good integrated oak, tannins and overall structure. Juicy

Deep purple. Pronounced intensity. Black fruits, black pepper, liquorice, meat aromas. High acidity, high tannin, high alcohol 14%, intense flavor, freshly black pepper, long finish. Outstanding quality. High reputation.
100 year old vines with 100% Syrah.  Brings a purple and red color with pomegranate ground pepper nose.  Big tannins and dark cherry flavors.  Not necessarily a beef wine but game or big pasta!
Meaty and earthy with beautiful Syrah fruit. Popped and poured during a big NYE tasting. Drinking really good now but will be a great wine in 5-10 years. Decant for an hour if drinking now.
Dark color, in the nose... alcohol, leather, spices. In the mouth.... silky, butter, bacon, no tannin... let it breathe, strong personality and long finish.
Violet tobacco and hints of leather and nice acid balance strong tannings a big strong wine. Lovely
Drank very well at Indian Accent w dav and kleeger.  Some dark cherry, even...but buried beneath deep iodine and bulgur
Super earthy, reminds me of the smell of spring, dark plum, licorice, tannins are still very present. So good!

Sweet spices, rose petals, dark fruits, blueberries, peppery cherry cola and flashy plums. Not meaty or rustic, in fact very energetic on the palate. Eucalyptus, dark chocolate, supple pepperiness of Syrah with blueberry fruits of Cornas. Dark and complex with mouth coating tannins. Needs 5-10 more years of cellaring to soften the tannins.
88/100
Cherries, spice, full bodied. Interesting wine, but I don’t think it’s worth the price. I don’t think I’ll buy it again.
Delicious. Smart and reasonable pricing for each of their wines. 2015 - happy days in years to come.
Fantastic entry. Needs more time in order for the mysteries to present themselves...brooding spiced blood & black currant.

Deep garnet color, opens to ripe black cherries, ripe strawberries and black tea. Full body with savory blueberries, spicy, rich with balanced acidity smooth tastes. Velvety tannins made sure this one will have a long life. Great value for the price !

What a wine! Dry,full bodied med +acidity,medium alcohol,medium + tannins of high quality ripe and sweet,light oak markers,red fruits,strawberries,raspberries,black fruits ,black current and cherries, spices and secondary aromas,hot earth,leather .long complex finish

Amazing, such an incredible bottle of wine. Killer nose with black currant, leather, cedar and oak. Palate full of dark fruits, full body with a beautiful velvety feel and great length! I can't wait to find another bottle!!

3.9/5 ⭐️ Complex, round and drinkable with blue fruit

🍇 from: North Rhone - Cornas

🍷 Appearance: clear; deep- ruby

👃🏻Nose: clean; pronounced intensity; aromas of red fruit, blue fruit; developed

👅 Palate: dry; medium acidity; medium tannin; high alcohol (13%); full round body; pronounced flavour intensity; flavours of blue fruit, mineral, lactic?!; long finish
Great stuff. Rich flavours. Complex.
Heavy on the berry with a powerfully long finish. Drinks fabulously over many hours.
blackberry earthy oak pepper
North Rhone tasting v 2009-2010. Didnt perform amoung the best in this qualified tasting but surely high quality shiraz.  No detailed notes today.
Great rounded wine. Excellent wooden notes.
Dark ruby in colour. Berry, violet, mint, tobacco and spicy flavour. Massive but fine tannins. Liquorice in aftertaste. Very good wine.
On the nose black and red fruits and cassis. Great tannin and acidity and complex finish. A lot of fruit on the palate for an ‘09 Syrah.
A great cornas well mature, great aromas mixing berries and fresh leather, very expansive on the palate and a surprising length. Highly recommended
Big class Syrah all on it violet aromas freshness longness
Powerful yet elegant. Supple tannin, good acidity, ripe black and red fruits, earth, cedar, some oak spices, vanilla, pepper. Long.
Black olives, peppers. Really excellent wine.
I need to drink more Cornas
Excellent, vibrant and full of fruit and life
earthy pepper blackberry
Beautiful color, smooth and bold. A little vanilla and a little smoke
Are you a #shirazlover? This beauty is for you! :)
Spice, fruit, delicate nose
Nice acid.  Great weight.  Pretty.
Gamey, blood/copper nose, dark floral, leather, and earth flavors. Amazing!!
Mid dark red, nose on menthol and spice, huge palate on plums with long finish.... so beautiful Syrah from Rhône Nord 😃😃

not the greatist year, gives us a medium + wine. not to balanced, typical chalk and crushed stones Cornas attributes, good fruit up front. I love the winemaker, 2015 will be a blast for sure.... can't wait

Fillet Friday could be my new thing. Last week's steak was with ArPePe's Grumello, this week's with Voge's Vieilles Vignes Cornas.  Similar price but sadly not similar pleasure. A savoury Northern Rhone style, plum, olive, pepper, cocoa powder. Medium bodied, the lack of intensity requires (at this price) a complexity that is unfortunately absent. It doesn't work with the steak as it is oddly moderate in acidity and tannins. Ah, well. Perhaps next friday with a left bank Bordeaux, then a Napa Cabernet....

Scent: Black pepper
Flavor: Mushrooms, rich, full
V nice :)
Clear deep inky garnet. Jammy cassis, blueberries, leather, scorched earth, spices, minerality from the granitic soil. Powerful, concentrated, with a long aftertaste.

Delicious. Aroma: blueberry, pepper, oak, leather, spicy, game. Medium plus body and tannin. Beautiful acidity. Easy to pair with roast beef. Drink now or hold.
May 2021
Lots of berry and oak, the 2011 is a very nice bold wine with a soft but long lasting and beautiful finish. A new preferred wine among northern Rhônes for me.

Color is beautiful dark
Nose is black berry, forest and some oak.
Palate is full, complex, long lasting, black currant.

blackberry pepper leather earthy blueberry black fruit blackcurrant raspberry savory black olive
