Dark fruit, leather, smoke, wood, and some baking spice make up a rich and powerful bouquet. On the palate, rich dark fruit with leather, tobacco, and a bit of greenery. Fresh acidity and grippy tannins that could certainly handle a few more years of age. Lingering finish. Very nice indeed.

Appearance: ruby red with crimson hues
Nose:moderate plus
Palate:firm tannins, bold wine, moderate acidity
Length:long finish
Excellent Margaux. Lot’s of dark fruits, cassis, rosemary, mint, earthy and tobacco. Medium + body, acidity and tannins. Great balance and structure. Extraordinary.
Still very fruit forward. Aroma of earth, cedar, cigar box, candied cherry and black fruits. Palate is rounded and adds black currant. Medium-long finish.
Very good yet too early to drink. Plum, blackberry, black current, chocolate, oak. Medium body, tannins well integrated and balanced, long blackberry finishing. 4.2/5
4.0 Lovely, balanced but not overly powerful at all, a lot of dark fruit like blackberries and plum, not overly strong oak and leather but it’s noticeable.
Classic Margaux. Tannins are beginning to fade and tertiary aromas are becoming more prominent, but it’s not yet at its peak, there’s still plenty of life left on this one.

On smell: floral musky on top with cheesy, crystalized notes after breathing deeper. Sought aromatic lavender notes. 
Taste: deep woody, slight vanillic, cassis fruity notes. 

Good bottle
Black fruit, forest floor and leather. Beautifully integrated and smooth, more approachable than many of the more austere grand crus, great on opening and improved with time
Ruby transparent with nice legs. Aroma of ripe cherry and black currant. The flavor was rich, smooth and balanced of black fruits with very soft tannin finish. A wine can enjoy alone over hours
What would I give for making this wine 10 years older.... graphite and blueberry nose. Hard palate due to being a baby but it’s always nice to think where it can go from here.
A good surprise. I wasn't expecting such power on a Kirwan 2012. It is for sure still far too young and preferable to wait for 2-3 more years but a good value for the price overall.
Decanted for 2 hours. Full of black currant, blueberry, pepper and licorice. Some leather and oaky notes. Still quite young but showed promise.

Incroyable! 

Started out by showing green-tinged herbs but slowly and steadily revealed layers of spices, chocolate, and vanilla.
Very nice Bordeaux!  Slight earthy note on the nose, earthy taste, very dry lingering on the roof of your mouth, but very smooth finish.  Would pair well with red meats and cheese.
4: 13% ABV Mild aromatic earthy, oaky and fragrant fruity floral  nose. Moderate tannin and acidity. Smooth palate and gentle finishing. Full bodied and needs red meat pairing

A lovely finesse and elegance. A very rich nose with black cherry, rose, leather, cloves and vanilla notes. Full body and velvety, with medium high acidity, and beautifully integrated tannins sustaining a long finish. Pair it with a roasted veal with a smooth gratin dauphinois, and you will be in Heaven. To enjoy for many more years.

The appearance of this wine is deep ruby. On the nose it is pronounced with aromas of blackberries, boysenberry, baking spices, tobacco and some earthy notes. On the palate it is dry, high in acidity, high velvety tannins, medium alcohol, medium body. The flavor intensity is pronounced with flavors of black plum, black currants and smoke. The length is medium(+).

It is a very good wine to very good but will improve with some aging!

It is just a great year and wine, worth every penny. Nice dark bordeaux red, full body. Nose of fruit, mostly blackberry and blackcurrant, plum, but also some cherry, vanilla and pepper. Taste is balanced and rich: blackcurrant, blackberry, plum, cherry (in that order of importance), earthy, ceddar/oak, leather, vanilla, and littlr bit of pepper, smoke, tobacco, licorice, and mushroom. Tannins are present but creamy. Long complex finish. Already great to drink, but will improve further.

Beautiful red, medium body, red fruits, needs a decanter a least 1 hour, this 2012 has a huge potential to improve in the next 5 years,  I am keeping a second bottle in my cellar. ...we will see ....cheers my friends! !!!

The worst you can say about the Margaux Chateau Korean 2012 vintage is that it is too young ..... Will be better as years goes .... But even now a wonderful well balanced wine with black currant and blackberries notes mixed with smoke, earthy wet forest and smoke.

Absolute delight.  Velvety, smooth, great body and structure.  Black fruits, blackcurrant, plum, cocoa, leather, and tobacco.  Drinking beautifully.  Can only get better over time.  Very strong 4.5 ⭐️

3.8pts.
Chateau Kirwan
Margaux Grand Cru Classe 2012.
68% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot, 7% Cabernet Franc, 5% Petit Verdot.
Fresh and fine grained tannins.
Pleasant acidity from berries.
Aroma from blackcurrant, wild strawberry, licorice and new leather.
Yakiniku and left bank were relatively good combinations.

Deep purple pronounced intensity of dark cherry blk plum black currant chocolate toffee cedar ink and herbal. Very complex flavors. Dry high acidity medium plus tannin full body and long length. Wonderful vintage.

Very well structured wine. Very earthy and with lots of black fruit flavours at the fore. Opened up after hour 3 and just got better and better. Still feels quite young and that there’s plenty of years left to go on it.

A second wine of Chateau Kirwan Blending of 71% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot, 7% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot. Typical Margaux, delicate and feminine with elegant bouquet of vanilla and ripe fruit. Easy to drink soft and smooth. black cherry, smoke, coffee n earthy made the medium body quite charming. Drink now or keep for couple of years. Value for money. Tasted 2019, Jan. 90/100

One of ten offerings at a Cabernet master class. A beautiful Bordeaux starting to show its age (in a good way!) but still higher tannins and some time to go. Notes of blackberry, plum, strawberry, rhubarb, bell pepper, oak, vanilla, licorice and leather.

There’s plenty of freshness here with mouthwatering acidity and mellowed, fine tannins !

Medium bodied, smooth cassis, blackberry, pepper, and prune with full mouthfeel and a graphite undertone moves to a slow fade of cassis and tannin. At first sip the wine seems simple, but further sips peel back the layers of nuanced complexity. A fine wine, though a bit over-priced.

Continuing our dinner at the Ivory Club.

Med acidity, well ibtegrated tannins. Med complexity and nice ling finish. Yum. Kirwan has improved a lot.

A very nice new world style Bordeaux. It’s from Margaux and displays those characteristics front and center. This is still a very tightly wound wine with big tannins holding the wine a bit hostage. Blackberry maybe a hint of blueberry as well. Toasted oak, maybe a little leather and some hints of floral. Sounds like I’m reciting every wine ever here but it’s really good juice. Just buy it and drink it.

‘10 vintage. 3rd growth GCC, Dark purple with an inky depth and little fade on the rim. A leathery, steely nose with hints of violets, black cherry and deep dark plum. On the palate, cassis, blackberry and sous bois. Richly lathered with present oak, cinnamon and timely sous bois. Fine tannins but just slightly astringent on the finish. Hints of tobacco, green bell pepper and leather. Sumptuous and well rounded, long finish. Mature and complex, med acidity. Extremely worth the price. 4.3
The nose was very inviting and mature, promising more than is yet to be found on the palate. To revisit in a couple of years.
Again too early but very good. Earth, leather abd plums on the nose. Quite harsh tannins
Superb Kirwan 2009. Rich, dark and at the same time elegant and feminine in style. Still very young, with plenty to give in the years to come.

Chateau Kirwan came to my attention through the great Mindovino movie interviewing Michael Broadbent who claimed Michel Rolland had turned this 3rd growth into Pomerol. Mrs Schyler soon let go of her priced advisor adding to the controversy. This is a fine example of Margaux with 93 points Wine Enthousiast. The blackcurrant is upfront on the palate followed by refined cedar, pencil lead in and elegant balance. This will allow you to taste left bank greatness without breaking the bank.
Nice bouquet but needs to keep for probably another 8yrs before it truly opens up
Deep red in colour with an intense nose of blackberry, licorice, pepper and blackcurrant .  Med + acidity on the nose with good tannic structure.  Will age well!

Deep Ruby, youthful aromas of black fruit and sweet spice. On the palate black currants, black cherry & blackberry fruit flavors with herb, vanilla, cinnamon and wafts of black pepper notes. Vivid acidity, fine grain grippy tannins, long finish ending with a black fruit and spice character. A few years in the bottle will reward. Outstanding.

More @Blind Faith fun. This sample said two things to me at the outset: definitively Old World and loads of black fruit. This ruled out many categories immediately and it was a toss-up between Bordeaux and Rhône given that the acid/ tannin structure was not reminiscent of Italy. I got distinctly meaty notes and a reasonable amount of smoke/ spice. No graphite (for me) but definitely no black pepper, hence it had to be Bordeaux. Regardless, it’s a lovely wine, really well structured and drinking superbly.

Deep purple. For me a slightly corked nose (not everyone agreed) but not on the palate, black currant, dark cherries, and some red berries together with prominent notes of stable, leather and oak spice. Medium + intensity and medium mouthfeel. Almost high acidity, medium+ tannis. Complex l. Medium+ finish with dark berries and leather. Slightly developed. Probably not the best bottle. An other bottle probably 4,25*. Reasonably priced.

2014 Kirwan was the wine that got me back into Bordeaux - 2013 is lighter, and obviously so in the vertical line up, but still violets and purple flowers over a dark fruit core. Pencil shavings and cranberry fill out inbetween.

First time I tasted the 2009 was early 2015. I gave it 4 stars. 
1/2016, 4.5 stars. Delicious!
8/2016, 5 stars!
5/18: 5 stars.
1/19: 4.5. This bottle was more closed as previous 2, even after several hours.
9/19: 4.5. Open 3h upfront. Started showing 2nd age. Opulant sexy wine, love it!

@[1|47623479|Blind Faith] season two, compete wine no.3. I called Bordeaux blend, but went super Tuscan, which seems to be what a few others though too. It was beautiful none the less!

👁 deep ruby with a touch of garnet on the rim.👃pronounced, blackberry, blackcurrant, clove, cedar, old leather, dried herbs, cinnamon, smoke, tobacco leaf.

Dry. Full body. H alcohol, acidity & tannins. 👅 pronounced, a bit savoury, but all the same notes as the nose. A long delightful finish.

Simply superb. 👍🍷

4.4🌟 Reaching Expert level for Margaux with two decades old 3rd growth!
40/31/19/10 CS/M/CF/PV, aged 20M in 40% new oak barrels. 
Bricky color, crimson core, F body.
N: Wax, parrafin&resin. Black earth, autumnal leaves, vintage leather, ink, cold tea, tobacco leaf, clove, cinnamon. Faded red skined petals, dried cranberry&cherry. Blackcurrant&plums. Crushed pencils&gravel. Citric notes shows up as well.
T: Nutmeg, clove, allspice, tobacco spice, cedar, used leather, still black tea, cold coffee...
👇👇👇

Healthy bright red, medium finished. Generally black fruit and cedar nose, with some hints of cherry and coffee. Smooth tannins, fruit forward and long finished (10-15 seconds). This vintage is a little to young, you had better put it in your cellar for a few years.

I expected much more... much more! Will see, what will be after few hour breathing... well, next day is much more better... but still lack of body... is mild... complex... but relatively short... for this price level is disappointment. Third day is again better... cherries and nice acidity in harmony. Drink it third day :-) and four stars are OK.

Surprisingly impressive is this half bottle.
Airing in Riedel Bordeaux Grand Cru glass for half hour.
Blackcurrant, fig, jam, tobacco, lavender, vanilla saffrsiffron, fennel...
Paired with hanger steak 😁🔥

@[1|47623479|Blind Faith] blind tasting. After last week's disaster with the malbecs I feared the same this week. My first reaction was Bordeaux based on similarities I detected to a CS I tasted last week, mainly the concentrated fruit and smooth vanilla. If it wasn't Bordeaux I hadn't got a clue so I stuck with my first instincts and got one right for a change. Frustratingly I was only one year out with the vintage. Very nice wine and would buy.

Blindfaith Compete #3 wine.

What a stunner! Hubby and I were remotely in the right category. We were convinced it was a Bordeaux blend / Super Tuscan territory. 

Thai beauty is simply an amazing quality for your money. Deep ruby with garnet hue. Pronounced intensity of black fruit, clove, old leather, dry herbs, smoke, cedar and tobacco. Heaven. 

Palate is quite savoury with a combo of black & red fruit, quite earthy, coffee. Dry, high acidity and tannins, high alcohol and full body! Everlasting finish.

Oh, woe, woe, woe is me 😩 This new @[1|47623479|Blind Faith] themes malarkey is messing with my mind.

I was rushing to submit before 7pm & initially thought I had a Super Tuscan bdx blend & Sangiovese in front of me so plumped for region.

Then I changed my mind and thought maybe the theme was producer & it was a Gaja ST vs old Barolo, then the tannin on this had me talking myself into saying they were both Nebbiolo from Piedmont 😖😖😖

And I had this in March! Didn’t taste like this at all. Very nice though.

#BlindFaith Compete S2W3. 

Didn’t manage to make the submission deadline but still loving the wine. 

Black fruit. Cedar. Graphite. Coffee on the palate. Just about entering its drinking window so should keep going for a long time to come.

Could still do with some maturing,  but already deep and interesting. Bordeaux blend clearly comin through, blackcurrant, vanilla, black olive, chocolate, thyme all showing harmonically. The palate is velvety, with medium body, and the nose is long and chocolatey.

92 pts  Great with many years left of course. Drank in Galway in Ireland where Kirwan were one of the 12 tribal families of the city before later making wine.

Mature and elegant, captivating more than fruit delivery. The nose is mature, complex and characterful, floral elements, not surprising of course from this great Margaux.

Nose has aged Margaux'ness, berries, red fruit, toasted expresso, mint tinges and layers of wood and wonderfulness.

======>
I decided to switch from Italy to Bordeaux tonight so I opened a magnum of Chateau Kirwan. Nice wine however far from Grand wines of Bordeaux. Powerful and earthy. Tabaco and plums. Opened up nicely.

Blind Faith #3 wine. I loved this and got it wrong 😑 but still loved it, I went super Tuscan.
Nose of blackcurrant, cedar, graphite and violet. The violet really came to the front after 30 mins in the glass.
More violet on the palate with clove, baking spice, cedar, leather and earth. Incredibly long finish. 
Those violets were amazing, I couldn’t stop swirling and sniffing it. 
A very pretty wine with great substance. Impressed.
Very earthy, black currant and a hint of Mexican vanilla on the nose. Fantastic wine, will be buying a few more for the house!
Deep red fruit flavor on the nose, not very sweet on the palate though pretty balanced between sweet and dry, overall great Margaux
Beautifully smooth. Deep Ruby and softly tannic. Red fruit and chocolate throughout. Already drinking well which I was pleasantly surprised by
Beautiful bouquet of dates and forest fruit. Delicious fig, toffee, and strawberry flavours. Smooth tannins and a long finish. Excellent.

New year with friend

Excellent Margeaux. Bold but smooth with just enough acidity to keep it lively. Wonderful finish. Bold, darknfruit, slight spice and pepper but totally smooth on the finish. We enjoyed with beef.

On the nose, flower scented soap.
On the palette, sweet cherries and fat cream.
Definitely needs air. Had it a couple of years ago and it had lost fruit since. Not a keeper, just past it’s peak.

Time for my #FridayCabernetfix. Here's a great one from Bordeaux. 

Dark ruby in color with a short brick rim.

@[1|47623479|Blind Faith] Compete. After failing to score in Argentina last week it felt good to be back on home turf. Initial instinct: 10yo Bordeaux. Deep ruby. Mineral nose, iron and graphite, cassis, rose, French oak. Fruity and generous intially, then drops away a little in the mid palate, leaves a touch of savoury austerity once the fruit fades.
Impression: Left bank structure, around 10 years, quality vintage. The perfume and slightly softer palate suggest Margaux. Brane-Cantenac 2010?
Reveal: 😀
Great wine. Needs more maturity. Nice balance

Deep ruby color. 13.5% alcohol.
Fragrant as soon as you put it in the glass.
Aromas of violet, tobacco, and ferns. Very soft tannins. A graceful wine.
Tasted at the Chateau. The Grand Cru offering. Was wonderful but could use another 10 years of aging. Keep for my 60th birthday. 2026. Purchased for $76.

2015  Lazy legs. Rust rim. Deep Purple. Black Cherry, damp stone and sweet wet oak. Rich blackberry liquor. Firm and finesse. Medium body. Softly coats the palate.
Starting to really brick in terms of colour. Really starting to develop now...earthy and chocolate tones emerging. Lovely.
Great Margaux Grand Cru Classe, 2009, much more expensive today, fantastic w a good steak, i love tannins
Perfect example of a great wine from Margaux. Silky tannins and very well rounded.   Paired well with wild rice and filet.
leather oak blackcurrant blackberry tobacco black fruit plum earthy cedar licorice pepper. Well that explain it well.

Excellent, elegant Margaux. It opens up showing that typical fragrance from Margaux...something floral, divine... And then some elegant red and dark fruits, ashes, dark chocolate, subtle spices. Medium bodied. Very round palate although the firm and polished tannins. Long and dry finish.
Perfect Third Growth “Grand Cru Classé in 1855” of Médoc, Bordeaux, France.

Beautifully well balanced.
Ruby red appearance- sangre! 
Wonderful nose of perfumed wood.
Taste of beautiful balance summer berries, very light, no tannins,
Little over sweetness. Smooth like red water.

Very rich, toasty nose, black fruits with a whiff of cedar and liquorice. Rich and super-ripe, very concentrated and slightly extracted, with robust tannins.It’s a bit chewy and lacks some finesse and lift. It’s quite worked over, and the fruit doesn’t really come through. Moderated ...

I do like Margaux. This could probably go a few more years, but is already very approachable. Smooth tannins, leather and earthy notes to go with the oak. Blackberry, cedar and black cherry give a M+ body and a good finish. Not a worldy, but very tasty
Citrus and great leather!!!
Delightful left bank Bordeaux. Smooth tannins and mouthfeel with blackberry, cassis, vanilla, black cherry, coffee bean, spice and licorice. Paired well with veal marinated with mushrooms.
Blackcurrant leather and tobacco
Classic Bordeaux...old leather, perfectly balanced, beautiful tanins.  Excellent wine...ready now but will continue to age beautifully!
3rd Growth from Margaux. The nose is out if this world, taste is just missing a touch of depth and complexity but still very enjoyable.
Notes of Black plum and Licorice. Steely minerality aftertaste. Subtle soft fruit. Tannins higher than the others and the younger age came through.
Gorgeous Bordeaux!!! Worth the $68.   Silky elegance, subtle undertones of fruit and tobacco.   Long finish.  Must have again!!
Very good. Light, but still with great complexity. We had it with duck, but it would probably work best on its own, without food.
Plum cherry jam with chocolate lilac and other florals,complex leather vanilla and cinnamon grainy tannins and smooth structure long in the mouth
Perfume nose, violets, ripe dark fruit. Full bodied but elegant, round smooth tannins with matered Cabernet taste. Great long aftertaste
Dark ruby red. Blury rim. Licorice, cedar, black berries, cassiss, vanilla, cherries. Juicy cherries on the palates. Dry finish. Long.
I rated this two years ago I think and if anything it is better now than then. Beautifully mellow tannins. An aristocrat amongst wines.
Just what you expect: cedar, eucalyptus and violets on the  nose. Dark fruit and cassis balances the backbone of tannins and alcohol. Still youthful.
Barnyard on the nose, clear age with brick rim. A sort of burnt sensation and earthy notes. Still alive but clearly aged with a medium palate.
Prime example of Bordeaux 2005. Opulent and fruit forward, but with a heavy vail of tannin and structure that creates a great balance.
Quite a stunner! Delicate and feminine Margaux with all the classic elements - read full review at Vinofili (Instagram). Cheers!

👁clear deep garnet colour

Very good wine (expensive!). Can drink now but has further potential for ageing.

A bit closed at this point. With serious swirling some cassis and graphite reveal itself. 

Med+ fine grainy tannins, med+ acidity. Some qualities present, but this needs more time and air. A keeper. 14/15 pts
Will never disappoint. Brilliant wine all around, elegant and smooth. You can drink it now, but some moderate aging will do it only good. That is the example of perfect winemaking.

loads of dark fruit, very fruit driven, can easily be mistaken as 09. Not quite in harmony, too much acidity, dry & still massive tannins.

Really quite an average vintage I suspect. Soft dark fruit with nice oak. Easy to drink but can’t score it any higher at this price.

Ok woo I like it
Spectacular. Very aromatic. Tobacco, black fruits, underbrush, minerals. Strong tannins.
Dark ruby color. Beautiful already delicious at first smell  dark berry bouquet. Plum, vanilla, blackberry. Chocolate? Lovely

Color: Dark red, hint of blue
Scent: Cedar, green pepper
Flavor: Green pepper, pepper, hint of ’björnlim’, lots of tannines
Overall: It’s all good :D Paired with fillet steak, buttered ovenbaked potatoes, flowe sprouts and madeira sauce.
Violet in presentation. Elegantly perfumed nose. Young red fruits on the palate. Despite its age, the wine felt very young and raw. Very dry with a sharp finish.
Oh those tannins. Were it not for your overarching dominance, this would be a five star wine. Dark berries and violet compete with toasted oak in a pleasant, if slightly off balance, Margaux.
An exceptional Grand Cru from Bordeaux. I had the pleasure of visiting the estate in 2012 and bought this bottle.
Wow.  Notes of black fruit on the nose and the palate.  Oak finish.  Love this wine.  Wish we had more.

Showing very well. While 2012 was meh vintage for LB Bordeaux, Kirwan had no problems with producing a great quality Bordeaux. My wife and I have been strategically enjoying this for 10 hrs now, and it has been gracefully evolving... tons of tobacco.

Deep garnet. Aromas of black fruit (blackberries, cassis, plum), hints of red fruit (cherry), floral notes of violet, herbal notes of mint and coffee, oak, vanilla and toast. Bouquet presents notes of licorice, chocolate, and leather.

On the palate, savory notes of mushrooms and minerals. Tannins are rounded and elegant, balanced with fresh acidity. Full bodied wine. Long finish is elegant and forward, very pleasurable!

Decanted 1hr+ before drinking, definitely has legs to run for another 5 years or more.

👁 Deep clear ruby 
👃 black cherry 🍒, black currant, plum, smoke 💨 earth 🌎 and cedar. 
👅 Vibrant characteristic Kirwan black and red cherries 🍒   cassis, lingonberry, bitter chocolate 🍫, white pepper and mint. Full bodied, dry with fine mouth coating tannins, medium plus acidity and complexity, long finish. 68% CS/20% M/ 7% CF/ 5%PV, aged 18mos in 40% NFO. Decanted with V-spin🌀 but delicious beforehand too! 
Happy Bordeaux Easter 🐣 Sunday! 🍷🥰🇫🇷

Blackberry, leather, vanilla, plum, bramble berry, rose, cassis. Heavy tannins but nicely balanced and drinking well even now (will likely improve with age). This is a nice wine and far preferable (to me) than similarly priced Napa Cab/Bordeaux-style blends.

Kirwan is one of the greatest (and in my opinion most underrated) chateaus of Bordeaux. Young wine, but still lots of leather aroma. Also hints of blackberries and tobacco. Lots of power on the palate, with a fine balance of blackberries and mature  /earthy tones. The finish is full of powerful tannins but in a balanced way. This wine is great and ready for drinking, but its potential will transform to even more greatness with a few more years in the cellar.

Wow, excellent margaux. Overall notes of plum and black cherry, elegant body, long finish. Sure to please for a special dinner or date night, or just to unwind after a long week. Was hoping for more on bigger flavor, but cant deny on how good this bottle is still. Worth its price.

Margaux GC,  mild nose but mineral inital palate lands a punch, red currant, blackberry, cocoa, worn leather kicks into the fight. Fresh n' fruity acidity, tannins are still too tight and compact to really appreciate everything this vintner is offering, @[1|29182960|Susan Neil], I was compelled to try after your '10 vs. '15 recent vintage review,  I do believe you are correct,  it's a young window that closes for a big sleep 😴 💤 Hopefully dreaming of bigger things to come! 4⭐ Bordécembre #31

From earlier this year:

Had at Mahoghany in OKC. My first go at real French wine not from a neighborhood market. A different pairing than my typical Napa cab. Bold as I remember, otherwise just an above average wine.

Decanted and aired for around 1 1/2 hours. A wine of wonderful elegance with aromas of pencil shavings, ripe plums, black cherries, accompanied by blackberries, vanilla, toasted oak and chocolate. Flavours of cassis, fig, plum, blackberries, with soft hints of liquorice and tobacco. Soft tannins and layered complexity. A big wine that will keep for years. Special!

No questioning the Quality here , but in my Humble Opinion at well over €100 , I have had better wine at a lot less € . Having said , perhaps the unpopular thing , I certainly enjoyed it .
Nose of Black Fruit , which I wasn’t certain of , and in the mouth , massive complexity . Leather , Oak/ Vanilla were extremely prominent , with Ripe Fruit in abundance. Remarkable, long Finish , which left you looking forward to the next mouthful . 4.2.

Dark, slightly brown rim 
Strong intensity. Black fruits, black currant. Fresh, slightly dried. Herbs and spices. Mineral. Toasty. 

Acidity high, pencil shavings! Soft but persistent Tannin, liquorice. Black fruit, toasted vanilla but more toast. Vanilla finish. Good long finish.

Moderate climate, French oak, 10+ years but cool year maybe? 

Guess: Paulliac 2013
Answer: Chateau Kirwan 2005

Can’t believe I said pencil shavings and then went for paulliac! Still chuffed with my guess though

Perhaps not the most epic vintage of Margaux and could still wait a few years, but still lovely black fruit integrated with oak, cedar, chocolate and vanilla notes. Also some prominent eucalyptus, cassis and herbaceous flavours coming from the Cab Sav

Lots of dark fruit here, fairly light and gentle, but some oak and quite grippy tannins. I suppose the element that makes it Grand Cru Classé is its long finish - the dark fruits continue right through

I remember tasting this wine at the Chateau in 2013 and enjoying it then. It's only a couple years older now but even so it's has become more intense and bold. The fruit is succulent, the tannins medium to heavy and strong notes of undergrowth and spice enjoy.
I was hoping for 5 stars

Concentrated and tight eith lots of tannin to spare. In other words, extremely young but has great potential. Had it last night at the Nusr-et in Brickell Key, Miami and the SOM tried to air it but neither the Vintury or the decanter would do much to anticipate it’s looong evolution. I should say it eventually loosened up a bit of it’s tannin towards the end of dinner; about 2 hour after. Then again, maybe it was all that beef!!!

3.75/5 ⭐️ Superb long and dynamic mid range. Slightly green and herbal with green bell pepper on the nose

🍷 Appearance: clear; dark ruby with purple rind

👃🏻Nose: clean; medium+ intensity; aromas of dark fruit, floral (violet), spices (nutmeg), elegant oak (bitter chocolate, coffee), green; developing

👅 Palate: dry; medium+ acidity; medium+ tannin; medium alcohol (13.5%); full body; pronounced- flavour intensity; flavours of dark fruit (blackcurrant), mineral, oak (coffee), spices, violet; long mid & finish

Blue fruit with blackberry, blackcurrant and blueberry. Some black cherry. Typical Margaux with that sweetness to the fruit. Leather, oak, tobacco and vanilla. Some pencil shavings and Earthy tones.
Medium acidity, ripe tannins. 
Long.
91-92

Strong, persistent floral aromas with a massive bouquet of black fruits, cassis, lavender, vanilla and chocolate. On the palate it’s much more subdue than I expected when compared to the muscular, opulent aromas, all the floral unfortunately are not present on the palate. The strong tannins are an indication this wine can be aged for several years before being on its prime. Not as expected from a Margaux wine that is softer, fleshy and floral.

I like the estate and the wine: this 2010 vintage has nice plum and prune characters, good acidity and ripe tannins. It can surely improve further over time and I look forward to tasting it again later!

@ O'Briens Wine Fair:
Walloping and highly concentrated Bordeaux from the Margaux AOC in the Haut Médoc. Still very ripe and young, i can only imagine how it would smell and taste like in 10 years time. Quite dry and intense, tongue in a ant hill tannins-wise. Dark fruit heavy and quite smokey. This thing is still developing and it's already spreading the hurt.

Great, well balanced left bank Bordeaux. Has an elegant but also complex and somewhat special taste with nice structure and finish. Still very young and should be kept for some time to develop. Has potential and would probably get 5 stars in some years.

Deep ruby color. Med+ intensity aromas of green bell pepper, red cherry, red currant, red plum, white pepper, vanilla, clove, smoke, toast, black plum, and menthol. Dry. Med+ acid. High tannin. High alcohol. Med+ body. Med+ finish. This is a great wine and I am for sure drinking it young. Would benefit from bottle ageing to be a bit better integrated. Delicious, but definitely give it some air before you drink it!

Ruby colour, nose that hits the senses immediately. Requires a bit of decantering before the palate opens up. Hints of black fruit cones across
The sweet taste hits you immediately, and lingers on with mid tannins. Some may call it bold, though I thought it was as smooth as it was bold. Good with the hard cheese for dessert
This was very nice with salmon

I rarely do “shop to mouth” since I started to collect wine several years ago, but I did it for this wine, because this 2010 vintage wine is ready.  Purple/dark red color, smells some alcohol, and the fruity smell is still very fresh like a young wine, does not have much the secondary smells like tart and etc.  There is some bitterness ending, sipping makes it better.

28092022 - mid week dinner with my sommelier friend, Danny 😇:
Bro LY’s second bottle of the night opened up with perfume nose of leather, tobacco & mild forest floor. Black fruits predominantly with blackberries & blueberries. Thanks for my first Kirwan & it’s a 2010 😇

Appearance: intense ruby
Nose: raspberry, strawberry, oak, vanilla, leather, smoke, intense
Palate: dry, high acidity. Medium tannin, medium alcohol, medium body, medium intensity. Long lasting. Mint, oak, vanilla, raspberry, strawberry, plum, leather, smoke. Complex 
Very good

2012 - tasted at Chateau. beautiful perfumed and floral nose. A wrapping of eucalyptus and spearmint. A soft entry into a full bodied juicy core. The tannins are still untamed but there purity of fruit and acid to see this will be delightfully in years to come.
B (needs lots of time in the cellar. Has potential. Fruit is there.)
1995 was a great year in Medoc and this wine is the proof. White pepper typical for Margaux, black currant, dark cherries. Smooth tannin, extraordinary balance.

Very good wine.
Pronounced nose and taste aromas and flavors.
Blackcurrant, blueberry, cherry, violet aromas and flavors.
High tannins and acidity. 
Long finish.
Still young but with a little air it was very nice dark ruby colour and lovely nose of violets and earth and nice dark red fruits and nice stewed fruits excellent
Wonderful intense tertiary notes on the nose. Earthy, pencil shavings, blackcurrant. Silky smooth (tannins barely noticeable). Long finish. A real treat.
A big deep coloured Margaux. Brilliant with the steak. Typical Bordeaux flavours but a subtle earthy and smokiness. So smooth. The Roger Federer of reds. 🐺 score 9/10.

3rd growth, dark ruby color, quite complex 
Nose: black fruit, jam, vanilla, clove, leather. 
Palate: intense full body, high tannins, off dry, acidic, long finish.
Leather, baker's chocolate on the nose with subtler floral notes. Medium acidity, silky tannins. Amazing. Our first grand cru Medoc and definitely not our last.
This wine was always very austere and tannic,but a forgotten bottle is at 18years of age,very nice to drink.Very plummy,Some leather and the fruit is still there.

An early try with this 2015, but worth it! While still undeveleped and more purple than red in the color, it has a powerful nose, and already very well structured and remarkably smooth body. Can’t wait to see this beauty develop further.

Present from a client, this was just wow. Not very used to drinking this tasty french wines. Dark, ruby, fruity... deep and long taste... too bad it’s in this price range, I would have gotten some more 😅

Legendary Château, Grand Cru and exceptional year. All this together means unforgettable taste. Opens up with loads of dark cherry and plum, after an hour the pallet is enriched with  blackcurrant leather blackberry.
Can wait another 10-20 years to fully open up.

3rd wine from the château.
A deep ruby
N intensity medium red cherry blackcurrant black cherry blackberry bramble vanilla clove nutmeg white pepper medicinal . Youthful
P dry acidity high tannin high alcohol medium body medium(+) intensity pronounced. Finish long
Quality outstanding
Readiness. Can drink now. Potential for further ageing

This one will keep getting better for quite some time. Right now we found among many other things some interesting floral notes (violet), most likely from the cab franc, in there. Still fairly rough tannins. Got a few other vintages shipped for future tasting :-)

Spice and tobacco on the nose. Cascading Dark cherry, Prune, raspberry, and vanilla flavors. tense beginning with a softer release.   Raspberry and cedar tobacco ending-  Very long finish!
Excellent!! 4,5 start
1 hr later,  minerals, prune and Cherry. Raspberry cherry ending Very smooth now.  Better and better. 4.7 ending.
2 hrs.  Mineral and prune nose.  Cherry,  Mineral & prune, and blackberry ending. Much shorter ending.

Great label, I’ve tasted and enjoy the 2016 vintage, but this 2015 confirms once again that is a great vintage.
I’ve taste it in a restaurant nest to a Wagyu stake and it was just perfect, and I take another bottle to go, to keep it in the cellar, to se future evolution, because until now is just great and I fell for more.
Dark red color, deep, with a lovely fruity nose combined with earthy notes, wood, forest.
Well balanced in taste, same dark fruits, leather and chocolate appears.
Firm tannins and long finish.

Soft nose with cherry and leather. Medium tannins. Medium-high acidity. Medium-full body. Violet, black cherry, licorice, blackberry, leather. Swirls of flavor flurry on the tongue that leads to a long finish. 4.4⭐️ complex and beautiful.

Purple hue. Stinky feet at first but dialed down to a blackberries, boysenberries and some oak. Dry, full bodied high but quality acidity high tannins. Quality wine. Great balance. Blackberries, blueberries, tobacco, cedar plank and some hints of tar. Very nice  and well made

93/100 Dark ruby/garnet red colour with purple hues fading at the rim. A sumptuous nose of black cherry, black plum, raspberry, and mulberry aromas with nuances of tilled soil, tobacco leaf and allspice after a aeration swirl or two. Opulent, lush, fine cherry and red berry flavours on the palate with a pinch of black pepper on the aftertaste. Medium to full bodied, dry, well integrated tannins, finessed long finish with a hint of minerality.

Opened for breath around 30-45mins. Very smooth and nice aroma. Some hint of white flower. Mild tobacco, leather and nice french vanilla, not too punching. Nice tannin and long finish. Went well with beef plate.

🇫🇷

🍇 50% CS, 35% Merlot, 10% CF, 5% PV

18 months in French oak

👁 Dark garnet color

👃 m+, beautiful red & black fruit, pencil, earth, spices, a hint of tobacco & floral notes 👌

👅 dry, pure, blackcurrants, blueberries, even a hint of raspberry, then vanilla, pepper, toasted spices, forest floor, a hint of tobacco 🎆✨

Medium body, soft, fine grained tannins, m to m+ acidity, elevated flavour intensity, long finish.

Elegant, complex & certain to age gracefully.

JS 93, WS 92

ABV 13.5%

4.3/5 🍷🙌

2007 was a vintners year and definitely one for trading up. Kirwan has still managed to deliver a smooth, rich and velvety number. The cedar and tannins are drinking perfectly. The BlackBerry and dried cranberry is intense despite the difficult growing conditions. Slightly more herbaceous and with a shorter finish than normal but otherwise a cracking example of Kirwan

Tasted the 2015 at the Chateau. This was the surprise wine of nearly four full days of drinking and tasting in Bordeaux.  The wine is fruit forward and approachable with a more modern or new world style.  Highly recommend!
Really good
Lower rating because it's still so young, Spring 2017. Unripened berries, leather, mineral and a little petrol. This will be beautiful in a few years.
Birthday wine (almost). Floral with beautiful tannins. What a lovely wine. Could easily be consumed today or saved for a great moment in a decade. I like :)
Deep fruits and a slight sweetness.  I think I should have kept it a few years longer.  Very good bouquet and like most Marguax wine - elegant indeed.
Barnyard nose and medicinal overtones but the finish was very nice. I don't drink a lot of Bordeaux but I think a little more cellar time will serve this wine well.
Wild berries, wild flowers on the nose; lush palate of blueberry and ripe plum--wonderful balance. Sneaky forest floor prior to spicy, lingering finish.

On the nose red berries. But palate reveals nice cigar box and chocolate flavours. 
Nicely developed tannins and quite a finish.
Another beauty of the same dinner. This Margaux is full of fruit. This is coming from the fantastic 2005 vintage. Blackberries, red cherries some charcoal and wood. Great wine.
Silky smooth , bold elegant soft tannis bold black fruits !!!!!
Too young in 2019. Sharp tannins, lot of acidity. Very good potencial. It needs 5 more years to get some balance.
Both liked. Delicious and creamy
High CP value
Great expression of Bordeaux. Reliable choice always.
Classic Margaux firm structure fine tannins oak vanilla long finish.Beautiful wine

Rounding out the evening before a new Spanish dessert wine.
 My dear Dad introduced me to Margaux! RIP
Very smooth with berries, very enjoyable to drink.
Absolutely outstanding wine. Was a stunner and love the age on it.
Worth another buy, for keeping it longer. Great one
Great balance full black fruit bouquet nice spice end
Saturated red fruit, hints of violet fields on summer afternoon- palate - extremely tannic and bold but smooth- red fruits, raspberry, boysenberry

91 pts. Cigarbox, vanilla, espresso and blackberries. 
Full bodied. Well balanced. Enough muscles.
At the palate a bit sweet jammy cassis notes later turns an aftertaste into vanilla.
Nose cassis, oak. In the glass tasting walnut, cassis, black currant, chokeberry, oak, cedar. Lingering red fruit. Enjoyable.
Blackberry and tobacco stand out. Very nicely integrated and caressing tannins. Delicious pairing with duck breast.
Blackberries blueberries cocoa and perfect tanines. So balanced and rich.  Wait for it.  Don’t rush.
Soft bouquet, smells like a baby’s room....in a dark fresh night.....gentle explosion in the mouth ....sautéed red onions....nice long finish.....
Deep, Rich red coloring.  Aroma of oak...  Full bodied, semi dry, Bordeaux.  Great!!
Rich less tannic aroma and faithful represent marguex characteristic. Even 2008 is not a good year but it better than I expected
2005 was generally a very strong vintage in Bordeaux, with that said it still require at least 10 more years to reach its prime but very good now as well, so no worries there! 95 pts
Fantastic and very typical for Margaux style with a lot of buttery fudge and liquorice and a bit of farm. Yummy.
To appreciate its beauty...decant it for at least 3 hours, thats when its 2nd aroma has developed and 3rd aroma developing. Be patient.
4.6 Deep garnet. Plum, blackcurrant, cedar, earthy, coffee, perfume, violet, little bit of coriander seeds. Medium body, medium+ acidity, mellowed tannin, and a long and delicate finish.
Drinking really nicely now.  Graphite and menthol notes.  Black bramble fruit.  Nicely integrated oak already but will continue to improve.
Full of Cassis and ripe red fruit !

Ruby,high acidity,high tannins,full bodied;
Red&black fruits, oak,herbs;excellent Bordeaux
Colour deep garnet red nose complex cigar box dry prunes mulberries palate elegant rich berries complex fruit bold unbelievably for this age lingering aftertaste awesome wine
sage, meat, smoke, blackberry. dry and dusty. a little thin in the end, but opening up with some aeration. 94/100
A great Margaux. Dusty earth, pencil shavings, red currants and tobacco. The tannins are very supple and fine with great lift on the finish. Just starting to hit its drinking window.

Carried to shanghai. 

Also loved it. I didn’t manage to give it time to breath so it was a little bit tannic. 

Slightly less concentrated compared to the Rauzan Gassies.
Almost 20 years on, and still possesses a beautiful rich deep colour. Discrete leather and cedar nose. Black currant and blackberry on the palate with fine tannins and a long long finish.
92. Deep ruby color with little browning. Aromas of cherry, cassis, tobacco, spices. Full bodied, medium acidity, juicy, tanins are silky. Long aftertaste. Perfect Margaux at peak.
Dark ruby colour. On the nose, delicate with Blackcurrant notes. Taste of dark red fruits and bit of pepper.
All fruit has made way for your classic cigar box, cederwood and leather. Still good acidity. Not as nice as the 82, but Kirwan shows very good consistency in the meagre 80's
very refreshing,  some eucalyptus. lots of wet leaves and barn in a medium body. long finish of liquorice, nothing over the top and the composition was great. magnificent!
Earthy tones and well balanced tannings.  Early for drinking 2016.  Most likely will develop beautifully within the next two years
Well balanced, with a good concentration. Hint of coffee, spices and vanilla. Still very young, and will develop for at least 20 years.
Complex and full bodied
Nose: vine arising out of stony soil; colr black leather velvet, dark fruit; Nice acidity surrounded by the tiniest spice. French steely resolve..Dried cranberry with cherry.
Dark red colour with bouquet of blackberry, spices & oak. Palate of sweet rounded black fruit with slight tannins & medium finishing.
Delish
Margaret!!
Super delicious 2009
Very good!

Vintage 2012, takes some time to open up and is still a little young. Typical Bordeaux Cabernet. 
Cassis and black fruits are very dominent, also some French oak notes, earthy, mushrooms, leather and tobacco can be found, light flavors of lavender and persley. Good wine

Elegant choice for Christmas evening. This '07 Kirwan is at its peak. Ripe berries, black cherry, dryied plums, sweet smoke.  Opened up shortly. Full, round tannins and a long finish. This wine has held up beautifully.
Purple red with dark garnet red edges. Nose of vanilla, liquorice, black cherry and lavender. Black fruit, spice and vanilla on the palette. Showing great potential.
Wonderful full flavor with an excellent finish.  Pairs wonderfully with cheese and hummus on the deck my wife says.
Nice, soft tannins,  very good wine, Love the texture... top!!!
3.5 Closed aroma, bay leaf, creamy black currant, dried black currant, light licorice, tobacco. Clearly far from its peak, which is clear even before tasting. Lacks depth.
High alcohol on nose after decanting for 1.5 h. Fruit forward with dried raspberry and subdued medium tannins. Deep ruby color. Long lasting  flavor but not incredibly structured or evolving
Margaux is a classic for its perfume aromas. This is a good quality example. Plush ripe blackberry fruit. Fine and well integrated tannins. Cigar box and saddle leather on the finish

Ruby color

Aromas of blackberry, blueberry, cassis, leather and chocolate 

Medium body, velvety tannins, good acidity with ripe, juicy dark fruit flavors and a decent finish.

A wine with a great potential! For now I give a 3.7 for this left bank Bordeaux red.

A medium ruby red with long legs.

On the nose medium+ intense aromas of black cherries, black currants, dark chocolate, coffee, tobaccoleaves, slightly balsamic and earthy.

The red has a medium juicy and fresh acidity. Medium tannins which are young but velvety.
It's medium bodied with 13.5% ABV.
On the palate are pronounced flavours of black cherries, prunes, blackberries, dark chocolate, coffee, tobacco and earth.
~~~>

Dry and still fruity.
A bit unintegrated after opening, much better one hour later. Still good next day, so could have benefited from some decanting.
(Dec 2021)
Earthy notes of chocolate, tobacco and toasted oak with cassis and baking spices.  Had brisket for dinner.  It was a good pairing.  I really enjoyed the wine.
Very balanced easy to drink
Ready to drink! Beautifully mellow with oak, leather and blackcurrant flavours. We drank my Father’s last bottle (admittedly, with him) and don’t regret it.

Instantly recognisable as a Left Banker. 
Is comfortably within its drinking window. 

Blackcurrant, blueberry make up a joyous fruit core, wrapped in delightful cigar box, wood spice, laurel and juniper. 
Fine tannins, smoke finish with terrific balance. 
Enjoyed it a lot. 
Thanks for sharing, Tim!

This is drinking beautifully - it's definitely not too young (unless you have very specific tastes), but will still age gracefully for another 5-7 years until it hits its absolute peak. Elegant aromas reminiscent of graphite and autumnal forest floor notes take the fore, with a delicate blackcurrant and dark fruit hiding in the background. Palate is super smooth, and easy drinking - some tannin, indicating potential to further age, but definitely well integrated now

Wauw. A good wine. I really enjoyed it. 

Nose: Dark and ripe berries of plum and cherry. Secondary notes of liquorice, earth, chocolate, iron, wet stone, dust, wet wood and oak. 

Palate: So smooth and easy to drink. So well balanced tannins and acidity. Shows great complex texture on the tongue. Nice finish with a lot of fruit and have a good longevity. 

Well done!

Wow! This wine is just winderful. We are checking my father‘s cellar and this is a real „trouvaille“! This wine shows how beautiful a wine can age. Dry dark plum, leather, tobacco. On the palate it has a beautiful sweet taste, the finish is long!

Less resolved than what I would expect of a 2005. This modern expression of Margaux opens with a rosy garnet core and heavily perfumed nose of stewed dark fruits and crushed berries with undertones of Bramble, licorice, and dried herbs and a slight whiff of glycerin. The mouth feel has the elegant smoothness of a Margaux but somehow also feels racy. It has an opulent sweetness and fruitiness in the palate held back only by the acidity of youth and some grippy tannins. Value. 4,5. Hold, this will improve.

Second time I drunk this lovely and complex Margaux. We drink this wine after a Lascombes 2000. Kirwan distinguishes itself from the Lascombes by more complexity. The color is deep red, it's full bodied with nice red berries, tones of leather and plum. The finish is long lasting. The earthy character give an extra level to this Margaux. It's really an adventure to drink this Kirwan.

Deep ruby colour wit a pale rim. Tomato leaf, red cherry, pencil shaving, strawberry, cranberry, raspberry, forest floor, vanilla, coffee. Dry, medium acidity, velvety medium(+) tannins, high alcohol, full body, pronounced intensity.

Crimson in color with a reddish pink rim. Cherry, black cherry, black currant, aromatic fruit filled nose. Hints of iron and Earth. Medium silky tannins, medium acidity. Raspberry, cherry, and black cherry body. Touch of clove, cinnamon, and smoke on the finish. 4.3 stars.

Very perfumed nose - floral and some fruits in background. Licorice and wood. Attack on the palate is satisfying-caresses the sides of tongue with elegant tannins. Medium to full body.Finish is lingering

Lovely expressive wine, drinking well even while young. Cabernet Sauvignon dominated. Medium+ nose of plum, cassis, licorice, chocolate, leather and mushroom. Medium+ acidity, medium grippy tannins, and medium body. Nice long berry-packed finish. 4.3⭐️

Cherry and blackcurrants on the nose. Still young, but already quite smooth, complex and with good struckture. A palete of dark fruits, plum, smoke, leather, minerals and oak. Long quite complex finish. Had it with baby goat, barbecued. Yammy!

Very good! We’re having it from a magnum to see how well the large format preserves and affects the wine. This is really good. Soft. Still has fruit presence. Nice petite Verdot presence bringing some earthy and forest flavors but with that beautiful dark red, dark black, and purple fruits. Plum, blackberry, blueberry, balanced oak, black currant. Beautifully delicious. Exquisite!!

Excellent colour and depth. Good rim with maturity. Dutch brick centre. Very viscous.

Bottle stink when I pulled the cork, but this vanished after a short time in the decanter. Lovely Margaux nose: elegance, finesse, milk, bilberry.

Smooth attack. Good acidity. Fullbodied. Powerful taste. Pleasant tannin in the finish. Long dynamic aftertaste.

Very good indeed.

Cork was pulled cleanly, lengthy decant, rustic, earthy nose of faint dark fruit, rosemary, eucalyptus, black olive, tar, forest floor and some pleasant funk, well balanced palate of black plum and cassis, secondary notes of toast, cedar, campfire, truffle, mushroom and leather and a whisper of black pepper, extremely rounded, soft tannins, lengthy finish of plum and black licorice. Paired well with Lamb Au Poivre, Sweet Sautéed Asparagus and Saffron Seasoned Israeli Couscous.

Waaaaa... Kirwan Planted Carmenere and added back into the mix!

Union des Grand Cru de Bordeaux (UGCB) - Chicago June 28th. Featuring the soon to be released 2019 vintage. My 6th place of 13 Margaux. (A 1855 3rd Growth classification)

Quick notes: Very black peppery, a little currant , tannins are very nice, long flavors.Varietal: 59% Cab Sauvignon, 28% Merlot, 6% Cab Franc, 6% Petit Verdot, 1% Carmenere.

Estimated 93-95 points (WE 96, JS 95)Rating these for potential peak. (Too tannic this young)

1st of the 6 in an ex-chateau pristine case. Beautiful, and more funky than the 1996 consumed 2 months ago. Drinkable right off the bottle. 9/Dec/20: 2nd bottle; even better than the 1st experience. Totally outshining the other 3rd growth in our blind theme and was the WOTN.

Wow!  This wine is amazing, with much aging potential ahead of it for a 2006.  Deep Ruby in the glass with thick legs.  Pronounced aromas of Cedar, Black Cherry, Black Currant, Vanilla,  Sweet Tobacco and Chocolate.  Same flavor profile with some Eucalyptus in the mix.  Dry and Full Bodied.  Tannins are Medium+ and silky.  Acidity is Medium+.  Alcohol is Medium+ and well integrated.  Paired unbelievably well with a Black Angus Beef Filet at the actual Chateau.  Wouldn't hesitate to drink this again.

1996 evening no. 2 - Great Bordeaux Power, no signs of weakness.  Wet wool on the nose, black cherries, spices. Palate of dark berries and wood, forrest floor and wet leafs. Long finish with lively acids

Best wine of the night! The great vintage of 2005 displayed in grandeur by Chateau Kirwan from Margeuax! Just shy of a five star rating! 

Very complex profile, really suited my palate with lots of damp barnyard notes to accompany more fees here yet developed notes of black fruit and some really ripe, fleshy cherries.

Straight up green earth, tar and meats. Tannins somewhat soft, but a clear alcohol heat. The red cherries, elderflowers and bit of white smoke shows up later. Finish was fairly long with mostly earth and forest fern

3,75. Garnet colour. Dekant 30 min. Develops nicely with air. Tertiary aromas of leather, tobacco, dried fruits and plum. Non existant tannins. Over the top for sure, but still a nice bottle of grape juice.

Aromas of cigar box, oak, leather, and smoke.  Nice dark ruby red color, with luxurious almost chewy  tannins, even 5 hours later. Flavors of plum, and blackberry jam. 
Delicious now, after 2 hour decant. Enjoyed over 5 hours.

Classic combination of 44% Cab, 32% Merlot, 14% cab franc and 10% of Petit Verdot.

Warm old smokey leather nose, with blackberry and hints of spice. Lighter and tart acidity than one would expect from an 18 year old wine. Masks a wonderful lush deep forest fruit which is subtle and still evolving in the mouth after a 30 seconds. Mildly spicy and quite dry and grippy on the tongue at the finish.

Fabulous left bank Bordeaux. Intense nose. Deep ruby colour. Blackcurrant, pencil shavings, cigar box on the nose. Still medium tannin, showing it still has ageing potential. Some stewed black fruit on the palate. Some cedar notes too. Medium acidity. Long finish. Really elegant wine still showing great acidity and tannin.

Tasted blind.  Decanted. Deep ruby with a garnet rim, med plus nose with a hint of VA. Tart red cherry, overripe black cherry, black plum, tobacco, leather, really nice cedar and spice from new French oak. Dry, with M plus acidity, M plus polished tannins and M plus alcohol (13%). Full-bodied, with pronounced flavor intensity, M plus length. Very good to outstanding, it will gain in complexity and benefit from further aging. 55% CS, 33% Merlot, 7% CF, 5% PV.

4.3 - Poured through Rabbit aerator. Very deep garnet color, with a rusty rim. Plum, prune, almond paste, cremini mushrooms and toasted coconut on the rich, aged nose. Dry, velvety palate. Full, round tannins on the longish finish. 

This has held up beautifully. Had at a dinner party with serious wine people who brought it over. It was purchased directly from the Chateau two years ago, so it’s been perfectly cellared. Best wine I’ve had with this amount of age. Very fun adding to my wine education.

Don't often have Bordeaux's with age. Interesting, tasty. Great with steak. Blackberries, dark cherries, dark plums still very much there. Leather and tobacco. Lengthy finish, still rather lively. Very good.

The night of undead wines! Cleaning in a friends cellar, testing wines that should have been drunk ages ago! This one shows that there simply just is something about Grand Cru BDX and ability to age. One of the top wines if the night!

What a year. Big, bold, violets and roses, heavy perfume on nose and palate. Black fruits, prune, chocolate, slate. So many years left in this one… 10, 20, 30 years. If you have the self discipline, stash this one away in your cellar and don't look at it for at least another decade.

This is a great QPR from Margaux. Excellent vintage. Nose is forest fruits, cedar. In the mouth, it is a velvet pleasure train with vanilla, blackberries, raspberries, and a touch of liquorice. Silky tannins. Bucket loads of time left for this wine. Yum!

I have had this red blend 2 times earlier. The 2001 and the 2006 vintage. This one is the best one yet. Light body for a Margaux elegant and nice complexity. Long finish. Not at the peak. Leave it in the cellar for another 5-10 years.
Kirwan 1998 (Jan18) is in a good shape. Leather, succulent black fruits, cedar. Fine tannins and harmonious. Enjoyable fruity finish.
Silky smooth, well balanced, dark cherry colour. Enjoyable now
Deep tannic and outstanding after decanting. AHBS bday dinner

So good. So floral   Elegant fruit. Silky smooth on palate. Gliding 
Great wine.
Nice one , good price very good taste
Excellently balanced  and complex wine
Love! Great structure, bold long finish...going to stock up and save😋
Black fruit, very dry, 13% volume, Grand Cru Classe, good Carmin color🍷🍷
Smells like Old World! Very classic and elegant!
cream cheese oak cherry enjoyed
Real deal. Very good. Buy more!
at Winery Hotel
Great Wine - fantastic year
Dark berries, violet, oak, tannins, and maybe some cherries.
Casis and plum. Drinking great now.
4++ should drink early
Floral, blackberry and yet light. A delight.

Light bright 
Light tannins
Tobacco finish
Ready to drink, great with hot pot
Excellent Margaux! Loads of Blackberry on the palette with early scents on the nose
Strawberries, wood, Light and smooth.
Cherry, iron and other metal flavours. Very good wine.
WSET Diploma, Bordeaux lecture with MW Barb Philip.
Elegant. Light fruits. Little spices.
Full bodied with intense notes of red fruit and oak.
Really good Margaux, high acidity, high tannin & long finish.
Very nice - black currant, red berry, cedar, earth, and love tannic notes on the finish.

A classic cab sauv and merlot Bordeaux blend that was unfortunately recommended for us to drink after a St. Emilion that blew the lights out and couldn’t keep up. Still good, but nothing spectacular. A bit fruit forward with notes of blueberry and blackberry, with pepper, some leather and mushrooms … so playing with some Syrah and Rhone flavors. Personally the Bordeaux style I DON’T prefer.

I should add it was still a shop recommendation so maybe we just got the wrong vintage or something …
Fruity and nice.

3.7. Lot of fruit with smoke, mild tobacco and leather nose. Bit of earth in the mouth with tart crab apple, walnut skin and tart cherry. Minimal depth and not particularly complex, but pleasant. Enough acid to maintain interest. Not a QPR star.

Left Bank 3: Margaux. 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, CF, PV. Black fruits, cherries, tobacco and on the nose with strange cork aroma (not on the palate). The wine is a little bit (too) acidic and at the moment unpolished. Unfortunately only 3.5 stars.
Exquisite. Great at 99$. Let it air first. Long finish.

Wine is clear, brightness is star bright, medium ruby, edge is pale pink, no gas, no sediment, viscosity is moderate. 
Aroma is clean, red current, black cherry, red pepper, red flower aroma.
Dry, medium body, medium + acidity, medium + tannin, medium alcohol, finish is medium.

Tannins still not fully softened and integrated yet, even after drinking this slowly as recommended by our buddy 😉 Nice nose but the blackcurrant and plum on my palate was only moderately impressive, even after having 5 different sausages at Uncle Hos SS2 Butchers Table 🐖 Great night out with BIL L and my sis in law T. Cheers 🇲🇾

Good, but nothing spectacular - especially given the price range. A bit fruit forward with notes of blueberry and blackberry, with pepper, some leather and mushrooms … so playing with some Syrah and Rhone flavors. Personally the Bordeaux style I DON’T prefer. I should add it was still a shop recommendation so maybe we just got the wrong vintage or something.

The 2012 shows a clear sign of struggle to ripeness. At this point the overwhelming sensation both on the nose and palate is that of oak barrel aging. I couldn't help but list descriptors such as vanilla, chocolate, cedar, and baking spices. Fruits are well hidden at this stage. Hopefully with a decade or so in the cellar, we may be able to appreciate the pedigree of Kirwan's great terroir. 87+

Tasted 16.08.2014
Classic Bordeaux including Earthy aromas on the nose. Velvet Soft mouthfeel and still vibrant. Long finish and a Great Aftertaste. 
Very much alive after 24 years.... 
Impresive wine.

Bordeaux catch up notes. A 3GCC, Kirwan 16 comprises 55/33/7/5 Cab Sauv/Merlot/Cab Franc/Petit Verdot & is aged 18m in 50% new oak.

Med ruby. Fragrant w. m+ aroma intensity of damson, black cherry, blackcurrant & raspberry. Floral touches & a note of pepper. Complex & concentrated w. youthful energy. Light liquorice & toasty vanillin.

Dry. Rich & smooth w. m+ fine tannins, high acid & m+ alc. Spiced black cherry, blackcurrant & elegant raspberry. Earthy liquorice, clove, anise & a well balanced m+ finish.

Grand Cru from Margaux - Parker says 91 Points and I can only confirm!
Textbook Bdx here with lots of smokey and meaty aromas pair ripe cherries and roasted origano.
Silky, well balanced and again smokey on the palate. Still firm, but well integrated tannins and a zesty-mineral acidity lead to a warm and juicy finish.
Lovely notes of sour cherries and burned earth stay for loooong.
This one does still show potential for at least another 5-10 years!
Of course it is not cheap, but go for it - safe bet!
91+ P.

15 yrs old still youthful dark red with purple at rim; a dusty nose underneath with dried herbaceous wood & still primary fruits of cassis & dark cherries noses; herbaceous entry with sweet cassis & sour cherries on mid-palate; rustic oak & woody tannins with clean cut finish; lacks of somewhat charming of Margaux but steady textured mouthfeel, quite extracted style for long run, needs another 10 yrs further btl ageing to show its hand.
Rustic but Seductive.

Little Margaux - Grand Cru! Made by Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot.
Very intense bouquet with dried plum and sour cherries that pair to deliciously spicy black pepper and sweetish sandalwood. Liquorice and smoked herbal spices pair to hints of tobacco leaves.
Good acidity and earthy minerality at the palate. Good and long finish of sandalwood, dusty stone and dried red fruits.

It's a formal event, so her tight blue dress seems a little bit out of place. But if someone can pull it off, it's her. Blue fruits: black cherry and blueberry. There's notes of cedar wood, pencil shavings and tobacco. Easy to like. The tannins are mature but still has long to go to optimum. Medium to full bodied and well balanced. One of the top third growth Marguax Grand Cru Classe.

3rd growth
Clear, medium garnet
Clean, intense black currants, black fruits, vanilla, oak
Dry, mediun acidity, smooth, soft & silky tannins, high a alcohol
Full bodied, medium+ intensity, ripe black fruit, black plum, perfume, floral, long finish
Elegant & refined. Not masculine.
Can develop further.
Very good.
So young in aspect. Still ruby red with very limited evolution. A very fruity nose with some spices, chocolate and refined coffee. Melted tannins, fruity and fresh. Long finish with a lot of finesse.

Had this again now. Even better now. Needs some air, but after 1-2 hours in the decanter it really opens up. Full of flavor, herbs and spices, dark berries, oak and a hint of leather. Very powerfull. It has nice structure and balance. More than full bodied, and it has a long nice finish. A great wine! Will only be better with time.

Tasted blind through @[1|47623479|Blind Faith]
Straight away the nose screamed cab sav – blackcurrant and pencil shavings. As graphite and cedar joined, I thought Bordeaux. Palate was similar, with a touch of meat and espresso on the finish.
Tannins were horseshoed around the gums, indicating I was in the right ballpark. I guessed for 2012 left bank Bordeaux.
Lovely - 4.2⭐
Reveal: 09 Margaux. 🥳 Close for once!

@[1|47623479|Blind Faith] wine 3 – metallic tannins, tart rhubarb and custard, tobacco leaf and pepper – tastes and looks very purple, everything here says cab franc. Chinon? Stratus? Let’s go Loire.
D’Oh!

@[1|47623479|Blind Faith] failure diary. I overrode my initial Bordeaux blend instincts to call this as a Rhône blend. Is there such thing as a restrained CdP? 🤦‍♂️ 
Oh well, I never drink this kind of thing. 
Nose of perfume and dark fruit / damson. Juicy and sweet. Odd malo / cheese note on the finish.

A dilemma: drink now or hold? We had this same wine a few years ago and I recall at the time that it was very young. So let’s open another one and see the changes. Results: improved but still needs more time. Classic Margaux flavours as bouquet. But still some residual tannins that will succumb to aging. This is a great bottle and one that is worth continuing to age.

2009 & 2010 vintages show the maximum potential available for the avid Bordeaux following.  Sensibly priced giving the consumer superior quality seen in high classified growths. A very confident must try!

Deep, rich garnet colour. Fairly complex nose of dark berries and red fruits, with hints of licorice, toast, cocoa, smoke, and a mild floral bouquet. Well-fleshed out and sumptuous on the palate, alive with fresh fruit flavours, underpinned by dark chocolate, espresso, spices and delicious raspberry notes! Vivacious and fruity mid-palate, with just a touch of sweetness. Finishes with good length and eloquent smoothness, leaving nuances of blackcurrant and cherries!

I believe Margaux is the best area in all of Bordeaux and this wine was truly unique.  Rare Bordeaux blend consisting of 57% Cabernet Sauvignon, 17% Merlot, 13% Cab Franc, & 13% Petit Verdot.  This reminded me of a super premium Priorat with plentiful notes of wild berry and wild fruits, undertones of truffle, and dark earthy tones throughout.  Full-bodied, balance, complexity, long finish, all the 5 star essentials.  Can't imagine how amazing this will be in 10 years plus.  
VIP Concierge Tasting (4 of 11)

Seemed liked a low neck, which was not the case after opening and a four hour decant. Extreme cedar and sandalwood, coffee, cassis and purple plums. Really good wine that probably needs an additional five years in the cellar to really deliver. Still the best Bordeaux this year.

Good. Typical 'fragrant' Margaux bouquet. Rather balanced and refine palate. Nice drinking now, but the presence of acid allow it to be cellared for many more years. Give it time to breath it becomes better. Good with steak

Black powder nose.  Smells like new years. Eve.  Red fruit with tannins.  Smoking hot.  As and very a smokey.  Elegant  light.  Tobacco galore delight.  92 points sexy to be honest.  Enjoying with friends.  Wow  great Irish roots

A very smooth red. Red current fruits with just a slight hint on pepper. Drinking at the Chateau as part of a wine dinner. Not as keen on its baby brother. Would suggest however that perhaps a further 5 years in bottle will bring further roundness of flavour

Loved this. WOTN out of 6 wines. 

On the nose, lots of earthy and barnyard smells - old leather, forest floor, potting soil, game, musk, mushroom, black truffle, coffee, morello cherry, tobacco smoke. 

On the palate, black plum, black cherry, wild strawberry, blackberry, blueberry, mulberry, graphite, tar 

Medium tannins, medium plus acidity, medium body. 

Super delicious and enjoyable.

Silky deep berry, tobacco, orange peel. Incredible bouquet. Definitely a standout and solid Margaux! Was even better then when I tried it years ago. Could definitely cellar for awhile and needs time to open up.

4.8 - dark ruby. Dark fruit nose on open, then leather, blueberry & fudge 3 hours later. Dark plum & chocolate palette. Balanced, silky, very smooth, med dry, mostly resolved tannins. Just an excellent Margaux. Home with Italian.

RP 92+
A big, powerful Margaux that should age for 20+ years, this inky purple-colored wine exhibits notes of spring flowers intermixed with blackberries, raspberries and cassis. Some lead pencil shavings and toasty oak are also present in this powerful yet at the same time very pure, textured, full-throttle Kirwan. It needs about 5-7 years of cellaring and will be among the longest-lived wines of the vintage. RP

Enjoying the 2nd pouch much better than the first funny how a reveal really helps. I’m still not really getting many Margaux characteristics but it’s definitely a bit less ‘napa’ than my original guess and a bit more Bordeaux. The cab on both was apparent but more so on this Kirwan. A nil points but a close nil points at least this time. Still early in the window, this will improve plenty, probably score higher in time. Still an enjoyable drop. Cheers@[1|47623479|Blind Faith]
This is a 92. Leathery but getting softer as it ages. Drinking this 2015 in 2022. Smokey after the first taste, with hints of berries and currants.
Wow! Truly a treasure. A medium to full bodied red wine with tones of blackberry, oak, vanilla and tobacco. Truly a wow-factor on the next level!
A fine wine…celebrate, enjoy, live.

Medium minus body, strawberry, tobacco, modestly astringent at least at first, exceptionally elegant, exceptional finesse, with this sort of micro effect where the strawberry fruit flavor and tannins percolate together nobly on the tongue.  This is a memorable wine,  both because of its vintage (our son’s birth year) and its remarkable characteristics.  Note please this wine is quite perishable.  Opened it 1 1/2 hours ahead of time and, for two people, did not decant.  This approach worked well.

A round taste of ripe black currant, dark fruit, fresh tobacco, leather and a touch of mild green pepper. Nicely balanced and soft tannins plus fruit. I’m glad we chose to drink it today. Perfect with our lamb and potato gratin.
Lot's of black currant, plum, purple flowers. Acidity are too high, although shows a bit elegant, but the un-balance mouthful very obvious. Vintage 2013 really weak.

Slightly superficial on the nose the Chateau Kirwan 2012 is still classic in its style, with graphite, cassis and mineral notes, intermixed with red cherry fruit. It is soft on the palate, with dried herbs and medium bodied texture and plenty of freshness on the finish. 90 points. Paolo Barbieri- Master Sommelier. Barbieri Wines

Make sure to give adequate air to this fantastic Margaux installment. Well structured, with a pleasant acidity at the finish. 

Enjoyed on day three of this year’s French wine pilgrimage through Nouvelle-Aquitaine.

Lovely blackberry and oak on the nose. Ripe and a little stewed Blackberry, dark cherry with a good amount of earthiness, wet forest, mushrooms. High acidity. Dry with medium plus tannins.  Totally in love with it.

Deep garnet color with ruby margn and long thin legs...fruity nose with a hint of pepper. Medium bold and dry, full bodied, fruit forward wine with black fruit notes and a touch of vanilla, leavened by air of clove or cinnamon that deepens as the wine breathes. Well structured with mild tannins that leave a long mellow finish. A fine specimen of Margaux and great value at $45. Rate at 4.3.

I was not sure what to open on a casual Sunday night, so decided to have a glass of this Kirwan which I had Coravin’d before. It is a great wine with lots of potential, but is in a relatively closed state at the moment. I reckon this will be grand in a few years, but it is not there yet. 

On the nose: pencil shavings, oak, tobacco, leather, blackcurrant, blackberry and forest floor. 

On the palate: lots of earthy and oaky tones. Closed. Needs time and working. Lots of layers and complexity. 

Points: 16-

Very well balanced. At first no indication of CAB, but after leaving it in the glass for a while there is the green paprika. Colour Purple. Indicate lots of merlot as for THE fruit. Can easyly be stored for another 10 years imo. Enjoyed with fillet steak, hasselback- potatoes mushrooms and Madeira sause and flower sprouts.

Very dark red with a black purple edge. Blackberry, plum, oak and cigar box on the nose. Cassis, black currant, oak and tobacco on the palate. This one is very tight and tannic at the moment so would strongly benefit of some more years horizontally or some hours in the carafe. Interesting next to the ‘75, clearly more alive and the better choice straight from the bottle. 

90

A very elegant, very well-balanced wine with lots of black cherry flavor and hints of toast and maybe even a bit of black licorice. Didn't blow my socks off with any particular element but just very good all around.
Black currant, vanilla and smoke.

Deep ruby red, complex nose with notes of black and red forest fruits, hints of blackcurrant, cranberries, raspberry and some blackberries, also notes of spice some oak and a bit of vanilla. Elegant on the palate, developing the notes discovered on the nose, presenting powerful yet silky tannins, still high on acidity and good alcohol integration. Almost full body, the finish is long remanent adding hints of plums,  dark chocolate and a bit of tobacco. Exceptional ageing potential. Great wine.

3.9. Soft and supple for Bordeaux, with ripe raspberry, black cherry, blackberry, cassis, light cigar box, nutmeg, light vanilla, juniper and fresh violets. Med- intensity with good finesse. Med/+ complexity, and a great QPR for 2014. The 2015s are expected to be fantastic. About 40% new oak aged 18-20 mos in barrel. It appears the Cab was on the lower % than normal, but I'm not completely sure. 13.5% abv.

Ruby red colour, medium to full bodied. On nose, rich fruity with blackberry, black fruit, black fruit and tobacco aromas. On palate, leather, oaky, earthy and vanilla taste. Quite light texture with low acidity and moderate tannins..

Deep garnet colour.

Nose of medium(+) intensity of primary aromas of red cherry, red plum, blackberry, violet and blackberry. Secondary aromas of vanilla and wood.

On the palate it is dry with medium(+) acidity and high tannin. Medium alcohol, medium(+) body and long finish.

The wine is very good but too young. It needs at least few more years to develop more flavours and softer tannin.

BA lounge wine #80: Kirwan can date it origins back to the early Middle Ages. It was in 1710 that a vineyard was first planted by Sir John Collingwood. Quickly establishing a fine reputation with none other than Thomas Jefferson noting he was very impressed with the wines in 1780. I love stories like this!!! 40%CS, 30%Merlot, 20% CF and 10% Petit Verdot. Ripe black currents, smokey, soft tannins.  Great with ted meat and hard cheese. \n

Burgundy purplish color, vanilla and nutty to the nose, medium full body. To the palate delicious notes of plum, black pepper, oak and again vanilla. Strong tannins when you sip it, high acidity with a delicate sweet aftertaste.
