Rich, very intensive 
Green pepper, plum, liqurice
Soft and not strong tannin. 
In general very good.

Masters of Wine 2014 Bordeaux Tasting. No detailed notes as too many wines
Punching above it’s weight
Full of berries. A little underwhelmed at the beginning but manage to open up nicely. Good structure with a velvety finish.
Best wine in the lounge. Rich, velvety with big hits of plummy dark fruit and a lengthy, cassis finish
Big wine that still has enormous elegance. Deep red fruit, a little tar and leather. Very very enjoyable
Nice smooth wine, hints of vanilla and raspberries  decent wine and medium finish. Depends on price you get From vendor

Need some time to bring out the true potential and flavour.  If you drink it too quick, this wine will be mistaken as a dry and dull one.  Overall, this wine is well structured with a good balance of body, tannin and finish.

Had it at Artisans restaurant in Houston, a French restaurant. We were hoping to get a recommendation for a great Bordeaux, preferably those in the Left Bank. Som suggested this Margaux and, while it was a nice wine, didn’t find that full bodied Bordeaux we were looking for. 
Got a St Julien Chateau Larose after this one, which built up to what we were hoping for a Bordeaux. I get that we may have had this Margaux too young still (??). 
Happy to get recommendations or comments on this and other Margaux.

VINTAGE 2013 // TASTED IN DEC 2020 : Semi translucent, reddish-mangosteen purple on the color. Hints of dried hay on the nose. Medium to high polished tannins yet minimal acidity on the palate. However, it's not quite balance and well structured. Lacking of finishing.

@[1|47623479|Blind Faith] S2W#3 A young Isole e Olena Cepparello? Nope no Sangiovese here! My lack of old world tasting experience was found wanting here. I didn't detect any graphite, only vegetal notes, high acidity and tannins suggested Tuscan. As with the handful of 2009 Margaux I have tasted, this isn't quite oven-ready and needs more bottle age to take the edge off it. Will make a fine food wine in a few years. This blind tasting lark is hard.

Great Bordeaux, needs a few mins in a decanter and then opens up brilliantly.
Velvety, smooth, light cherry and hint of Citrus at the back.
Fairly tannic, but also with some noticeable acid. Lighter-bodied than the 2015 Marquis de Terme, but also more enjoyable than it.
Much better again and a real grand cru; I did not like this wine in the last years of old mr. Schyler, but nowadays they are back on track.
Great!
14/20: dark in appearance and flavour profile, barnyard included. At only 10 sgd cheaper than the Canon, a clear pass though.
Excellent. Long lasting. Starts very fruity, blackberry and raspberry followed by some good times of tobacco and closes nice and long
Pop and pour. Medium body and concentrated on the midpallate. Earthy and chocolate at the core. Likely needed more aeration but certainly well into its drinking window.
Two excellent bottles of wine. As good as it gets. Balanced, a claret in all senses.
Surprisingly different experience vs last year this bottle is so youth with very solid structure I thought it's first growth if not super 2nd nice wine

Nose: leather, smoke
Palate: slightly tannic, dry
june 2021. thank you shien. brilliant nose, grassy...earthy, dark berries. hint of licorice. juicy, tannins present and softening. quite a yummy chaff
Tons of blackcurrant, cassis and black fruit. Oak, tobacco accompanied of great leather and earthy. Very elegant easy drinking Bordeaux. Always love Margaux!
Tastes very good to me.
Nice complex plummy blackcurranty minty flavour with medium body and certainly slightly superior to the other Pavillon Rouge de Chateau Margeaux that we had.

Nose: oak, tobacco, leather, black plum, black currant, baking spice, blackberry

Palate: baking spice, black plum, black currant, blackberry, cranberry

Delightful!

Just enjoying casually. Lots of fruit and a little bit of black pepper and anise. Some structure but it's kinda flat. Don't think it's the bottle, think it's the wine. Not the most classic Margaux, but still yummy and enjoyable. A little too jammy for me. Don't recommend.
Superb. Decanted for 3 hours. Nice acidity, plenty of tannins, lovely mouth feel and a finish that just keeps going. Tart black fruit, oak, leather, tobbaco and a hint of pepper.
Medium body with medium tannin and a medium to medium + acidity. Notes of black currant, plums, new leather and violets. A pretty open and easy drinkable glass, taken the young age in mind.

A beautiful fruity aroma, balsamic, dark cherry.  In the mouth: very concentrated and fresh, well rounded with a spicy note.  Red fruit and berries with a long finish, a little leather.  Dense, strong wine, full body, lots of fruit, extract and richness.

Classic Margaux. Black fruit profile with a beautiful black cherry note. Graphite and gravely earth on the nose, with well integrated oak notes. Tannins are silky smooth and soft, and the wine is shockingly open and inviting for a young wine. After an hour decanting this was ready to go and a killer pair with steaks.

Deep and dark colour. Fruity and restrained spiced nose, I smell cherries (Northern Rhone blackcurrants), generous levels of oak, full bodied. Would have preferred a longer finish, but mouth feel is good. Perhaps wait a couple more years to drink?

Deep Ruby, a lot of oak and blackcurrent, a scent of cigar box on the nose, in the palate, it is round and smooth, plummy, medium tanning， high acidity, tobacco leafs, last quite long, shall be more complex if giving five more years.

Good Bordeaux from Margaux. Deep ruby red in color, medium intensity aromas of black currant, black berries, cloves, cinnamon and toast. Dry, medium racy and round acidity and medium + silky tannins, medium alcohol. (2014 May)

graphite，new leather，prominent sencodary aromas derive from oak，baked capisium,black fruit black cherry and black cherry and blackcurrant
,some toasty and smoky on the palate,medium acidity,firm tannin didn't resolve into wine.medium finish,full body.

N:sweet, fragrantly ripe fruits of black cherries, cassis. Vanilla, pencil shave, general herbs (sage). 

P:M+bright acidity, M+ round and velvety tannins, M+bodied. M+flavour intensity of graphite, blackberry, smoke. M+finish of blueberry and smoke. 

This superb vintage is filled with well ripen fruits and mouth-coating tannins. The wine is easy to open up, almost ready to serve upon opening. Soothing to drink and shows great elegance which is typical of Margaux. Nothing surprising, but overall impressive

Dark blue. Blackberry, blueberry, crowberry and red fruits. Dried flowers, rose pepper, coffee and raw meat. Mighty in the mouth. Fresh fruity start. Firm well balanced tannins. Long finish with the good fruits lasting for a long time.

High QPR as this has excellent structure, terroir and crushed stones, still-prominent fruit, fresh acidity and fine tannins. One of the favorites of a Bordeaux tasting with many prestigious names and vintages.

Black currants,cinnamon/spice, tobacco, sweet vanilla and cherry notes. A beautiful wine to have with steak. Perfect balance of fruit, acidity and smooth tannins. What a treat to share with some great wine trade friends.

I get quite excited when I see wines from Margaux. So excited that I drink them instead of saving them. This was no exception. 

Nose presents shaved truffle, wild mushroom & moss, bright fruit & violet/lilac. Expressive aromas - the body not so much. M+ alcohol & high acidic content. Tannic structure is approachable - you just won't get the "oomph" in terms of depth and finish.

Tasted side-by-side with the 2005 Ch. Lascombes. Not as silky, but the tannins are slightly more pronounced. A good wine in a very good year.
Pleasant aged Bordeaux with stewed dried fruit notes- strawberries, blackberries, licorice, cedar and peppery tannins. Has good length and acidity

Violet color. Nose earthy, forest floor, licorice and tobacco. Pencil lead, spice, tannins, plum palette.

A bit earthy, dark fruit, cherry, black cherry, cassis, iron, tobacco, chocolate, long finish. Very good but there are better values out there.
Red fruit candy, ripe peppers, Juice #primeurs2014
Bordeaux Grand Crus Tasting hosted by Sotheby’s - 17 Oct. A rare opportunity to do 2015 Bordeaux horizontal tasting including 2nd - 5th growth of left bank, Right bank appellations, and sweet wines
A nicely structured bone dry wine for long lazy evenings. Medium bodied, smooth tannins, well balanced with a  blackberry, earthy and chewy palate and leather, cigar box and a light floral nose.
Supple dark fruit, lavender, spice, cassis with a well structured acid. Such a well balanced bottle of fruit, floral and spice that is absolutely lovely. Strong and leans almost robust. Loved it!
The 2002 Kirwan is bloated and clumsy. A muscular array of juicy red berries, forest floor, crunchy minerals with grippy tannins. Uncomplicated and fruit forward. Austere and short finish. (78/100)
Shows potential, very young. Probably will buy again in the future.

Been holding this baby for a while in the cellar and boy it was worth the wait. Amazingly fresh and silky with layers of complexity and solid backbone. Blackcurrants mix with cigar box and ripe cherries with a floral edge. Wow!

Smooth or light depending on your point of view.

Nice nose not over fruity.

Lovely ruby red colour.

Now I found this to be a little light compared to thier 2005. The power just isn't quite there for me. Good well made just not what I look for in a Margaux.

All that said we did enjoy it and did help me finish off the New Year Comt, phew 😇🐷

An interesting wine..🤭

Med ruby, slightly purple, with wide rim.

Dry, med+ acidity, med tannin and bit of bitterness.

Deep ruby red with some touches of orange at the rim. The nose is of very pure dark fruits - blackberry, plum, cassis, with underlying cedar, tobacco and pencil shavings. The palate is perfectly poised, lovely balance of fruit sweetness, acidity and superbly fine tannins. Rich plum and cassis fruit and a long finish.  Deliciously stylish Margaux at peak drinking now but with a good deal of time ahead of it.

Great balance of fruit and secondary aromas, eucalyptus was a little too strong for my liking but the depth, the complexity and the development of the glass is a long saga. Dark fruit, like cherries and blackcurrants, wet forest floor and earthy game finish that lingers on and on.

Perfect silky structure! Decanted for about 4 hours and nose went from strange and fungy to fantastic mature fruit. Palate was a text book example of aged, ripe Bordeaux. Mellow round smooth and subtle yet w long complex, full aftertaste. Magnum format has probably helped aging in a dignified way. Loved this one!

Took 3.5 hours to warm up after opening. Truly a quality wine with a ton of life left. Lots of oak, cigar box, eucalyptus, fresh earth, and dark fruit. Needs time. Very delicate and we'll balanced once it opened. 15 years old and assumed it was ready but was closed and shy at first. Would like to see what it would be like after another 5 years.
Getting better :-)

Dark fruits, spices, roasted coffee notes, complex and elegant like you expect from a 3ème Grand Cru classé in Margaux. Very good\n\nTasted it freshly opened, after 2 hours and after 6 hours, gradually oxygenation soften the wine and integrate all aromas together. Nice experience

What an amazing wine. 
The nose shows blackcurrant, cassis, black cherry and coffee.
Slight herbaceousness with thyme and wild herbs on the palate with black plum and blackberries. Pencil shavings  and lead pencil.
Good tannin structure

Very good- with great balance, length and intensity with a decent complexity.
👀 Deep ruby
👃🏻 Pronounced aromas of black cherry, black plum, black currant, green bell pepper, forest floor, vanilla, toast, clove and pepper
👅 Dry, medium+ acidity, medium+ tannins, full body, medium alcohol, high intensity and medium length.

The nose really appeals to me: tobacco, forest floor, cigar box, black fruit, cassis, a dash of black pepper, clove, smooth and juicy, puts me to a dreamy mood as I remember how much I enjoy aged Bordeaux! Once the bottles was  opened, the mouth appeared flat, but decanting for an hour started to wake up the wine, more spices, fruit appears. Be patient - the wait is worth it. Should have waited for longer before serving this with dinner (rustic lamb/beef meatballs with herbs, mustard etc ‘French’ style)

The surprisingly light and elegant characteristic of a nice Aged Bordeaux. Did not do as well with food as I’d have hoped. I enjoyed most pre food and after our entree. It was quite different during those two moments- rich and bright fruit in the beginning, opening up to a more mature, woody, structure by the end. For me it could have almost been a desert on its own for how much richness and things going on in the flavour which you encountered in each sip.

Given a drinking window of 1998-2010 by Wine-Searcher, it is remarkable that this 1993 vintage is still drinking reasonably well in 2022 - and also considering the 1993 Bordeaux harvest was generally poor (heavy rains in September and October). Fresh fruit and vibrancy may have faded, but there is still some dignity left here.

Had never had this producer before but really enjoyed it. The fruit on the nose was like it was a jam or was stewed but was still tart. The fruit on the palate was dark with lots of plum and had a pithy bitterness on the finish.

Medium to deep garnet with orange rims 👀

Part of a Bordeaux tasting 👌

Notes of leather, coffee, tobacco, smoked charcuterie, cigarbox, tree, tar and still some primary fruits like black berries 👃

Medium+ body with medium acidity, medium levels of tannins and a fairly long finish 🎯

Cheers! 🍷

This wine shows the power of Bordeaux. Big fruit notes (plum, blackberry) with properly integrated oak and hints of thyme and leather. Personal preference would have a little more depth, however that being said this is a lovely wine.

Very floral aroma and excellent wine.  This is as smooth of a Left Bank wine I’ve had.  Black cherry and plum balance lovely with cedar and subtle oak and vanilla.  Bright acidity makes this wine lovely now and very age-able.

Crimson with pale edge, 13% alcohol. So this was sitting in my wine fridge for two decades and I decided its day had come. A great example of Bordeaux vin garde. Floral, dried fruit and spice on the nose. Full bodied on the palate, currant and dark fruit with a backbone of spice and tobacco. Went excellently with a sirloin steak and cauliflower cheese. Drinking very well, suspect it will continue to be so for another 5-10 years.
Leather, Pretty jammy, tobacco, plum, blackberry… really good medium bodied leaning towards full

Velvety smooth tannins, delicate and excellently balanced textures of dryness, acidity and body yet with complex flavours. If I was being picky then I'd say slightly overdone on oak and cork flavours. The smell was incredible. Slightly cheesy. Other flavours of wild berries, cherry and deep floral tastes/smells. Lots going on. Matched the charred flavours of barbecued meat foods brilliantly.

Super nice Bordeaux from the acclaimed 00 vintage. Very beautiful and elegant nose with lingering tannins. Still loads of life left and nowhere near the decline. If you can find a bottle of this, buy it. You will not be disappointed. Knockout pairing would be Roquefort cheese... Had this bottle in 2017.....

P: red fruit -> minerals, earthy herbs -> blackcurrant & oak. Med+ conc & length, high acid, med bod & silky tannins. Polished & elegant, good balance, fresh cut lawn in a glass w/ fruits & minerals. Good wine. Best 2024+. 91p

An extremely subtle yet exceptional wine. A light mouth feel with short legs. But the taste is full of leather and minerals. And the nose is full of spring flowers. A fine wine that true aficionados will enjoy.

Bright and splendid wine from the famous appellation Margaux. 
The smell of fresh fruits and the fascinating almost stringy sensations while drinking. You can feel strong tannins, but the taste is very elegant and fresh. 
The taste of coffee and black spices reminds of the ground and you can also feel  liqueur notes. 
I really hope that today`s play between Brasil and Germany will be also unforgettable as this superb wine.

Great Margaux in a great vintage and perfectly aged. Nose of dried sherry, strawberry, leather, blood, cinnamon and a bit of forest ground. Not so many tertiary notes. Surprisingly still very fruity with a nice acidity and lots of red fruits, especially red currants complemented with grilled meat and black pepper. A bottle I seemed to have had for at least a decade, grand cru classified as third growth from the 1855 classification and visited by Thomas Jefferson; however, the quality returned when the property hired Michel Rolland to consult in 1991. 04 is a more restrained vintage, initial barnyard nose blowed away after opening for 10 minutes, deep garnet burgundy color, notes of cassis, boysenberry, black cherry & clove, refined tannin with balsamic acidity, medium to full body with soft mouthfeel, elegant finish.
Very Dark, leathery and intense. Feels like it has matured perfectly. Just optimal right now.

Earthy on the nose, and it was reflected on the palate. It certainly had  intensity and a length of finish, but lacked fruit, if that is your preference . The character of this House has changed since 2007,to include more vibrant characteristics.

🍇 59% Merlot, 28% Cabernet Sauvignon, 6% Cabernet Franc, 6% Petit Verdot, 1% Carmenère
Juicy, medium body, flowery, flavours of oak, cherries 🍒, black currents, boysenberries and mocha ☕️, slightly spicy and mineral notes, good integrated acidity, round tannins, med.(+) finish.

Drank it in 2018 and wow, did it handle the age! Very nicely integrated tannins and a well balanced structure. Another wine to thank our former landlords for as they gave it to us upon return to their house!

So pleasurable drinking with my dad! Living the life and don't you waste it! Kirwan 1998 is an excellent millesime. Which means only behind millesime du millenaire, du siècle and exceptionelle. All these are legendary.
Notable violet aromas, magenta color, black cherry, BlackBerry, plum, cassis, bit sweet, black pepper and flower. Old brick small village house if you will. Sustained by fine acidity. Sweet round soft velvety tannins accompanied by long aftertaste. 98+pts apogee by 2023-2027 Decant it for 3h.

4.0 - good grand cru clasee, well balance from margaux, strong to the nose and quite some perfume aroma, a bit smoky but overall good option with light tannins and great experience. Went well with French dinner

Fabulous wine that surprisingly was drinking well. I expected it to be another I wish I had waited which I will say but it did drink well. Dark fruits, cherries, maybe coffee but had good fruit and great tannins so will keep for a while. I tried the 2011 and it tasted just great.

Said it all in my August review:  Ok, we killed a young wine.   Too old to wait; too tight to pay for the aged bottle.   Still, a pleasure.  Terrific fruit concentration of red and black berries, black pepper, earth, oak, and leather.

2001 is an unrated vintage in my estimation  as this Margaux illustrates well the reasons- bright fruits and aromas of cassis, herbs and cedar. Considerable tannins still masked the full throttle fruits. Still purple in the core with garnet ring, it will stay vibrant for the next 2 decades. 91pts

Beautiful grenade color with a slight browning towards the edges. Rathe light bodied with a good fruit cincentration and a typical medoc cedar note. The sweet extract was also a treat but the wine lacked some body and the tannins were a bit too coarse to make it a real gem. maybe 5 more years will help.

Medoc 3rd Growth. I feel that I drank this bottle at the good timing. Still young and fresh, but it also reached the time to enjoy. Enchanting nose of cassis and plum is well condensed. It also has a complex note of vanilla, leather, tobacco and mint on the finish. Sleek tannins, rounded mouthfeel, beautiful acid and extended finish constitute one of the best Margeaux. I suppose this chateau does not have much of a presence in Medoc 3rd Growths, but this bottle was wonderful. Bought at Aeon de Wine.

2015 Chateau Kirwan, Margaux.
50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Merlot, 10% Caberbet Franc, 5% Petit Verdot. 18 months on oak, 50% new.
Discrete in the nose, candied cherries, plums, sweet licorice and vanilla oak.
On the palate same aromas as well as black currants, blackberries, leather, pencil and cherrystones.
Medium to medium plus body, medium acidity, dry, medium plus and tight tannins, 13,5% alcohol and a medium long, dry, fine wood aftertaste.
Needs classic food like veal with truffles today.

Lots and lots of fruits like being thrown into a basket of berries - black cherry, red cherry,  blackcurrant. The tertiary notes of leather and tobacco are showing but still very subtle. With the abundant fruits and prominent acidity, definitely a keep for another 10+ years.

Overripe plum, cigar box, pepper, spice, boysenberry, wood, dark berries and herbs.

Soft and fruity on the palate with notes of boysenberry, plum, blackberry, wood and tobacco leaves. Nice succulent core with medium body. 
Grainy tannins lightly gripping the gums.
The finish is dominated by ripe dark fruit, spices, vanilla and plum notes.
Nice wine without much fanfare.

Maybe it will get more tertiary complexity to balance out fruit forward primary in later years. Dusty tannins round out a pleasant mouthfeel.

Wow, I was mistaken.  I blind tasted this and thought this was from the Napa Valley because of the big mineral driven nose.  This was a pleasant surprise.  A rock solid bang for your buck Bordeaux blend.  Cab dominant here, pretty easy drinker.  Attractive & vibrant aromas.  Characteristics of baking spices, cedar, slate, & bing cherry.  Would certainly consume again.

Cherry, plum, vanilla and jam on the nose, and absolutely incredible flavors explode on the palate. Fruit, baking chocolate and vanilla melt away into some of the smoothest tannins. Highly recommend this affordable grand cru!

92: medium intensity and light brown colour. The core still has some depth to it. After air exposure the nose reveals a complex nose of cellar, musk, cigar box, and a delicate black cherry fruit. The structure is firm, grippy tannins and medium finish with the sensation of coffee grounds. Overall an impressive wine, kept well and still somewhat youthful.

Black fruits, sweet licourice and some floral overtones try to impress but this wine isn't one of their best. Still it's much nicer than Chateau Cardboard and it didn't cost me anything per se, so who's complaining!!!

This is in a weird place and I think it's just not well made enough. It looks cloudy but the bottle was absolutely fine. 

30 minutes drinking window. Nose of burnt sugar, capsicum. 

I would say it's past its peak, which I absolutely do not expect from a 95 vintage.

Nose: pronounced intensity
Blackcurrant, black cherry, smoke, cedar, clove, Licorice, black pepper, earth, leather,  tomato leaf, tobacco
Developing
Palate: dry, med+ acidity, med+ body, high alcohol , high tannin, pronounced intensity, med finish
Very good quality 
Drink now. Suitable for further ageing

A beautiful Margaux wine.  Excellent aroma to start the journey.  Mint, herb, leather, mushroom, but everything came very balanced.  Some biscuit and coffee came up later.  Really silky smooth tannin, yet acidity still balanced.  Very fruity with black cherry, plum, black currant, and some blueberry.  Long lasting and great finish.  Wonderful Margaux wine with its usual look.

A very solid 4, almost 4.5! I was waiting for the right occasion for this bottle and New Year's Eve with my parents was perfect for it!

Clear, medium, ruby color with light brick sides. Clean, medium intensity aromas of leather, tobacco, black cherries and forest floor. Dry, medium+ acidity, medium, silky tannins and medium body. Black fruits and oak. Medium+ finish. Very good.

This one just didn’t want to get out of the bottle. The cork ended in the wine, which is always an embarrassing moment. The first sip after decanting into the glass was not impressing, however the color is dark red and impressing looking. The early taste was rather closed and a has steep finish. After an hour in the glass the wine does actually open up but does still not give any long finish.

Typical Margaux beautiful velvety sophisticated claret. Powerful with loads of fruit and drinking perfectly. Fabulous for a special occasion or if you’ve got deep enough pockets I’d love to drink every day ! 
Stunning

4.25. Blackberry, black currant, cedar, tar, earthy mushroom, and a slight violet I always get in good Margaux. A bit shy and alcoholic at first, but smoothed out quite nicely after some time. Juicy acidity as well. Soft and delicate Bordeaux which I love.

Liquid blackberries, cedar, underbrush, truffles. Less perfume than I'd expect - presented more like a St Julien. Excellent acidity, tannins resolving but still nicely structured.  A tad backwards  but quite good.

Drank the same wines with my friend,
different places and times  🇧🇪...🇹🇭
Merry Christmas dear all 🎄🎅🏻

Bought this small bottle yesterday to celebrated Christmas with my dear friend, even we're not the same place and time, still able to enjoyed!! 😁

🍷: Medium-bodied with cherry and black fruits, balsamic, smoke, cedar, floral background with woody moderate finish. Easy drinking but not much depth and complex.

🎼: Diana Krall "Christmas Songs" album.. for the mood 😊

Merry Christmas all 🎄🍷

2000 vintage opened and drunk in 2021. Medium to dark ruby with brown edges. Unmistakable nose of left bank Bordeaux, fine oak with pencil shavings plus a touch of what I would describe as “whisky barrel”. Medium bodied with good black berry fruit flavours and and earthy dry finish. A pleasant vintage treat - my exact rating would be 3.75.

Deep cherry red. Very good fruit intensity and perfume on the nose. Quite powerful, structured tannins. Ripe cherries, fresh oak in the background. Some secondary notes starting to develop slightly. Good, but maybe still a bit young.

Had this since release, This bottle was pretty good, but others have been better. Classic Margaux nose and ‘sweetness’ still good fruit and balance, this still has time left on it. Easilly see 15+ more hears in the cellar

A stunning 2005 Margaux - though I would ever have guessed that exact commune. Quite undeveloped.

Opulent in style, rich notes of blueberry confit, leather, espresso beans, sage and tobacco. 

Smooth tannins but a solid underlying strcture. Long and intense on the aftertaste.

Kirwan's best vintage up to this point!

A bit strong for my liking, with hints of black currant, earthy, oak. Better with a bit of time in the glass, so I had to curb my impatience. Would have rated it higher but for a simultaneous taste test with a 2010 Chateau Lascomes Margaux Grand Cru Classe at slightly better price point.

Excellent wine and still a hot closed on the palate. Shows a lovely perfume, still showing some
Primary fruit - cassis and black currant, blackberry, with dark leather beginning to develop and toasted cedar/spice box/cigar box. Palate still slightly closed, could have waited longer. Med+ body, med+ tannins that could develop further, still showing a solid grip, med + acidity and a long floral finish.

3.5
My disappointment of all the wines tasted during the Union des Grands Crus de Bordeaux event held in Montréal. 
Memories of my youth sharing this Grand Cru Classé with the family are much better than the 2017. 
Full bodied, dry, with aromas of blackberry and a palate with overpowering tannins and a high acidity. 
I wish I could get some of the other vintages.

It’s fascinating how Bordeaux wines evolve through life, from tedious oaky wines  to gracefully balanced reds when old. Bright and elegant wine 🍷 (Cabernet Sauvignon & Merlot dominated blend), medium body, subtle dark fruit, forest floor, leather, liquorice. Lengthy spicy finish.
Classic Margeaux
Deep opaque colour, lovely nose of ripe fruits, still quite tannic. On the palate, quite short. Not quite as developed. Prob need a little more time.
Good palate and mid-full after taste. Still very good to pair wt foods specially heavy taste. May almost mature, not for keeping.
Me love it....at first. It tasted very dry after  an hour.
Very nice bottle and a great vineyard to visit.
Tasting v nicely now

Very mild smoother warm not that spiky sour sweet
Very delicious! Full of body, berry flavor, and just greatness!!
Smooth, velvet, dark burgundy
Great full body, we paired it with ribeye and lovely beef ribs.

Very smooth, perfect to drink now, not a lot of tannins left. Classic Bordeaux, dried fruit, long finish, dark berries (blackberries?). Had it with cheese (gruyere, primadonna and a boursin), beautiful!
Smooth, delicate, long on the nose. Alpine fruit at the finish with a hint of tobacco. Good vintage but you would not want to leave it any longer given 20 years young. Enjoyed post dinner with cheese
Oh my god, all my favorite chocolates are in this' note. Salted caramel, fudge, irony and lactic😍 it covers your tongue with a blanket of well balanced tannins and ripe dark berries. Delicious!
Extremely well balanced, dark fruity flavors with a welcoming aftertaste of cherry tobacco
This was one of the best wines I’ve ever had to date.

We’ve had this twice now at Bien Venuti in Norman. It is a lush, big wine, with heavy tannins, and an almost inky blackness in color.
Tannic dark cherries to the nose, best decanted, and opens up very lovely. Strong wild berries, medium body.
Dark and deep. Needs at least 20-30 minutes after opening. Cherry, tobacco, chocolate. Not too heavy, but fantastic with meat. Very acidic on first opening, but mellows wonderfully before pouring.

Pencil shavings. Ink and dark fruit on the nose. VERY full bodied. Covers every millimeter of your palate and gums. Just superbly balanced with a bone dry long long finish that has you licking your gums and wanting more. One of the best I’ve had in a while. Fantastic example of how wine should taste. 13% alcohol. None of the sherry style alcohol of new world wine.

This was my first Bordeaux while in mid summer Palm Springs. It is hot out, 48/118 degrees so Ive been having much more Sanserre and Rose lately and no reds. OneFriday afternoon we decided to go find something spectacular from the back room of a wonderful local wine store.

First try of this 2005 wine which I bought en primeur - well worth the wait - ruby red, black berries, vanilla, cherries. Rounding tannins, long, balanced with plenty obviously to come from this terrific wine from a recognised vintage. Opened 3 hours prior and decanted but unnecessary. Totally opened up following day!

I cannot believe this Margaux only received a 4.1 rating. It is the best left bank Bordeaux I have ever tasted in my life. Hint…you need to decant the wine for a few hours beforehand to truly experience its velvety delicious potential. Absolutely superb!!!

Great bottle to surprise dinner guests. It heightens any beef dish With black currants, plums and soft vanilla. The finish is long and with Tobacco and earthy notes. Slight oak lingers.

I suspect the latter as fruit, tannins and concentration must be somewhere, just not in the bottle!

I am hoping this was an off bottle. Had it during a blind tasting event; and no single person in the group could identified it being a wine from Margaux. It was extremely tannic with rough edges; and primary characters were vanishing. I simply thought it was a mediocre Saint-Estephe from a bad vintage. The tannin had smoothen out slightly after hours but where were the floral notes, silkiness and feminine character of Margaux?

Wow, I mean 35 years!! As I pour this wine it is even a bit "closed" still. Given some time to breath it started to show its full bouquet. Ripe dark berries and such a powerful body! But smooth as silk at the same time. I was truly impressed! Should anyone still habe a bottle of this 1985, keep it another year or two, it has even more potential!!

Fruit is fading out on the nose, replaced by more of the leather, earthy, smoky tone. A great vintage that is showing well on the palate. Tannin is very smooth after decanting, even the non-decanted one is also showing silky tannin. Acidity is still holding up with good concentration of flavors, balanced. Finish was medium. Based on the non-decanted one, this still can be kept for just a few more years, but not too long.

Clear medium ruby color. Clean, youthful, medium+ nose of blackberry, red currant, cassis, green bell pepper, and toast. Dry, medium tannins, medium body, medium alcohol and high acidity. Medium+ intensity flavors of blackberry, cassis and green bell pepper on the smooth palate leading to a medium length finish. Very good wine. Drink now, but also suitable for aging. Very good wine. Drink on its own or pair with poultry or pork dishes.

Deep ruby colour.  A wonderfully expressive cabernet franc!  Perfume on the nose - violet and sweet tobacco.  On the palette there is ripe blackcurrant, blueberry and forest notes.  A really great wine.

Cab franc from the Loire ( chinon) 🇫🇷🇫🇷.  My world tour continues🌎.   Sweet tobacco and dark fruits on the nose.  Leafy herbal notes , cassis/blackberry  and smoke.  Tannins are still active but manageable and that cool climate acidity refreshes.  Medium finish.  4.25.   Their is a very nice balance of intensity and finesse to the fruit.  🇫🇷🇫🇷.  Cab franc has many faces.

One last example of cabfranc in chinon 2011, faster and greater ripening year!

Mid intensity ruby color, bright. The nose has a red fruit character, touches of green pepper with smokie hints, nice! Dry attack nice acidity/bitterness balance and a finish with the smoky character and aromas of over ripeness. Very pleasant!

PNP. This needed several hours to open up. But then it revealed a lovely, if primary, array of bright red fruit, earthy tobacco and enough greenness to remind you this is cab franc. Balanced with crunchy acidity and slightly grainy tannins, this is delightful now, even though it is a decade away from peak.
blackberry black cherry black fruit blackcurrant it’s very black fruits on the palette. Delicious. On the nose it’s for sure tobacco and  earthy notes

Med ruby colour. M+ nose of bramble,  black plum, wild strawberry and black pepper w edge of green bell pepper. Full body, m+ acidity and m+ tannin leading onto m+ palate intensity of black fruit, some ash, twist of pepper. Med fruity finish.

4.2+

Medium ruby in color.

Huge volume & powerful aroma intensity showing tobacco, blackberry, raspberry, cherry, bell pepper, leather, black pepper, licorice & mushroom.

The pure & assertive tobacco when opened will never be forgettable. As it got more airtime, there have been many changes in characters and it became more delicate & complex, while the secondary aroma was more dominant from the opening to the end.

It was full of beautiful & gorgeous aroma and complexity on the nose.

Half Blind Cab Franc tasting. I chose Charles Joguet for the European wines as a top Chinon producer, but they were smashed out of the park by the new world competition. Deep(-) colour, still a purple tint to the rim. Fruity, floral nose, medium intensity. Blackcurrant, raspberry, lily, green bell pepper. The palate is not as powerful or as complex as I was expecting. Dusty berry fruit, toffee, medium tannins, tangy medium(+) acidity. Medium(-) body, the lightest of the four. Perhaps it needs more time.

pickled beetroot, cassis and mushrooms on the nose; subtle palate, a bit restrained, round tannins, hints of cranberries, currants and dark berries; medium  finish. Will benefit from a couple more years in bottle

The bouquet was constantly evolving; initially the nose was dominated by violet and red/dark berries but over time aromas of pink peppercorn and bell pepper emerged. Powerful yet supple and elegant on the palate with notes of dark raspberry, blackberry, cedar, sweet tobacco and black pepper.

Next Chinon coming from one of the 3 top Clos of the house, it was clearly a level up and already a bit more fused and more accessible, after all Cabernet Franc needs a lot of time, used grapes from the  historical clos from vines 70-80 y old, matured on oak for 12-15 months. 
Black fruit forward nose followed by black olives, dust less earthy than the previous one, in the background violets and green pepper notes. 
Powerful, rich and structured on the palate, a tannic bite and dito acidity, those ⬇️⬇️

Very cabernet franc: iron, depth

This is a great food wine, robust with medium acids and low tannins. Nose of cherries, raspberries, ginger, forest shrubs and rosemary. Juicy, dark berry fruit and a cacao nib finish. Medium-low alcohol. Great with full flavored meats such as fruited pork, smoked duck, ribs. Fantastic!

Loire cab franc 2009 tasting 8/8

Good dark inky colour giving little age away. 

This was powerful, with a good hit of oak and a nice purfume hit on the finish. Good integrated acidity and tannin carry a nice smoky finish.

My second wine of the night and quite different to the others.

Tasted this right from the bottle (not decanted), therefore a bit closed at first. Later on plum, smoked, oriental spices, cocoa and tertiary aromas. On the palate, ample and fairly fruity, tight tannins and a little wood.  Nice long aftertaste.

Medium to full bodied, well balanced wine. In this 2010 the tannins are still present, but have softened a lot over the years.

For those who doubt, Loire wines can age beautifully. Lovely nose with lots of very fresh black berry fruit (blackberry, black currants), sweet spices, grilled peppers, licorice. Very fine structure: lengthy with still young and powerful tannins, excellent level of acidity in combo with good volume of freshly picked fruit. This is very good. One tip though, avoid the last bit of the bottle cause it really has bad influence on the taste of the wine.

@Paleo-Piraeus. Top notch Chinon sourced from a 2,2ha single vyd of >85yo vines. Aged for 18m in used oak barrels. 13,5% abv

Dark garnet. Tight and restrained nose of ripe cherries, blackberries, forest floor, crushed stones, licorice, old furniture and graphite. M(+) body, grippy tannins, m/m(+) acidity. Rustic, austere and earthy palate at this stage. Needs a very long patience to appreciate. Just forget it in the cellar...

2015. Still young. 

Nose pronounced. Green notes of bell pepper, stalky, tomato leaf. Dark cherry, blackberry, forest floor and bramble. 

A bit short on the finish. Blueberry on the palate, tannins a bit grippy. 

Can do with more age.

Stellar Cab Franc. High typicity on the nose — green bell pepper, pencil shavings and crushed gravel. Roasted red pepper on the palate with medium(+) acid and gentle tannins. Hint of oak influence. Tangy finish. On the whole a very structured, well-integrated wine. 

Very good (1, 0.5, 0.5, 1)

4.2 stars. Quiet delicious. Classical structure with good complexity. Nose of black cassis, savory, with some tobacco. Dry, medium plus acidity, medium body, medium tannin, 13.5% alcohol. I like it.
Smell of smoke and bacon, pepper, herbs, a bit of Brett. Savory and medium bodied. Aged in new barrel when rawest and then aged in old barrels. Cab franc “hates the sun” like pinot noir
Jammy, fruit forward, well rounded, not sour, brilliant color.

Smooth red from Chinon with candied fruit & tea aromas, ripe cherry flavour with spice and light tannins enriching the finish.

Clear ruby ​​in color without any noticeable sediments. In the there were aromas of blackberry, violet and licorice, accompanied by graphite, crushed stone and a hint of paprika. The mouthfeel was dry and medium-bodied, balanced by a fairly high level of crisp acidity, a medium level of silky tannin.👅 Blackberry bush, pencil curls and Ceylon tea lingered in a long, mineral-driven finish. It seemed quite floral and fruity at this point. May evolve for another 4 years. !⭐⭐⭐⭐👌🍷🍇‼

Charles Joguet defined 5 famous "Clos" - where one of them is AOC CHINON. Muskiness, softiness for 30 yrs aging potential! 85+ yr old vines. Organic, 25 month in oak. Long lived wine w/ elegance, individuality, red currant, black currant, black pepper, white pepper, graphite, cedar, licorice.

What an incredible Chinon - savory earth and wild fruit notes along with smoke - lovers of Islay scotch will gravitate to this! From the glass, I get elegant and earthy notes of wild red field fruits, clove, truffle, mushroom, brambly forest floor, black olive, and saline/granite minerality - very smoky. The palate is well-integrated and complex, with firm tannins. The finish is exceptionally well-balanced and celebrates Old World sensibilities. Will age 18+ years. Fine value, too!

90 p. A deep red/purple hue. Initially red berries and fruits on the nose- a pinot character almost. Some time in the decanter reveals earthy notes, herbs and blackcurrant. Elegant palate, a bit on the lean side, lots of acid and bold, fine grained tannins in the finish. A savory rahter than sweet style. Will benefit from a few more years now, I think.
great chinon. this cab franc has fruit and dry tannins and is bold and full bodied.
Should be even better in another 5 years. Still not completely integrated, a true vin de garde.
delicious cab franc from Loire Valley
Dark fruit, open nose, ripe tannins, very convincing

Fascinating to taste a fully mature Loire valley Cabernet Franc.  This 1997 Joquet was still very much alive. Light to medium body. Earthy with notes of cigar box, forest floor, fern and tobacco dominating.  To my surprise the core showed plenty  of ripe black and red berries, some spice and a hint of herbs.  The acidity was pronounced but not overpowering and it had a nice silky texture.  This showed unexpectedly well.

Casis,smoke,tobacco in this exeptional Chinon Cab.Franc . Charles Joguet from Sazilly producing it. As sugested by locals the wine perfect match is boiled beef with vegetables and local blue cheese...

a little farm on the nose, with something like a red plum or even cranberries on the nose. after a little time and aeration, way more vegetable notes - green pepper, tomato paste, tomato leaf, some sort of nightshade representation. very very nice. not $100 nice.

Exceptional vintage, extravagantly flavorful and delicious. Its perfume is so delicately gripping, so sensual, so forward. The taste is unmistakeable Cab Franc, mellow, but still bright. The end was pleasant and persistent. When tasting undecanted, it came with a slight bitterness at the end. I bet its peak was in the recent past.

A grand wine with a promising bouquet, that explodes against your palate in a multitude of tastes - citrus, apple, pears, almonds, hazelnut, browned butter and spring flowers. And on top of that a long after taste which leaves a sense of content and happiness. Delicious!
Great!!!

Fuligni’s BdM Riserva, aged for 5 years, 3 of which in oak.  Made with grapes from the oldest vines in the vineyard, it is already displaying Asian herbal aromas and some nutty flavours.  Enjoyable.

4.3
Medium bright ruby on eye. Intense layered aroma of balck cherry, red currant, plum and prune associated with very woody aroma of cypress, white sandalwood, very floral smell of iris and violet as well as dried herbs, tobacco and leather. Dry on the palate, high acidity, high alcohol and velvety high tanins - relatively med+ bodied one. Very balanced, jolly punchy, rather lingering and quite complex. Quite an excellent one!

Light Garnet red.  Very fragrant bordering on preserved prunes and floral hints.  Smooth, well rounded, good tannins, a delightful delicious wine.  Lot of red berries like raspberries & cherries.  Love this wine.  We didn’t particularly paired it with our food but it worked well with a grilled tumeric chicken satay.

4.6/5.0. Friday Night ‘Rona Wine (and this was a great one)! Medium garnet in colour and a bit earthy on the nose with notes of cedar, mocha and tobacco. Black cherry, red cherry and chocolate all shine on the palate along with subtle notes of espresso and Italian herbs. Medium+ bodied with well-structured tannins and bold acidity. This wine should continue to age beautifully or many years to come, but it’s really drinking nicely today.

Happy Sangiovese Friday ! Backlog Carnival Legend 🚢 w/@[1|10538791|Adele Rubin-Herzenberg]. 
Garnet/ruby color, after a three hour decant, earthy aromas of cherry oak leather tobacco plum vanilla and smoke. On the palate cherry raspberry tobacco oak licorice earth and smoke. Full bodied and on the dry side with med tannins med acidity and a lengthy earthy finish. 
Excellent pairing with the usual steakhouse fav’s, prime NY strip, spice rubbed ribeye lamb chops and skirt steak with all of the trimmings😋🇮🇹😎🍷

A distinctive aroma of earthy leather previews a lingering finish on the palate.  This wine is substantial enough to serve as the basis for a meal in itself.  Just add a good cheese plate, crusty bread and ripe fruit for a satisfying and delicious repast.

👁: Garnet colour with medium wine legs
👃: Abit muted on the nose as I can only picked up faint hint of mint & cherry
👅: It’s a totally different experience compared to the nose as the palate is brimming with red fruits attack especially strawberries, raspberries & red cherry. It’s a medium bodied wine with high acidity but low tannins. It has a very long finish (the mouth lingering fruits & mouth watering sensation are screaming for food pairings)

2013 Fuligni - round 2.
Great nose has red cherries, forest berries, wet leaves, violets, nougat, walnut, dry earth & some freshness, maybe menthol.
The palate has firm, early on earthy, tannins & juicy, lively acidity.
Flavors range from morello cherries, forest berries, old cabinet, tree bark, cocoa powder & rose petals. Hints of minerals & eucalyptus complete the picture.
Great nose, super delicious. Powerful upfront, dims down & gains balance after 3-4 hours, extremely juicy & mouthwatering.

Red fruit, seeming maturity. What a length. Very impressive balance. It is young and very promising.

Partial note - local wine agent tasting event.  Lots of sour and red cherries, hints of leather, tar and earth. Tannins a bit dry, but nice acidity.

A Brunello on top of its game right now. Brown color nuances. Lovely animal notes of whool and leather, countryside vibes!  Mushrooms, wet leaves, crushed stone, dark cherries, dried violets, mint, tobacco and olives. Great depth and structure. The sillkyness on the palate is really impressive. It's literally weightless. Tannins are so fine and smooth but still has the classic bite of sangiovese bitter. Fantastic balance!

Powerful & modern with with tertiary complexity & good depth, showing a rich & plump bouquet of sweet cherry, wild herbs, violet, chestnut, mingling with vanilla, clove, licorice, cedar, earth, mushroom, smoke, tobacco and hints of balsamic. Firmly structured with polished tannins, solid minerality & bright acidity. Harmoniously balanced. Closes with a long finish lingering with flint & dried herbs.
Not as firm as the solid 15 & 16 vintages but easier accessible.

My highest rate from the button of my heart. To This Brunello is nothing to compare. There is perfect silk full body and structure, balance between tannin and acidity, cherry, leather, vanilla, oak, smoke and plum, pronounced and longest finish to enjoy

Sour plum floral minerals leather mushroom smoke strong ripe blackberry blackcurrant prune

Excellent!!! Medium body and aromas of red fruits (cherry and raspberries), leather and smoke. Acidity medium plus.
Fragrant nose with ripe red fruit, vanilla, tobacco, leather, tar, crushed rock, rose, and a whiff of orange peel. On palette vivid fruits, med + acidity, med body.  Well balanced. Very good.
Muscular ripe black cherries, tar, leather, very chewy fruits on the palate, sour cherry, umami dark plums notes, well structured and elegant tannins with long finishing, delicious!
Like the 2015. This wine is balanced and like a classic Bordeaux it’s tannins softly coat your mouth. But where this one takes off is in the symphonic finish of changing notes. Sublime.
Excellent Italian wine. Try it.

3.8/5 ⭐️ Complex and accessible nose

Italy - Tuscany - DOCG Brunello di Montalcino - Montalcino North

🍷 Appearance: clear; medium garnet

👃🏻Nose: clean; medium+ intensity; aromas of herbs (tea), red fruit (cherry), elegant oak, liquriche, HP sauce; developing

👅 Palate: dry; high acidity; medium+ tannin; high alcohol (14.5%); full body; pronounced flavour intensity; flavours of red fruit (cherry), cherry kernel, herbs (oregano, thyme), HP sauce, pepper flake; medium finish

Medium ruby colour. Aromas of cherry, raspberry, mineral. Palate is medium+ acidity, medium- body, medium alcohol, tanjims are very soft, finish is medium+. Easy with lots of dishes, versatile and approachable.

Dark fruit, licorice and leather on the nose
Cherry, plum and oak on the palate with dominant pepper on the finish
Very muscular wine as expected for a BdM but yet well integrated tannins and structure

Lauded Fuligni have over 20 Acres under vine in the heartland of Brunello, most of which is over 400m ASL, the vineyards running to the east of fairytale, hilltop Montalcino🤴🗡🏰

A pristine, regal part of Tuscany reflected in this classical wine, which while not excuding warmth, certainly exudes quality. 

A guarded aristocrat, after 3 days it did not budge in aromatics or flavour. With high acidity, round tannin. Dense and full, black cherry with secondary smoke, oak, liquorice. Powerful. 

4.5⭐️ in 5+yrs

Still great, and shows off the land really nicely, but poggione and padaletti win out for me. 

Nose: Dried red fruit and dried prune with dried mint and some licorice and tan earthen tones of Montalcino’s east facing hill
Finish: ditto from the nose, with some soft vanilla and baking spices from the oak. Well made. Body is medium plus, but high alcohol and needs to breathe given the high (though not jarring) tannins.

dd48.3 attractive perfumes of floral cherries red dark friuts intense deep layer very focus herbs friuty minerals leather earth pepper spices metal iron green grippy tannins sharp balance acidity savoury finish nice evolution

On the nose is complex with dried dark fruit. Beautiful tearing. Balanced but complex, subtle, tart with slightly dominant tannins. Prunes and dried fig. Cellar another 5+ years.

TN: Rich and round, featuring cherry, raspberry, floral and mineral aromas and flavors. Graceful and intense, showing terrific balance, with a long, fruit-, tobacco- and mineral-tinged aftertaste. Exhibits fine purity and freshness. Drink from 2025.

4.5. Happy Alphabet Saturday 🔠 everyone! This week brought to you by the letter 🎏 as in 🎏uligni, considered one of the top estates in Montalcino. The Fuligni estate in Montalcino was founded in 1923.

This is the one of the best 2015 Brunellos I've had to date (note @[1|4803465|Jean Sendero]). This scored 100 points from James Suckling and 98 points from Wine Enthusiast. This has red and some black berries, dusty plum, sweet spices, tobacco and Gamora leather. 👍 🍷 🇮🇹 ❤️
Earthy dirt and leather in the glass. Hints of cherry and blackberry that were even bigger on the palate. Buy again. Great Brunello. Can’t wait to try the ‘15.

31st sip: Ei Fuligni Brunello di Montalcino 2014 (#84)
JS93 (planned to try their JS96 Riserva 2013 but was all gone)
Sweet burnt brown sugar. 4.5*
Italian wine tasting, Nov 2019

WONDERFUL 
Fantastic brunello, east part of Montalcino
Rich nose of chocolate, leather, smoke and tobacco leaves. Full body, low acidity, outstanding tannins
Great pair for Fiorentina 🥩
Bright dark clear red. Red fruits and florals. Delightful palate of elegance and finesse. Layered red fruits with spice and forest. Firm tannin and energetic acid. Long and persistent. Lovely.
Nice garnet colour. Typical notes of sour cherry, tobacco and licorice, spices, leather, balsamic and only a bit "animal". Harmonic, high acidity and chalky tannins. Decanted for 60 minutes.
Complex with dark fruit balanced by tobacco and leather. Strongly recommend decanting for at least one hour. Very complimentary to grilled beef or rich pasta dishes . This is a wonderful Brunello .
Verry good
A “vin quelconque”. A bit disappointed. It’s round and pleasant but lacks the strength and enchantment expected.
Opened up after 1h. Strong tannins good acidity. Dark cherries. Flowers on nose. Paired with amazing dry aged ribsteak at Buca
Much better than last time I tried it. Opened 4 hours before drinking and decanted and hour before. Will wait another year or so for the next bottle.
Superb BdM. Decanted for 3 hours. High acidity, tannins becoming softer by the sip. Ripe red fruits, licorice, bramble, light mint.

Always a safe choice with Fuligni. Warm vintage, but still a well made and delicate brunello. Red fruit and cherry that have developed to more raisin and plum. A little hot fruit and 14,5ABV. Discrete green herbs, a little vanilla, caramel and smoke. Nice acidity. Dry. Fuller body. Still quite vivid tannins. Longer finish. Very well balanced. Pure joy.

Wow! Absolutely perfect Brunello... Lovely deep hue. Thick and viscous as expected. Deep rich red fruit nose. Cherry, raspberry, with overarching earth and oak tones. Powerful in the mouth, deeply satisfying, well rounded and full bodied. Perfect tannin balance, low acidity, deep dark oak, tobacco, subtle vanilla flavour. Long lasting savory notes, dry, unami feels. Welt fabulously with rich fish pie but would pair with most food. Would love another bottle. Cheers.

Last wine from our afternoon at a local wine bar today- long time since I’ve had a Brunello but rarely disappoints.

Red cherry and licorice on the nose, this is medium bodied. Black fruit and red cherry on the palate along with licorice and chocolate oak on the palate with a medium to long finish.

4.4

Woooow! A fantastic wine that needed a couple of hours of aeration before its potential blossomed. Took a mouth about 10 minutes after opening the bottle, tannins made the whole mouth stick with the gums, 2 hours later, to the food, grilled red meat, it was the best wine I drank in a very long time! Expensive of course, but worth every penny. Best of all, I have two bottles left.

Tremendous wine. Amazing fruit, earthy, and slight tobacco aromas that lead into bold yet wonderfully smooth structure with many layers of fruit, chocolate, and earth in the palate. Great chalky and long finish.

There is something distinctive about Fuligni that when you taste it you know it is a Fuligni wine. It is a flavour that is so distinctive and easy to love. 
Beautiful sour cherry notes hide amongst the baking spices, wood, earthy floor notes and tannins. Some tobacco leaf. Smooth yet somewhat dirty in the aftertaste sort of that not quite clean note that speaks of the winemaking process and the land. 
This is not the best vintage I have ever tasted but is is up there.

Enjoyed at Wine Spectators NY Wine Experience 2017! Medium body. Lighter then most but expressive. Red cherries, raspberries. Secondary flavors of leather, charred wood to give some depth. Good finish.

Whoa, this is one big knock out punch of a Brunello. Big bouquet of red cherry, plum, leather, tobacco and a hint of mint. Big mouthfeel with cherries, red plum, Italian herbs, stewed tomatoes and licorice. Little orange peel zest on the aftertaste which is not too long. Fullest body I’ve yet come across on a BdM with lots of weight as well as some of the darker red fruit I’ve seen. A really good effort.

Medium-bodied. High in acidity. Dry. Notes of cherry, strawberry, and raspberry with a hint of oak, tobacco, and vanilla. Smokey. Impressive flavors. Well-balanced. Firm tannins. Best paired with lamb.

Nose: mushroom licorice oak vanilla chocolate pepper violet
Palate:  cherry  raspberry
Wow! Amazing complexity!! 
Opens up quite quickly(1hour)
Texture, taste, & aroma justifies the price-point.
Bottle of luxury!!!

A Tuscan delight. Medium-pale ruby red with somewhat bricked edges. This one really draws you into the glass with its complex and deep nose. Cranberry, red cherry, tobacco, scorched earth, leather, smoke with plenty of floral aromatics like rose and violet and a touch of mint to lift it. A hint of baking spice and wood but all in balance. On the palate the fruit is darker, a little more like prune, plum and has a lovely grip with kicking acidity. It’s long..really long. 17.5.

Beautiful wine in a great spot. Certainly will hold for several years but unless you like tertiary notes, I would drink now.

Nose is austere but elegant with balanced notes of cracked, worn leather, earth and smoke.

Palate is smooth, medium bodied and balanced with fine tannins and modest acidity. The wine’s 14.5% abv is perfectly integrated.

Flavours add black cherry, tobacco and black plum to the full and complex medley. 

Drink now, at peak.
At JS Tour of Italy tasting 9/8/22. An elegant medium bodied Brunello with raspberry, black cherry, bramble, and roses, bright acidity, velvety fine tannins.
94 pts. Raspberry, strawberry, vanilla and light oak. Such great balance and fine tannins. This is just ready now and will stay here for at least 5 years.
Orange chocolate on nose and palate. Deep berry red colour but not as deep as an Aussie Shiraz. Leather. Good wood and well developed tannins   Fantastic red wine.
Almost as good as Ciacci Piccolomini d’Aragona Riserva 2010 (benchmark Brunello for me). Should consider buying Riserva when released
Medium ruby colour with well-aged nose of red cherry, tomato leaf, tar and mushroom. Still has great acidity and tannin. At early maturity; still with good fruit.
Elegant and very balanced. A superb match with chanterelles with cranberries, baked Hokkaido pumpkin and potatoes. The bottle did not survive the meal.
Nothing special
Chewy and meaty. Rust orange color. Lots of tannins, with oak dust, leather and bread crust. Medium finish.
Excellent Brunello. Bright red color. Notes of red cherry, plum, and cinnamon. Full bodied, high tannins, with a great finish.
BIG! Red fruit, leather, oak and lots of cherry. Tobacco and super dry. Fruit really lingers with you.
Had to air a bit but then it really warmed up. Super nice and smooth Brunello. Notes of oak and cherry.
Great Brunello! Just make sure you can affort it (dont look at the receipt!). Flavour all over the place!
Great Italian Brunello wine.  Let it age and it will improve.  Flavors of  cherry strawberry raspberry earthy balsamic vanilla oak and licorice.  Would recommend this wine.

Very nice Brunello! Still quite tannic, but good to go after a few hours.
Nice fresh acidity, blackberries, serious undertone.
I think this wine will get better in time. Wait 5 more yrs.
