Wine tasting at Enoteca la Fortezza di Montalcino. Fresh and powerful Brunello, with succulent black cherry, licorice, smoke and moist earth flavours. It was the first glass to set the direction of the night. Wonderful!

Mid ruby & garnet core eye with slight garnet rim. Nose brings smokey bacon, blackcurrant, candied cherry, strawberry, slight licorice. Initial tongue has blackcurrant, followed by red fruits including cherry, strawberry and raspberry. Slight herbal notes and subtle forest floor and slight leather. Tannins coming in beautifully as the wine gets warmer, lovely mid-long finish with some oak representation. Superb balance & sensual structure. Sexy and beautiful. Will get better in 5-8 yrs. CoravinEd 25 Jan ‘21

Italian week? I guess it just happened that way. 

I believe this is just coming into a drinking window. With red berries and spice, showing some age with leather overtones swirling into a floral perfume that says "this is Brunello". 

On the palate, those red cherries, spice and leather coupled with aniseed. Smooth tannins and velvety finish. This has depth. 

A 4 to 4.5 stars wine.

The vintage 2015 BDM is legendary, as you know. Something pleasant happened, so I opened this wine, which is not yet time to drink. It took three days to fully open, then it radiated the aromas of red and white flowers, violet, plum, some sweet berries, ripe cherry, candle, chalk off the glass with top-notch concentration and seamless texture. It’s evolving definitely. Gorgeous. 95-98pts.

What else could I ask for more? Surely another bottle of this wonderful Fuligni's Brunello, a winery that produces less than 200 boxes per vintage!
This '08 beauty already has a deep grenade red color.
Aromas are quite intense of mature red fruits with notes of oak, spices, pimento, bitter chocolate and liquorice. 
It is medium-bodied (14.0%), very well-balanced, presenting perfect acidity and alcohol. Tannins are elegant and properly strong. Finish is robust, velvety and persistent.
A 94-GB pts GREAT wine!

This wine is exquisite, and is clearly one of the good reasons Montalcino is on the map. Faded brick color, with an earthy and fruity nose. Starts with raspberry and black cherry that melts into earthy spice, leather and tobacco. Most notably, you can detect just a hint of the clay terroir that made Montalcino famous. The finish is so smooth you might not even notice. The balance is perfect. Actually, pretty much everything about this one is perfect; this is a great benchmark. Indulge every chance you can.

When I saw this bottle brought in to the gathering, I pointed it out to the other “wine” people there. One person said we should let it be a gift to the hosts. Then another person pointed out that one of the hosts doesn’t drink and the other one prefers gin and tonics.  So open the bottle we did. Just funny to see five of us in a circle just smelling our glasses with this fine vino. We thanked the person who brought it to the gathering.  Yes, it was smooth and full bodied.

(4,3) Elegant, yet also weighty and robust. Orange zest, candied fruits, leather, smoke, fur. Balanced. Beautiful tannins. Lengthy. Very good Brunello ‘15, among the best wines of the vintage, this has everything you look for in Brunello.

The winery is located just north-east of Montalcino. Mainly an eastern exposition, 370-450 metres, rocky Santa Fiora-marl. Fermentation in steel vasts, 18-22 days. 30 months in oak barrels, starting with French tonneaux (500 l) and Allier barrels (750 l) for the...

Well balanced, tannins, acidity and fruits all there in balance, you can tell this will age well. Red fruit, oak, leather and slight vanilla round out the finish. Impressed with this bottle given the hype.

Really harsh and acidic on opening. This young wine at this stage benefited enormously from a day of breathing. Then became very full and lush with lots of sour cherry. Fragrant and soft with a nice balance. Will be great in 5-10 years.

Located on the northern slope of Montalcino for this small winery, their wines always come with finesse and intensity. The wine has medium+ nose intensity. The aromas are so elegant, layers from fresh red fruits to salty minerals and finally some limestones. The wine has a medium+ intensity. Wow! this wine is outstanding, one of my favourite Brunello di Montalcino! still young and tight but can drink now, and has potential for ageing.

Aromas of dried fruit, earth, oak, dark fruits, on palate dark fruits of blackberry, black cherry, plum, chocolate cassis, cola, some astringency on end; lingering aftertaste of fruit, chocolate, cola. Nice complex Brunello DI montalcino.
Cassis, strong tannins, a sour note complementing the underlying gentle sweetness, a clear wooden base, oaky, rich spices, grows on your palate,
Really nice Brunello. Ruby red in color. Rich, dry, full bodied. Red fruits, cherries and raspberries, pleasant, clean, crisp finish.  Goes very well with grilled meats.  Enjoyable.

Great Brunello producer!
Poor vintage!
14% alc.
👃: Cherries, liquorice, viol, tobacco, earth and cedar.
👅: Palate is dry, elegant and rather light-bodied. Notes of black cherries, tobacco, liquorice, viol and discreet vanilla.
Firm acidity. Good structure.
Unfortunately the bad vintage 2014 is noticeable with rather light and weak fruitiness and lack of depth and complexity.
Still a good Brunello!
Great producers don't make bad wine!!!
100% sangiovese, aged five years (two in oak) before release, full body, velvety tannins, medium to high acidity, ages for decades. #masterclass

Wild flowers, rose petals, spice,  and berries on the nose.

Tight tannins. 

Ripe, acidic berries on the palate, with blackberry, cherry, and citrus flavor

Medium-plus
Beautiful ruby colour.  Smells of cherry, almond,  pepper and wet earth.  Taste of sour cherry and so very smooth.  Had with black truffle gnocchi.  A DELIGHT
Brunello is always delicious. On this, night #2, rhe cherry is riper and the smokey meat taste is more pronounced. Only a glass left aftet last night's indulgence. Ugh
Excellent. Notes of  cherry, leather, mushroom, oak,  dark fruit. Pleasant tannic finish. Great bottle.
4.4 What a wine! J. Suckling hit the nail on head with this one. Really increases my appreciation of this varietal.
2011 Vintage - Top 31 of 125 tested; thick, vibrant aroma; smooth, full, complex attack; off-dry finish; wonderful.
Classic Brunello nose and palate yet delicate, light color and weight. Looking forward to trying more from this producer.
earthy, oaky and spicy! doesnt remind me of the 2013 vintage i had just 2 months ago! still lovely tho.
Elegant youthful brunello. Bright red cherries and juicy crunchy cranberries. Good balance of acidity and tannins.
Good depth, concentration of dark fruits, structure and restrained power in a fairly tight worn core of tannins. WOTN
Oaky earthy delight.
Very good
A fine Brunello !

Wow. Enjoyed this. Let it breath and discover the universe for about 2 hours. Rewarded us with a brilliant bright nose of cherry, soft damp oak, and citrus smoke. Flavour profile followed suit. Although I would have loved a little more cream and silk body. Well done though.

98 pts - James Suckling.  So juicy and gorgeous. A fabulous red! I really appreciate the dark berry aromas that follow through to a full body, with very integrated tannins and a ripe and juicy fruit character. Savory, succulent…hints of chocolate and nuts. Drink now or hold for years ahead.

Very round, silky smooth with tannin well integrated. Almost like a Burg with more black fruit, more power and higher intensity. Compared this against 15 and 16 but love this more. Overall 15 has a better structure but 10 more approachable.

Intensed floral notes, strawberry, berry  chocolate, smoke and  vanilla aromas all mingled nicely to please the nose. Full bodied and well balanced. Tannin is silky smooth. Structure can be maintained for long hours and the finish is persistent. Super!

Been drinking 2010 BDM for the pass few days, Fuligni the best & as expected, prominent BDM maker. 

Decanted 3hrs, evolved every minutes, complex & amazing depth that definitely will become a gem in the next 5yrs. JS98pts.

With airtime, very fresh ripe cherry aromas, choco, cinnamon, mint, spice & hints of pepper & earthy. All slowly integrated & expressive. 

Amazing texture! Fantastic acidity & balance tannins. Savoury! Superb finished with spice, choco & rounded fruits.

Can't wait to taste '10 riserva

How do you elevate Nachos, Buffalo Wings, and Super Bowl? Why not with a stunning 2010 BDM! Of the many that I have come across from this top vintage, most of them would be drinking way too young, however this would not be the case for this flying Fuligni. Structured in a way that makes this very approachable in its youth, but still ticks all the boxes for long term cellaring. Loads of ripe cherry, raspberry, cedar and spice, with savoury tannins, bright acids, and a robust lengthy finish. Killer BDM! 14.0%

What a special treat this was! Garnet and rust in color, with a wonderful intermingling of red fruit, tobacco smoke and spice. Tannins are super smooth. Bold and lovely. The 2010 BdMs are really coming into their own!!! More on @goatsandgrapes on Instagram

Best for last! Probably my favourite wine of the 🇮🇹 trip, a classic Brunello from an outstanding vintage, it brings ripe red fruit, mixed berries, earth and tobacco, a full, muscular body with excellent structure and complexity. Outstanding wine 🤩🤩🍷👌🇮🇹🙏

4.5 92p. Sour cherries, violets, wet underbrush and a whiff of oak. High acidity and high tannins. 

Lots of glycerol. A very good glass. 

4-5 months on barrique and then on large botti for the remaining period. 

14.5 % abv. 
11-

Tasted at winery with cellar master. Brunello riserva 16. Fantastic nose fresh strawberry / strawberry jam. Rich elegant floral and bright red fruit with a little Blackberry and black cherry. Tannins beginning to integrate and mellow. Will get even better!

Another wine from Sunday last week. Fuligni is definitely one of the best producers in Montalcino and I really like the usual powerful style of their Brunello. This 2010 is in a perfect moment. 👃🏻 Tobacco, raisins, mushrooms, dark chocolate and moist earth. 👅 Balanced palate, with rounded and silky tannins, plenty of acidity. Dried herbs, cigar, plum and raspberries, followed by a bitter sweet prunes impression, lingering on a lengthy finish. 4.5⭐️

Medium ruby in color.  

It shows aromas of red and dark cherry and licorice with hints of earth and soft leather.  The palate is dry, medium bodied with cassis and coffee flavors.  

I could confirm that 2010 was extraordinarily vintage in Toscana.  I like it.

NYC James Suckling event Sept 8, 2021 (my wine #36)
Day one.
JS 97
Medium garnet color. 
Amazing nose of earth, leather and cherry.
Palate is red cherry, plum, leather and cedar. 
Dry with medium+ body and acidity. 
Finely tuned tannins.
This is ready to drink and it's delicious🍷

pale garnet. med+ aromas intensity of sour red cherry, dried strawberry, red plum, cranberry, smoke, dried leaves, black tea, clove, tomato leaf, leather, coffee and forest floor. Dry, medium+ acidity, medium+ bodied, high tannin, tannin is fine-grained, medium+ intensity on the palate, medium to long finish. Excellent quality wine. Great balance between the acidity, body, and tannin. Very harmonious. Can drink now, but it will benefit with bottle aging. It has great acid and tannin structure to carry.
Excellent matured brunello. Very fragrant and a bit dry to start with. Open up in a short moment. Smooth drinking. Enjoyed it in a steak dinner.
This is just a bit softer each time I try it. Wonderful palate and rustic fruit. Still some yummy spice. Really good with a rich Gorgonzola sauce.
Very nice medium bodied wine with a delicious sweet red fruit, some earthy notes and mild leather. well balanced with mild tannins. Great structure and a good med finish. Delicious!
Tasted again, starting to come into its stride. Slight bricking, the cherries have become more black cherry reduction with good M+ acidity. Really enjoying where this is at currently. 93+
Wow, this one is fantastic. Really so well balanced - no other comments let me drink this sucker
Outstanding brunello and great price
Super enjoyable. A little sweetness.
leather tobacco cherry
Very nice Brunello with strong tannins first but softening up with food
Cherry, plum, cedar, oak, vanilla and a hint of licorice. Very elegant and tasty.
One of my favorite brunellos
Fruity nose. Medium bodied, smoky, dark fruits, hawthorn. long finish.
Top velvet big taste Brunello.
Fruity, berries; leather, hints of espresso and smoke; very well balanced; good wine
loved it!, ready to drink. Just. Great Brunello
Turning out to be one of my favorite producers. Sandalwood on the nose was a first time for me, and enjoyed it. Full bodied and wholesome.
Smoke and leather with some interesting red fruit flavors coming through very nice wine.
leather cherry tobacco oak plum blackberry
2014 - nose of wet cardboard, dust and red fruit, cherry.  Light in body, but tannin dry through the palate....well done, 4.25*
Excellent. I prefer the 2016 but still a tremendous wine.

2010

Color: ruby clear

Nose: tobacco plum smoke 

Taste: medium firm tannins. Medium bodied. Plum. Some smoke. Cherries. JS overrated.
cherry, blackcurrant, blackberry, orange chocolate (jaffa cake), oak, dark chocolate, tobacco, gamey, medium+ tannin, medium+ body, high acidity

Great Sangiovese 2011 at Italian restaurant in Brooklyn 
Medium acidity with cherry raspberry and leather and earthy 
Velvety tannins
Purple to garnet. Mix of Leathery and red fruit notes. Balanced tannin and acidity. Beautiful blend. Lingering aftertaste . Love it
Black pepper right off the bat. Second phase, blackberry, plum, cassis brings up the rear. Tartness fades to a little vanilla.
Dad stuffed up when he brought this over. Obviously can't read in Italian too well. My gain, it's delicious.

A BdM that I love - refined, sexy and simply delicious. On the nose, she has complex and harmonic aromas, with cherry, plum, aromatic herbs, pepper, cinnamon and wood at first, then cream, licorice, violet, star anise and leather after 1.5 hours. On the hue she is dark ruby, clean with long legs. On the palate, she is balanced, velvety smooth, voluptuous plus a lingering finish, very memorable! Overall she offers her charm after an hour, and has maintained her power, with a hint of elegance since. Superb!

cherry , sour , a touch of tomato 🍅, with pale in colour, still strong in alcohol
and long lasting tanning. Quite a balance one

Oh boy I loved this vino. Perfectly aged and balanced. Dry tobacco notes with a cherry finish. Excellent bottle I got from Eiman for my birthday this year.

Been holding onto it for a special occasion, which was a fun last-minute concert and swim before Kate and Darren’s wedding!! Love you @Titillatingwinereviews and @[1|43172419|Rachel D’Acierno]!
2008 vintage. Slight bricking at the edges, fabulous nose of red fruit and hibiscus. Elegant tannins and a long finish. This is drinking very nicely now. Excellent!
cherry leather raisin, tar, smoke, chocolate, earth, forest floor, super aromatic, tannins are silky, still has some nice acidity. drinking really well
Drinking old Brunello is really a pleasure. Sweet spices and tobacco, hint of cherries and leather. Silky tannins, raspberry, sweet cigar and a long finish. Great wine

Top.
Evolution. Parfumed with a lot of complexity. Tastes very young.
Red (cherries, cassis) and black fruit, silky tannins, drying, lovely acidity in a mid. long finish

Medium red. M+ fragrance of red cherries and red plums, vanilla, tar, tobacco and cedar. M+ taste of red cherries, vanilla and cedar. M body, M tannins and M+ acid. M+ finish dominated by red fruit and some vanilla. Well done, a really fine Brunello with good QPR!

Strawberry, black cherry, plum, spice, and rose. A notch riper and more complex than the Rosso. High acid and firm tannins with a long finish. A mix of vines planted on limestone and clay. James Suckling rated the 2015, 100pts, so that one was sold out.

Full bodied very enjoyable Italian red. Beautiful aromas and flavors of red cherry, strawberry, raspberry with notes of sweet tobacco and licorice. Great food wine. Fantastic value. Ready now 2017 and sugar enjoy now and next 4-6 years. 92 pts

Integrated , complex , balanced well made with lots of red ripe fruits , silly tannins good level of acidity and range of aroma profiles of vanilla oak and sweet spices . Medium plus body with a long aroma finish. Exceptionnel .

One of my favorite, new to me, Brunello producers at the James Suckling Great Wines of Italy event was Fuligni.  Loved all their wines I sampled.  Red cherry, leather, cedar, Montalcino dust, tobacco.

4.4
Colour: medium ruby

Nose: low intensity, elegant, a bit closed, raspberry, earthy. 

Palate: medium/high intensity, tight, red fruit, mouthwatering, high tannins, high acid, very well balanced 

Finish: medium/long wet stone

Served by the glass (under Coravin).

Medium dark red hue. At first seemed a touch subdued. Opened with deep aromas of raspberry, sour red cherry, dark plum, liquorice, and violet florals. 

Beautiful pristine fruit in the palate, excellent delineation and length, minerality and powdery tannins to close. Cork (unopened- needle extraction) 14.0% alc.

Vintage 2009 slow to mature. Smell: densely packed with almond, chestnut, and dried fruit.
Taste: cherry, chestnut, tobacco, chocolate, and it becomes more flavorful as you swirl and decant the wine. Very enjoyable!

4.0 Fuligni is east of Montalcino on 10 hectares across four vineyards at Cottimelli. The family has along history is the area coming originally from Venice. 
No detailed notes taken but focused Brunello with structure and plenty of potential for aging and enjoyment

Drums are done and it's time to celebrate with a beauty!! I was Amarone'd out...honestly I enjoy Brunello more lately. This is a new producer for me, & a great first impression. Decanted 2 hours while tracking drums. The bouquet keeps you coming back: elegant yet powerful, notes of black cherry, tar, something herbaceous, cigar box. Silky on the tongue, lots happening, dark & red fruit, tobacco, earthy oak, yum yum. I have enjoyed many 2011 bottles, though they get less hype than 2010. Rock on friends!!!
Superb brunello from Fuligni! Tones of leather & red fruit. Full & round on the palate with great acidity. The best is yet to come in the following years. 16/20
Really shows off the grape, excellent example of Brunello

Love how it sticks to the wine glass in droplets,has nice legs.
Very fine wine earthy a touch of citrus with a lengthy finish.
Not too heavy yet well refined flavours.
Supes supes yum
Dark crimson in colour. Herbal notes, spice, and skin of blackberries in the aroma. Flavour of cherries, leather, ink, oak, blackberries, tannins, and spice. 89.
Beautiful bouquet, silky tannins, salinity, hint of spice - wonderful wine I would love to try again in 5 years time
4.5 still so powerful!
4.3... a little too acidic after a couple hours of decanting. Lively old fashioned BdM
This is great juice.
Let this one decant for a few hours and when you drink you'll find a balance of dark fruit, cherry, vanilla and oak. The tannins are fine grained and tight and the acidity is well balanced. 🥂
Amazing wine. Great taste and finish
Strong structure. Dry Cherry, plum, metal, leather , tobacco, and earthy. Still too young.
Red cherry, cedar, tobacco and some leather. Nice!
Beautiful wine, medium body, lots of cherry and blackberry, small tobacco. Great vintage and so ready to drink this wine.

#8 Wine from the Brunello Tasting 
 Fuligni Brunello Di Montalcino
4.1
Ruby in the glass. Berry and chocolate nose. Nice tannins and spicey oak. Medium finish. Saluti 🍷

4.4+

Detailed review later
Big & yummy. Earth,red fruits,tobacco & cedar. Needs at least 5 yrs.95
In Florida with Broeker’s. Outstanding
Dark Ruby. M+ intensity berries,sandel wood,new leather smell. The Palate is dry. intense hawthorn,good wood and herb,smooth and refreshing. dried herb spice finish with decent tannis.
Doesn’t disappoint ! What I expect from a brunello at a good price
very good
92. Seems a bit more Classic In the style within this little BDM 09 battle. Decant or keep In the cellar for further 2-3 years and expect a great glass of Sangiovese.
Terrific nose, with flowers, cherry, earth, spice. Flavors of red fruit, mineral, spices, tobacco, chocolate. Very full bodied for a Brunello. Loved it.
Dark fruit aromas of cherry and plum. It is quite rich and shows many different layers. Dark spices, tobacco, forest floor and leather with velvety tannins that leads to a long finish.

Only previously drunk in Tuscany  but my first in the Uk. A great wine with food. We had it with a grilled lamb of the The Big Green Egg.
 cherry raspberry tobacco leather oak
Had the magnum … yum yum ! Deep fruit and smooth tannins. The full story in this one - a little of everything and then some. Age kicks in with tertiary impressions of rounded acidic and herbal tones.
Thin, Barolo style appearance but leaves a warm rosy glow. Modest astringency and bright acidity. Not over-complex but enormously drinkable - esp with cheese and charcuterie.

Brunello Wine Tasting 2018

Bright ruby red. Scents of roses, blueberries, licorice and juniper berries. Very balanced in the mouth, with lively tannins. Long finish with a fruity finish.
A very nice brunello, one the best I tried. Dry but very round in taste, probably thanks to the 7+ years rest in the bottle. Leather and smoky but also some red berries.
A fantastic Brunello. Incredible nose of petals, berries and spice. Pale garnet in color, radiant clarity. Great depth of flavor with cranberry, cherry, leaves and some toasty oak. A great wine.

From the Vancouver vivino Brunello tasting. Groans echo across the room when the well regarded Fuligni was revealed to be our "last place" wine. 

In hindsight it was by no means the "worst" (they were all great) but it was the least ready to be opened. After an hour decant it was still really tight giving  off a bit of earthiness. Suitable for aging. 

If you're sitting on these don't worry you haven't wasted your money. It just needs to rest a little while longer.

From my last experience I gave this bottle another two years in the cellar and a 6-8 hour decant. It’s good but not at the level I was hoping/expecting. Over powering acidity and lacking fruit. I’m not as confident with this getting much better with age, however I could very well be wrong. Fingers crossed.

Surprisingly, this came dead last in the Vancouver gang's BdM tasting. Again, nothing wrong with this textbook Brunello. On any given night, anything can happen. 

Unyielding after a 1+ hr decant, I sniffed smoky, earthy aromas which opened up with more airtime. Medium body, high acidity, grippy tannins hiding its red & black fruits suggest this has a bright future. Just like the Ciacci and the Costanti, I'm bullish on this bottle though the price tag is a bit steep, making the QPR relatively unattractive.

A  clear medium garnet wine in appearance.

The wine is clean on the nose with a medium+ intensity. Aroma notes include cherry, cocoa, tea leaf, flinty minerals, vanilla and violets.

On the palate the wine is dry with medium+ acidity, medium+ tannin, high alcohol, full body, medium flavor intensity and a medium+ finish. 

Flavour notes include cherry, tea leaf, cocoa and flinty minerals.

2010 Brunello Horisontal
#7: Still youthful-ish and very fruit driven

This stood out a bit in the line-up. More youthful than many of the others. Very fruit driven. Where was the leather and earth?

High tannins. High acidity. Full body. Long finish as expected.

I’ll say it will peak in 5-10 years. Looking forward to revisit. Big 4*! 



(Backlog review)

This was my least favorite brunello of the 6 and the group agrees

The nose is very closed even after going back to it several times to double check in 40 mins of tasting. 

Old wolrd classic brunello nose of vanilla wood, dark sour cherries, a hint of smoke. 

Chewy but closed on the nose.

Soft and luscious tannin strucure with high tannin and medium plus acid
Sour cherries tobacco finish . 

91-92 pts me
This was one of the hardest to score as it is very closed. 

98 suckling
96 WE
94 galloni 
92WS

While many 2001 Brunellos are still closed, tight or austere - especially the Riservas- and require more aging, the Fuligni normalle is simply singing.

The perfume and aromas from decanting give you an idea of what's to come. Cherries, little red berries, gummy bears, spices, tobacco and leather. Some tertiary notes add to this developed vino.

The palate is delicate and refined with a dry finish. Great texture and balance. Bravo! +8.5:/10

No detailed notes on this Brunello as it was briefly tasted out of Mike’s glass. (We had a problem with a bottle that had no replacement, so only 50% of the audience was poured this wine) Powerful and fresher fruit than expected.

👁: Medium brick
👃: Pronounced aroma of fallen leaves, forest floor, leather, tobacco, clove, cinnamon, dried fruit, cured meat, caramel, mint, 
👅: Dry. Medium bodied, very ripe, rich tannin. Tannin spikes when breathed. High acidity. Medium alcohol. Strong intensity and long finish. Very well aged. At its height or past the peak!
4.3

Balanced, soft, well structured, harmonious and persistent on the palate. Opaque and dark garnet color; On the nose it releases complex aromas of ripe red fruits, in jam, tobacco, tertiary such as leather, vanilla, smoke, earthy and herbaceous; On the dry palate, it has medium body, accentuated acidity, integrated wood with 14.5% alcohol and fruit, active tannins and satin texture. Silky, intense, powerful, elegant, pleasant and very persistent finish.

Another stunner from our Italian wine night. It's really hard to go wrong with Brunello!

Smooth, with a mix of fruit and earth notes. Cherry, smoke and mushrooms (maybe?).

Perfectly balanced, with a full body and round palate. Medium finish and interesting evolution as we drank through the evening: opening up and evolving perceptibly as the night grew late. Decant and enjoy!

95/100, this wine surprised me during a Top Tuscany 2006 tasting. What a finesse and elegance. First time I tasted Fuligni but this was a nice surprise. Blackberries, forrest fruit, vanilla and chocolate mousse, light spices but everything in harmony.
I will buy.

Highly recommended. I thought this one was just wonderful. Cherry, raspberry, tobacco, leather, plum and menthol. Full bodied with medium tannins and acidity. A great finish that really begged you to take another sip. Very, very close to 5 ⭐️

91/100. Opaque crimson. Fragrant nose of dried flowers, pencil lead and black cherries. Concentrated. Black fruit, leather and smoke on the palate. In balance and no obvious heat as a result of the especially warm vintage.

Had the chance to enjoy this Brunello during a tasting and it was simply brilliant. Deep, amber red colour combined with deep and powerful nose of cherry, leather, smoke and liquorice. Bold body, with a well rounded medium tannins and acidity. Outstanding complexity on the palate, offering plum, leather, tobacco on the front and sour cherry with cedar hints leading towards a velvety dry ending. Generally, a fantastic proposal, which comes slightly more expensive than it should be. A must try. 4.6⭐️

Fragrant and mature nose with leather, cherry and tobacco aromas. Medium-full body. Fresh, intense and energetic. Silky, well-integrated tannins. Some sweetness. Lovely harmony and complexity. Very stylish. Positive finish.
Quite tart in relation to fruit. Medium body and medium plus acidity. Not my style of Brunello, although stunning tipica on the nose.
The age on this vintage seems older than 6 years I thought. I got lots of oak, leather and cranberry, raspberry, currant. Pretty earthy.
M NI, ripe red fruit, black fruit, spice, fruity sweet palate, a bit VA, m+ acidity, m chewy tannin and bit of oak tannin, m body and finish
oct 2020. teo bday part 1. one of the trio of 2015 italian. edged it. super integration, smooth and silky. really awesome bdm
Bursting with ripe cherries but grounded by some vanilla and earthiness. Lively tannins balanced with a good level of acidity. 🐺 score 8/10
Just perfect. A balanced taste and lovely after taste!
Wow - Amazing floral nose. One of the most delicious Brunellos I’ve ever had.
leather cherry oak earthy raspberry mushroom
amazing wing with zing! simple another 8 Brunello after this one but never got the same sensation
Nice. Earthy. Not super complex on the palate
very good. dried fruit. prune, plum, cherry, rose, mint, anise, licorice, cinnamon, dried leaves, earthy. quite heavy tannin but smooth.

A fantastic Brunello themed seafood feast with some friends.
Ruby.  Nose of black fruit.  Touch of blue.  Good bramble and earth.  Leather and spice with a touch of smoke.  Palate is tart cherry, vanilla with nice fine silky tannins.  Bolder and has more complexity as the night ended.  WOTN.  4.3⭐️

£54 retail £179 in the lovely Duddells near the Shard, (best Cantonese food in London btw, truely, and the wife’s overall favourite London restaurant for lunch/brunch.)  Great nose (dirty but not filthy Italian farmyard with a few bodies buried close by), lovely dry taste.

7.10.2017 - Another one with lively floral notes on the entry with some earthiness .. lightish mouthfeel with good acidity and tannins  .. all four BdM opened so far today were all relatively light in my books and seemed at odds with what I expected warm vintages BdM to be like  ..  but then this is just my 2 cents worth

WE95 JS95 WS92 WA92

Brief notes @ TongWoh Brunello Tasting

3.8 / 5 ⭐️ by me!
95 James Suckling
95 Wine Enthusiast
92 Wine Spectator 

🍇  100% Sangiovese

👃🏽earth, tobacco, spice, tannins & red fruit flavors! 

🍷experts recommend drinking between 2022 to 2032! Not surprising its 2015 counterpart is $150 more expensive.

🌅 burgundy red 

👅👄 dry, full bodied, leather, earth, spice, plum and tobacco!

🥗 with high ABV, this makes it a great pairing to game meat 🍖  veal, lasagna bolognese, pasta and filet mignon.

Cheers 🍷

92+/ Traditional expression of Sangiovese aged for 18m in barrels shows ripe cherries and strawberries, cassis, red rose and violets with hints of mocha, cedar, coffee and tobacco. Violets again, camphor and anised and earthy notes. Fruit and spicy, intense and depth. Welcome to Italy

This is a dry red wine made from the Sangiovese grape, grown in Tuscany, Italy. Aromas of oak, chocolate, red cherry and leather. 
Medium-bodied with notes of red fruit, oak and chocolate on the palate. 
Generous finish with well-balanced firm tannins and  crisp acidity.

Wow an amazing brunello. Red berries, blackberries, leather, smoke, dark spices. The palate is rich and full bodied, with high rich tannins and low acidity. Very good indeed, can age for years longer.

A little disappointed by this wine. In general I think Brunello is a bit overrated and way too often I feel like I end up overpaying for a wine that really doesn't bring much excitement to the table. So, knowing that Fuligni is a BIG name in Tuscany, I was very eager to try something BIG! And big it was - powerful and corpulent indeed! It actually tastes good - I like the wine. Not "over-oaked" which many Brunello's tend to be. Still, WAY to pricy. Not something I would recommend paying +60 Euro for!

4.2 - 90 min double decant. Deep garnet color, with a slightly rusty rim. Blackberry, wild strawberry, poppy seed, leather, and tar on the classic BdM nose. Very smooth, dry palate. Firm, full, low intensity tannins on the longish finish.

In the glass ruby red.
On the nose ripe cherries, strawberries, fragrant with mocha and touch of oak.

Palate has great grip, fruit less prominent and touch darker, cedar, earth, coffee and tobacco, grippytannins, great acidity. Needs some time.

Thicker black fruit with a soft camphor jam. Pleasantly fragrant. Stronger on the palate. Softens out toward end. Some deep cherry leather to finish. Tannins are fairly tight still. Will definitely get more interesting as it ages.

The purity of fruit on the nose is perfection with cherries, crushed raspberries, mineral, pumice and citrus fruit. Dust, too. Full body. Powerful, chewy tannins. So long and muscular, yet polished and formed.

Nose is ripe red cherry and strawberry with vanilla. Same on the palate with hints of black pepper on the finish. Acid is nicely structured. Slightest leather and cedar. Texture is light but so flavorful. Great now but know it’ll be great with some more years age.

I have some sort of a brunello phase right now and this 2012 vintage Fuligni only intensifies it. So dark, so earthy and intense, with smoke, cedar, cherry and blueberry. And surprisingly, this 2012 vintage feels mature enough to enjoy now.

92 - Cherry, plum, spice and tobacco flavors are the themes in this rich, grainy red, which is well integrated, with a vibrant feel. Accents of earth and leather emerge on the finish.

Solid and harmonious !!
Tada!!🍷🍷💃🏻

Nose had elegant hints of ripe blackberries and worn leather. Top note had slight vanilla. Palate was delightful, reminiscent of plum and minimal astringency. Color was a vibrant maroon. Will do great with further aging.

Magnum P.I. Theme (Ian Freebairn-Smith) Drank this from a magnum which increased the impression of richness of this wine even more. It’s a good vintage that already can be enjoyed without much decanting today, offering a garnet color and typical aromas of cherries, currants, spice and licorice. The mouth feel is silky, elegant and round with flavors of sweet cherries, strawberries and dark chocolate, balanced by surprisingly fine tannins. Splendid Brunello!

Phenomenal.  It opens with rich cherry and red fruit flavors, before more sophisticated notes like leather and licorice join on the palate.  Just a fantastic taste all around.  We enjoyed this with pesto linguine at an Italian restaurant; even without decanting, it was superb.  10.4.18

Intense and complete.  Already coming into balance.  Mouth filling and complex. Plum, ripe blackberries, leather, smoke, dried flowers and tobacco.  In a few years , this will be an amazing bottle. Drink or hold.

Benvenuto Brunello 2020: This 2015 was a real winner from a boutique producer of 30K bottles a year. 

This had interesting cherry and oak tones, but with an intriguing smoke profile. On the palate again cherry, red fruit, and smoke oak with bright acidity. Stringent, yet balanced with a smoothness and elegance. A bit high on price at €60 at the cantina. The vineyard sits just outside of the city on northeast quadrant where the terroir is clayey marl alternated with masses of alberese (clay-limestone)🍷🍇

Really good BdM 🇮🇹

Full mature and ready to drink after 1 hour of aeration.  Herbs and balsamic on the nose.  Red fruit, anise on the palate. Medium body and acidity.  91 pts

2020 tasting; Very nice. But really need time in the glass. Think its not ready to be opened yet.

A beautiful Brunello at maturity. The 2012 is not the very best vintage for this wonderful wine, but with some age on it now, it drank beautifully. Opens with black currant and cherry, then draws out to a long lingering finish of cedar and ash. Absolutely lovely.

Enjoyed in a magnum, flavours softened up over the hour or so if drinking.  Started out dry with leather, oak, dark chocolate, vanilla, and finished much smoother and ever so slight jam. All together wonderful wine and could / should go another 20 years.

This is tremendous! Garnet and clear in the glass. On the nose, mostly cocoa and red licorice. Medium bodied to full bodied. Luscious on the palette with rich round red fruit, dried leaves, tobacco, cocoa and vanilla. Exceptional integration and smoothness. In my opinion, faultless and probably my favorite Brunello.

Color dress Purple rain on and in the glass 🍷👃: An expressive nose with notes of red fruit (berry, strawberry, raspberry).👅 On the palate we find an expressive, balanced wine, with aromas of cherry, stewed strawberry. Aged five months in steel, 36 months in Slavonian oak. Six months in bottle.

Opened young, this is an approachable wine, medium color and body, nice oak and high acidity but in fairly good balance. Not a 100 point wine for me but it will definitely improve with time in bottle.

Lea & Sandeman. 4y6m.
C: Pale garnet
N: Med+ intense & complex, high clarity. Cherry, raspberry, sweet tobacco, cinnamon, pepper, clove, dried herbs & earthy potpourri. Less floral, spice & complex than riserva but still engaging.
P: Cherry, vanilla -> dried herbs, minerals, exotic spices -> chocolate raspberry & cedar. Long, high conc & acid, med+ bod & grainy tannins. Needs much more time to integrate, a high quality & well balanced BdM. 2024-2036. 91p.

Deep ruby in the glass.

'15 vintage JS100: this small winery makes wines w/ incredible finesse & intensity. Winemaker law professor Roberto Guerrini. Purity of fruit, w/ cherries, crushed raspberries, mineral, pumice & citrus fruit, dust. Full body. Powerful, chewy tannins. Structured.
12/18 Praelum tasting@GIC

3.9pts. I haven’t tasted many Brunellos but this 100% Sangiovese impressed me. Not sure if i was influenced by the 💯pts scored by a critic but I preferred this to the more esteemed riserva (scored ard 3.5pts). Bold aromas of dark fruits and pencil shavings, n yet, on the palate, it is light on its feet. A firm resolute structure of bold tannins equally matched by a fresh and M+ acidity. Beguiling for such a young wine. Almost a 4.0pts.

Clear medium garnet color. Clean, developing, medium intensity nose of red cherry, cranberry, dried oregano, leather and earth. Dry, medium alcohol, medium+ tannin, high acid and full body. Medium+ intensity flavors of red cherry, leather and earth on the velvety palate leading to medium+ length finish. Beautifully balanced. Very good. Drink now, but potential to age.

Pale garnet color. Medium - nose sour cherry, dried thyme and red licorice. High acidity. Medium + tannins. Medium full body. Cedar, cherry, thyme, dried cranberry. Complex and long finish. Dirty earthy mushroom with dried cranberry and cherry. 4.2⭐️ balanced and powerful, yet earthy notes. Drink now or hold.

Solid Brunello! Ruby red/garnet in appearance with light tears on the glass. The nose showcases aromas of cherry, raspberry jam, earth, musty cellar, and a hint of floral bouquet. Flavors on the palate include cherry, cranberry, underbrush, charred earth, and a hint of iron. Medium-bodied with bright acidity, medium (-) tannins, and a lengthy finish. Definitely enjoy this with food and give it some air.

Initially very incoherent with a dominating bell pepper note. Fortunately, after 2-3 h this vanished completely. Intensely aromatic nose of raspberry perfume, orange peel, camphor and nutmeg. On the palate the raspberries again take center stage backed by a high-toned acidity and licorice, mocca, and black pepper complexities. The finish displays amazing intensity without any heavyness. Beautiful BdM that's just entering it's drinking window.

This wine has so concentrated and clear cherries, so that it's difficult to stop taking in this nice aromas. In addition you find sweet herbs, aromatic tobacco and hints of leather. On the palate it's still too young but it's super elegant and it's very well structured. One of those wines that you just want to have in your wine cellar.

Great brunello but losing 1/2 star on value for me. Nice red fruits with dark cherry, raspberry and strawberry. Earthy secondaries with subtle smoke, tobacco and leather. Silken tannins with nice long finish.

The Fuligni shows another different face of the 2007 vintage. This time it is an impregnable fortess that is only giving up some primary fruit, earth and oak aromas. Dense and structured on the palate. This one will take at least a few years to reveal its secrets.

A very nice Brunello with cooked cherries and a wonderful funk. Slate, earth, but tannins still a bit aggressive. Has years of aging left and will only get better. Get this and cellar it for your children.

Ripe and full bodied at 14.5% alcohol. Tannins have settled but still present, needs food. Cherry and red fruit with spice, dried flowers and spicy notes. Went well with a lamb starter and a duck main course on St Patrick's Day.

I'm managing the kitchen while everyone enjoys the foods & wines... this one almost got past me! French oak? Great color- almost garnet. Some spice, vanilla, & chocolate. A lot going on here. Higher alcohol but it achieves a good balance. Long finish... oh yeah

Pale garnet color with some hints of copper. Clean, light to medium intensity in the nose with notes of smoke, tree bark, earth & some rust. Low to medium acidity & tannins. Light bodied with flavors of dried figs, dried apricots with an aftertaste of pecans and dried mint. Very nice wine!

Slightly mahogany taint already. Heavy nose of bitter cherries, Provence herbs, wet earth and something deep, dark and licorice and olive-like. Then just a slight hint of eucalyptus. Most of the fruit has gone. On the palate it is equally deep and bitter. Soft tannins and medium acidity. I personally prefer a fresher style of Brunello. A good effort considering the vintage but this is not a Brunello for the long haul. Drinking well now or for the next 10 or so years. 92-94p

Another great Brunello, black cherries, wet dirty, licorice, tannins are vivid, acidity that makes my palate swing. Fresh very long finishing. Ready now, better in few years. Salute amici! 🇮🇹🇮🇹🍷🍷RP 92 pts.

ITALIAN CHRISTMAS GIFT

No pretension. We didn't decant and I was still wild about the entire experience. Gracious presence of vanilla and anis in the nose, extractions of ok, truffle and cinnamon/date in the elegant body. The finish was far from standard Italian emotional tannic breakdowns. Effortless dropoff. Wonderful food wine.

Decent brunello but not worth the price. You can do better. Beautiful Italian tint/ rustic color. Red fruit dominant with cherries and maybe some plum. Nice spice/acidic profile here. Medium minus tannins. My guess was that it had to be Italian, had to be Sangiovese, I went with Chianti. Thought Chianti as it was a very drinkable acidic wine. Didn’t blow me away and not worth $62. 4 star wine that’s lower on the price adjusted scale

Amazing! Leather, tobacco and hay on the nose. Maraschino big time! Red fruit w strawberry and raspberry. Orange and star fruit. Just an amazing wine. Tannins are present but very very drinkable at this time. I am sure this wine will just get better and better. Monster finish. Paired it with a Asian inspired grilled strip steak and was perfect.

Still very young, but drinking well now.
On the nose black cherries, licorice, oak, toasted wood, raspberries jam, vanilla, blackberries jam.
The palate has fresh acidity, very good concentration, without being heavy, firm, ample and young tannins that are elegant despite the thigh structure.
The fruit is still fresh, the palate still tight, this will take another 5 years to reach its peak perhaps?
Great work from Fuligni! Highly Recommend.

This wine is a clear med garnet.

The nose is clean & pronounced. Aromas of red cherry, raspberry, vanilla, clove, leather, balsamic, earthy & dried herbs.

The palate is dry with med + acidity and high alcohol. The tannins are med + and very smooth. It has a med + body and a long finish. Med + intensity that follows from the nose, it is very herbal.

Outstanding quality wine. It is very complex and is very herbal. The acidity keeps it refreshing. Drinking now, could age a few more years but in a good spot.

4.2 stars. Strong nose of red berry, red plum aroma. Still tannic and may need more ageing. Dry, high acidity, medium plus body, medium alcohol, high tender tannin. The palate also showed flavor of prune and hints of mint.

Perfect wine to our New Years Dinner! The red / brownish color shows its age. Nose of ripe cherries, with layers of earthy notes like leather, forest and tomatoes. Seductive hints of vanilla and caramel. Very nice texture on the palate blanching the acidity and the smooth tannins.

Outstanding. Medium to full bodied, smooth and well balanced in all its characteristics. It has pleasant tannins with a long finish and moderate acidity. With touches of smoked oak, leather, cassis and cherries.

Perle italiane vers.3 #8 served by @[1|992691|Marc Engels], now on instagram as @ dacellardweller. 
The first contact is very intense and so unbelievable balanced, it's all about elegance, depth and complexity uplifted through overwhelming power with still grippy but balanced tannins and dito acidity framed with overripe red and dark fruits. It offers such an unbelievable lenght of more than 40 seconds, no more words needed. Top stuff.
5🌟

A truly excellent wine; jammy, plummy, yet wonderfully rustic at the same time with a medium dry finish. Extremely complex, with layers of flavour and a floral overtone. This wine is very integrated and quite special.
Exquisite!  Light and fruit forward...strawberry and cherry.  Earthy tones with mature red color.  Will definitely buy more and this is a great wine.
Hmm guess it needs more time - both to open in glass, but also in bottle 5-10 years i guess
4,25. Really special. Strawberry, mushroom, balsamico.

Lovely nose, light red cherries, well balanced but evident tannins in the background.

Very smooth; great drinking wine and can hold its own with or without food.

Let this baby breathe for at least a couple hours before drinking.....it needs to spread its wings. Lovely colour and gentle flavours 2/3 of the way, it’s a little tight on the back end but pair it with food and this isn’t an issue. I’d recommend waiting another 24 months.

Classic Brunello, very likeable with lots of tannins but also notes of fruit, vanilla and wood. It has great structure, probably due to the fact that it has matured in barrique only (ie not in steel tanks). I did miss a little more depth but this may well be due to its young age. This wine will only become better in the next ten years.

This was the second wine in my arsenal last night. I absolutely love this winery...
This bad boy I needed to decant...he apparently needed a little room to breath. While we waited (an hour) someone at our table thought we should all have a round of Manhattans to pass the time...which turned into 2...not the best of ideas.
However, when our attention was returned he did not disappoint in fact he was amazing. Earthy grippy tannins & dark dusty fruit. A little sweet, a little bitter...completely perfect

Medium ruby color. Surprisingly few signs of bricking. Scents of chocolate, cherry, tea leaf on the nose with a slight sweetness. Cherry dominates on the palate, with some leather, chocolate, caramel, nut, and fig notes. Medium plus tannins persist with good acidity. Medium finish. 13.5% abv. Good structure but doesn't *quite* drink like a brunello.

Have not tried this wine maker before so thought it's good to have a go with a 2008 vintage after a night of Australian wines. This is a really easy going, forward fruity and atypical Brunello, totally unexpected especially when it starts tasting somewhat jammy after a while, probably I am still influenced by the earlier wines tasted!

Probably a 4.25 star wine. Needs some time to open up but nose is a bit tight. Opens with mixed red berry fruit, and some leather notes. This is a cracker and even in terrible holiday glassware it has performed! Super nose of oil, leather and winter fruit. Happy Any Day Every Day Brunello Day everyone.

Nice almandine garnet red with gentle jarositic reflections, it offerd aromas of plum, cherry, leather, and anise.

The palate had evolving tannins over the two days it took to empty the bottle with a medium attitude at the end maintaining a medium high acidity. 
Berry, spices and notes of leather as flavors. 

Paired with beef filet, carrot purée and zucchini ribbons

From Magnum. Clear, medium red brick.  Clean. Intense nose. Lots of primary; cherry, old leather dried cranberry, dried oregano lighty toasted almond Integrated but very clean nose. Juicy upfront, full silk body, lt+ rounded acid lt delicate tannin. Lt alcohol. Super long. Great flavor concentration and balance. Love. Elegant AF. Drank at Mercato San Lorenzo in Florence.

This is a big bold rich Brunello - darker black fruit than expected with some red cherry mushroom tobacco wet leaves etc. A smooth dry wine with great acidity and spicy finish - quite intense. Aged in barriques (30% new) for twelve months and then in larger Slavonian casks for three years. A very nice Montalcino but for the money I prefer the lighter cherry styled Brunello’s than this style albeit I won’t complain if some one is pouring me this again :-) 🍷

Medium garnet color

Complex nose of wild strawberry, black currant, oak, leather seats in a new car, mint, dried herbs, cinnamon, violet, and tobacco.

Flavors of sour cherry, blackberry, plum, vanilla, licorice root, cocoa powder, and tar.

Medium+ fine tannins, medium ++ lively acidity, and good balance, even in its youth.  The nose is more impressive than the taste but both are great.  This is a complex and quality Brunello.

Rating: 92-93

This Brunello has some promise. Drank this with our cacio e Pepe and beef tenderloin. After 2 hours of decanting and double aeration, this bottle was ready to enjoy. 

It was a medium ruby in the glass. The nose showed cherry, tobacco, leather, cedar, smoke, vanilla, thyme, and cocoa. Very intense aromas!

In the mouth, this wine had a medium silky smooth body, with medium plus tannin and medium plus acidity; moderate alcohol at 13.5%, and a long dry finish. 

Enjoyable, but needs time. Cheers!

4.2/5.0

Italian Summer Wines - Try it Before you buy it Tasting at Dante in Omaha with Kim, Andrea & Tricia 7/31/22. From Kelsey Kessel with Republic. Sangiovese similar to the chianti, but ages well so could sit another 20 to 30years. Named after bandit in 12th century that led to the rebellion of Montalcino. 94 points by James Suckling & Wine Spectator. Nose of sour cherries, raspberry, tea & earth. On the palate, red fruit with violet, black cherry, earth & tobacco on lengthy finish. $71

The Italian answer to fine Bordeaux. Ruby red. Nose of sour cherry with a suggestion of richness. On the palate we get beautifully balanced cherry fruit, fine tannins, well integrated oak, strong acidity - this is Italy not France - and a harmonious finish. Lovely wine and not a French grape in sight. The true Super Tuscan. Delicious.

Lovely Brunello with enveloping aromas of eucalyptus, dried violets, red fruit like strawberries and cherry, followed by leather  and coupled with that ever present earthy or barnyard aroma I love in italian wines. The palate is simple but long and doesn't leave you wanting. From fresh strawberry and cherry, to sweet balsamic, tanned leather, clay pot and plenty of nutty vanilla. Lovely medium plus body and acidity with just more than medium tannins that add elegance and structure to long, dry finish.

4.2⭐️. 2-hr decant. Medium garnet color. Nose: black cherry, oak, new leather, violets & distant coffee. Mouth: black cherry, medium+ acid & sharp tannins. Long finish of dark fruit & leather.

ABV 13.5%. Temp controlled ferment in SS. Spont and malolactic fermentation. 2-yr in 30L oak casks & 2-yr in bottle. Hey, it’s Brunello! Very good.

100 % Sangiovese. Looks like the NATO flag on the label. Expressive with dark, fleshy morello fruit. Tobacco, blackberries and leathery spices. Chewy, salty Licorice on a weighted palate. Well integrated oak. ABV: 13,5 %, TA: 5,6 g/L, RS: < 3 g/L. NOK 556 @ VMP. No further details taken. Drank @ Vininor tasting, Marg & Bein

Nice clear with orange highlights. Skinny fast curtains. An absolutely smashing Sangiovese bouquet. On the palate: Pure, clean, dry and delicious. Not value at 400kr (if you buy 6) but what the heck! My highlight at the Tuscany wine dinner at Vin & Vin.

4+
Grapes: sangiovese
At nose is complex and fascinating thanks to cherry, raspberry, earth, leather, tobacco leaves and black pepper.
In mouth very lively acidity, tannins are still young but elegant, good body. Overall balanced. Long final with pleasant fruity notes.

After 5 years it is still young.

Very nice wine! Nicely structured, moderate and smooth tannins. Loved the fruit on the nose and palate from cherry to strawberry. Finish was medium in length. Nothing to see but a wonderful brunello di montalcino! (But ya’ll knew that I’m sure!)
Fresh raspberry and cranberry flavours with fresh, thirst quenching acidity. Long lingering finish. A fine wine 4.3
Hadn’t been stored properly and had probably been left too long, but still very tasty. Red cherry, blackberry, redcurrant, vanilla, blackcurrant leaves, plum, oak, round tannin.
Medium-bodied, semi-dry with a smooth finish given the oaky notes. Very good wine, long smooth finish and would recommend.
Very good Brunello. Dry, high acidity, high alcohol, medium+ tannins and body, pronounced intensity of flavour with lots of berry, earth, game and leather notes. Long finish!
This is Brunello at its best and at a good price.
Mixed nose earthy with dark fruit .  Notes of blackberry and mushrooms , acidic with medium tannins.
Smoooth, but tart
Decent young Brunello that will definitely get better with time. Had it with lunch at the fabulous Roscioli Salumeria.

Light and well balanced. 
Gaetanos.  Excellent.
Never heard of this one but perfect expression of Brunello. Great balance. Cherry, oak, leather. Jam. Superb.

Exceptional quality wine! This was enjoyed with a deer from mid norway. 
This wine has perfect balanced tannins and strong dark fruits, with a soft spicey taste before a silky end. 
Top quality!
That was a great bottle. Smooth and round body. Everything was in the right place. Combination of “old wardrobe” and light fruits taste at its best.
Gawd I love Brunello. Pretty acid and balance. Nice fruit remaining, great structure, high acid and a bit of heat. Tertiary characters starting to show - olives, leather, and espresso.
Awesome
Marvelous gift from my son from Italy!Very enjoyable for drinking with a nice steak or on its own. Absolute top quality at a decent price.
Cherry, tobacco, leather, plenty of long-lasting fruit. High acidity, nice balanced tannins. Excellent.
Not bad but it’s flagrantly more tannic and acidic than other Brunellos I tasted plus, it’s better in the nose than it is in the mouth. JS95, his best rating among the last 13 vintages.
A perfect Brunello, with 15%vol a real dream! Don’t miss it at Lucas ‘Sunset Bar’
Well balanced wine with medium bodied. The beautiful label got my intention and it can represent the taste of the wine. It seems uncomplicated but there’s something.

Deep garnet colour, not entirely clear. Appears to be over the hill. 
Beautiful nose, luckily. Fruit still in there. Well alive, and in great shape actually!
Full body. Holds up very nicely, very smooth. 
Very long finish.

Wonderful! Very much what you'd expect and want from a good Brunello: light brick red in the glass, tar, leather and spices on the nose, followed by a well balanced palate - acidity and tannin complimenting notes of cherry, oak and plum.

4.3pts.
Tenuta San Giorgio
Ugolforte Brunello di Montalcino 2009.
The Ugolforte named after a famous bandit who in the twelfth century led the revolt of the inhabitants of Montalcino against the occupation of Siena. 
I don't know if it has anything to relate with the name, but this wine is very elegant, sophisticated and modern.
Aroma from red cherry, prune,  plum, raspberry, cinnamon, balsamic, leather and  chocolate.

4.3*

Haven't had many Brunello at this point...but this is super elegant for one!

Showing some garnet colour at 11 years.

Nose of fresh leather, red cherry, plum, baking spices.

Palate is elegance: mostly the nose, but adds tart cherry and strawberry.

Dry, M+ alcohol, medium everything else. Popped at 4pm, and is fading at 10pm in a decanter. Fantastic!

Tasted blind and I was like "omg.. what's this wine, I want to make love to it, it must be Italian, omg is it a super Tuscan... no no, it's a Brunello" -- and then I rejoiced. $55 is  a great price point for this bottle. Tobacco, vanilla, sour cherry, cloves on the nose. Can easily drink now, don't think it can age more then a few more years.

First offering notes of underwood, dried mushrooms followed by savory scents of baked raspberry and worn leather.
The palate is voluminous and smooth, this is rather a feminine version of a Brunello ( it actually feels more like a Barolo) with lots of ripe cherry fruit,plum , mint and a whiff of pipe tobacco.
Of great structure, silky and truly polished and elegant.
The aftertaste is impressively long lasting with a pleasant warmth!

An absolutely fantastic nose, deep red fruit, earth, truffle. Palate after a few hours of air is very concentrated, potent dark fruit, superlength, black cherries, earth. Fantastic. Probably at its peak right now.

Excellent! In the glass it's lively tawny red and it shows an high consistency. In the nosr It features a large variety of flavors which starts from overmature red fruits, cherry jam and ends in ethereal hints passing by very elegant spices, toasted flavors, herbs and a touch of earth.
In the mouth it confirms its value. Full-bodied, balanced, intense and very lingering. A textbook wine!

This is a spectacular wine. It is old world heaven. I am only drinking this instead of water. It has perfect balance with oak with blackberry and is a perfect Italian wine. Sara says it is like butter. Sara says tobacco and blackberry also.

91/100 Ruby red with a brick edge., Cherry, tomato twigs, blood, rust, leather and perfume of violet. 
Velvety tannins nice fine acids. Length and palate with fine balance. 
Pleased to get this after years of cellaring this rather inexpensive wine.

This wine is so complex. Having a hard time breaking it down. On the nose: plum, cranberry, spice box, slight notes of tobacco, anise, leather, violet and minerals. On the palate, near perfect balance. Cranberry and tobacco are there and the spice box presents itself as well (thinking from some French oak). As mature as it is, it will continue to evolve. There is still obvious tannin. I'll say I was dreading the end of this bottle. Could drink this for days. Just stunning wine.

Tried it at home. Just a bit better - more fresh and not so developed than the one tried in Montalcino ! Bottle variation for sure. Superb 09! Great fruit and confit of cherries. Super balanced and great acidity and tannins.
Needs more time to calm down and develop finesse (acidic character). Vanilla, oak, leather, smoke and a raspberry  note on top. Too classical for me.
Magnum bottle of nice wine
Real nice brunello. Great body and round tannins enough tannins to make it a bit jammy. 4.25
Great Brunello - maturing nicely👍
Needed 1.5 hours more to breathe but very nice
Wonderful soft mellow a treat at our friend’s. Thank you
Cherry, with leather, tobacco and oak
A brilliant brunello with a beautiful finish
Full bodied, oaky red italian. Amazing with my pizza.

4.2/5

Comes in fruity, big tannins, high acidity
Lovely lovely wine…a pleasure to drink
Light to medium body. Very crisp acidity but well balanced. A good wine for food.
Great wine packed with flavours and dimensions
Full bodied red with quite some tannines, definitely could do with some aging.
Very good, unexpected, need to retry
Light body, lots of funk. Not my favourite brunello, but I’ll definitely finish the bottle!
Very good 2015 brunello. Decanted for 4 hours. Would definitely buy again
Taste of a perfect vintage. Ready to drink riiiight now! Blackcurrant and cherry 🤤
Middle ground BdM, a nice pair with Pastitsio.
Wonderful. Very accessible and all you would expect from a good vintage.
Solid 4.0. Perfect with Italian food.
Good Brunello, a little bit soft but good. 👍
My taste was off today. Was good but didn't stand out as something special today.

Rose petals on cherry nose, light body, cranberries with citrus skin tannins, nice long dry finish
Tasted at the Sangiovese Reset 2020 tasting in London.

Blackberry on the nose and up front with some sweetness of plum, cherry, and boysenberry. Unfortunately it doesn’t carry though to the body and the flow or gives way quickly to thin structure with a harshly oak ed pecan shell and pencil shavings finish.

Dark plum predominating on the nose, with a hint of smokiness. This slightly brownish tinged red colored 2015 full bodied Montalciano on the palate showed strong tannin, which dissipated nicely with breathing, resulting in a balanced quite dry plum, cassis, the tannin somewhat smoothed out, and slight soil characteristics discernable. I believe it is at or just past it peak now.

Very fruit forward nose of cherry and raspberry with just enough fresh tobacco and earthy qualities to keep it interesting. Refreshing on the palate, medium bodied with dusty tannins, firm acid, and more fruity flavors. Medium+ finish that calls back earthy flavors.

A Brunello that stands out from the crowd. All the expected cherry fruit in a well structured wine with a long finish. Add to that hints of orange and anise in a very nice glass. Drink now or keep for another ten years.

Garnet in color. Pronounced aromas of blackberry and dark cherry. Missing the complexity of a good Brunello. Medium finish with a bit of leather and pronounced tannins. A decent Sangiovese, but missing complex flavors of a good Brunello.

Decided to go for a Brunello after requesting a couple of SuperTuscans that were out of stock (Strangely,  restaurant recommended some Chianti Classico and Rosso di Montalcino when the Super Tuscans where not available)

I much preferred a Brunello for our steak! 2009 and aged to perfection.
A good spot between primary and tertiary notes. Developing nicely

Black cherries. Potpourri. Worn leather. Dry earth with gravel. Forest floor. Cedar. Dried roses

Drinking very young currently. Was expecting more complexity. Lacking the ripeness and depth of flavour. Notes of tart cherry, leather and prominent oak on the palate. Medium-plus structure and finish with firm tannins.

Reminded me of the wines I had with mom in Italy! Bold and lots of tannin when first opened. After decanted for 2 hours, it opened up and became super smooth. It’s fruity but not as fruity as the napa cabs. Very fragrant cedar wood smell and taste. Very zen!😌

Not what you would think of a Brunnello. Soft and ver complex. Lighter in color but just a round easy to drink experience. Almost don't want to spoil the wine with good.

Intense nose of spice, red fruit and leather. Incredible length and very smooth tannins. An absolute joy

Opulent bouquet, jammy sweet with notes of boysenberry, forest floor, spices, herbs, hay. Delicious!

Ripe sweet fruit, dry and fresh core with wood, boysenberry, raspberry. Very flavorful and complex but too ripe though. Medium bodied. Pretty finish, very dry. Aging will be beneficial.

Classic type of Brunello, red ruby color, fragrant aroma of cherry, leather, species, bold, tannic, well balanced wine with taste of berries, chocolate and mocha. Long finish. It’s ready and has potential Very good, liked it, recommend.

I am disappointed in myself. I run an Italian restaurant and I don't like Italian wines. What can I do if they just don't impress me. Italian wines are generally too dry and too tannic for me. 
I haven't had a lot of Brunellos, but this one didn't make me want to drink more either. 
The problem is that our restaurant is a Mom & Pop, get in easy, eat, go restaurant, where you wouldn't have time to decant a bottle. That is why I don't even carry good wines. I decanted it for 45 minutes. The nose was ⬇️⬇️⬇️

Plenty of acidity in this still young red that really would benefit from 4 more years to calm down.  It does open up and smooth out a bit, but needs time.  Earth, raspberry and a bit of licorice balanced in.  A tight acidic finish.

Delightful Brunello in a sweet spot right now. Fallen rose petals, violet, dried tobacco leaves and clay on the nose. Medium acidity and medium + tannins. Well balanced and nicely structured palate with hints of black cherry, red sorrel, baked portobello mushrooms and mint. Very good.

Intense, ruby red. Nose of marzipan, matured red fruit and rich, delichious barrel. Palette of intense, but balanced barrel. So complex and rich mature fruit. Character of strawberry and cherry. Balanced acidity and silky soft, integrated tannins. Long finish.

Great Brunello from a challenging year.

Maybe even 4,5. Wonderfull. Berries. Leather. Stays everywhere. Probably bought it at Eataly in Torino. Love it day before Christmaeve. Great conplexity. Just a bit strong in acids.

Quite disappointed with this. Not really much fruit to speak about the acidity is out of balance and so high it was not enjoyable. I couldn’t finish the bottle so tried it again the next day, there is now some fruit but I would describe it as generic red fruit. It has a really light mouthfeel which I appreciate. Beautiful garnet colour. Stunning, completely open nose. Tar, tobacco, cherry. Super fine mouth feel that oozes class. Tannins are perfectly refined and wine is really coming into its own. Very good.
Bold and rich. Oak and vanilla. This was a winner for me.

Nice garnet dress with mahogany trim. Highly aromatic bouquet with aromas of cherry, plum and hint of menthol. Bountiful and fruity on the palate. Full bodied and lingering finish
Even better that the 2007. Beautiful light ruby color, but definitely full-bodied. Rich aromas of cedar and cloves. Flavors of vanilla, dark cherries blended with a delightful oak finish.

Mild roasted plums and caramel on the nose.  Smooth and rich with hints of roasted dark fruit and vanilla.  Old world style.  Best at cellar temp.
Almost gave this 4.5 stars, but it just doesn't quite make it. Leathery, dried red fruit, brick, a little hot. Excellent wine.

Deep brilliant garnet colour with slight orange reflections. Ample and complexe bouquet, reminiscent of cherry, prune, mint and sweet tobacco. Very full bodied and harmonic, silky and slightly dry with impressively long and pleasantly fruity aftertaste.

Long Live Brunello - the mighty, structured 04 still feels so young and tight at 15yo. Aromas of raspberries, cigar, spices and earth are followed by a round palate with grippy tannins and a long lasting finale. Decant or keep it longer. 8/10

The first Brunello di Montalcino I’ve been lucky enough to indulge in. A night out in Florence lead me to this beautiful bouquet of aromas that ended up blissfully gliding down my throat like satin silk.

This is a "hello, where have you been all my life kind of wine." In its drinking prime, this perfectly balanced wine has mature notes of leather and tobacco leaf, with vanilla, cloves, cherry kirsch, cassis, prunes, sweet spice, and caramel.

Winally Friday and happy Sangiovese Friday! A while since I had a Brunello and had to pay my tribute to the ambassador after Rhône Tuesday! Very nice nose of dark berries, leather, stewed plum. On the palate, high acidity, smooth smooth tannins, long warm length. Palate flavours of cherry and figgy chair leather 😉!Really have to drink more Brunello! 4.1🌟!Happy Sangiovese Friday 🍷🍷🍷!

4.25 Superb Brunello, mid power but very elegant and complex. Luscious palate with a very smooth first feel of restrained power despite the impressive tanic structure. Long and powerful, just great !!!

Very fruit forward on the nose - red sour cherry and cranberry. Then the Smokey leather shows up and the black fruit jam. It finishes with the coffee, chocolate and pepper. First flavours surprisingly are the black fruit jam, followed by the coffee and chocolate and ending with the sour cherry and smoke. Pepper on the long finish with a lingering cherry on my tongue. A little acidic but not over powering.

Lovely brunello. The brightest star of Montalcino. It took 2h to open up upon aeration. Translucid cherry colour. Earthy and balsamic, round, complex and classy. Was perfect with tomato and basil bruschetta. Acidity on point, finishes long and delicious!

On the nose there are flowers, red berries, dried fruits, spice and a gentle kiss of wood. In the mouth the wine has well balanced, fresh acidity and beautiful, smooth tannins. A lovely wine indeed. 17/20 (89-92)

I think I could keep my nose in this wine all day long! Aromas of cherry, herbs, old leather, and delicate floral notes.

Smooth tannins and perfectly balanced acidity make for a beautiful glass. Cherry, plum, cedar, and earth meet the palate and linger on for a long perfect finish.

Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Bright ruby red colour with almost opulent density and the nose is filled with impeccable oak, vanilla & luscious bouquet of very well rippen plum. It is a very full bodied wine with high acidity & very powerful tannins. It is a fruit forward wine and the palate is brimming with dark fruit characteristics especially black cherry, black currant, plum, dried prunes & fig. The powerful tannins doesn’t make the wine imbalance but instead it reinforces the long lasting finish with silky & buttery tannins!
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

I like Tempranillo, so this wine I like too 😅

Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
3,8
Blend of Merlot, CF, CS, Malbec and Carmenère (~65/25/14/5/1) from Saint-Émilion Grand Cru with ~20m in 100% new FO barrels.

Deep garnet color.

Med-high intensity on the nose.
Aromas of brioche, black currant, black cherry, prune, leather, cacao, mint, coco, clay, violet, rose, cedar.

On the plate dry, high acidity, med-high tannins, alcohol well integrated, med+ body, med+ finish, some bitterness, sour sherry taste.

Mote peasant on the nose than on the palate.

Quite sour and tannic.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Dark purple color in aroma and taste primarily dark fruit in the background ripe red fruits palpable figs raisins prune notes vanilla chocolate coffee tobacco tobacco cedar smoke leather earthy pepper cinnamon dried herbs well balanced high acidity delicate slightly irritable tannin good wine with beef.  🍇🍷👍🏻😃👌🏻
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Enjoying this with my father in law this evening after he did hero duty with three jet-lagged kids and two bedraggled parents (us). Always a treat to have black sheep wine, even if a second label. My review from a few weeks back (which led me to buy a case of the 2016) still stands. Garnet in glass. Nose is quite opulent with violets and stewed black fruit, maybe even some cinnamon. Only medium to medium plus bodied, clear that 2014 was tough. High quality palate. Silky tannins with blackberries. Yum. 4.2
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
What an awesome wine. I wish I could've given it a few more years to chill out, but the 2014 is very much ready to drink now. Oak is not too stoopid, red fruit like raspberry and red plum are quite prevalent for Valandraud, which I tend to feel drinks a bit more austere. I drink a lot of 14 St. Emillion as it's my anniversary year, and I can def. Recommend this to buy and cellar OR drink. If you do drink it, tell anyone who asks you only drink 2nd wines when you're shitfaced.

Gives ya street cred.🤠

Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: So elegant! Scents of leather, oak and cherry jam. Once it has opened up fully, notes of raspberries and dark chocolate. Earthy, full bodied with a long, velvet finish
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Oaky, dry, and fairly tannic. Mild blackberry, but not overly fruity.  Excellent minerality.  What a St. Emilion Grand Cru should be.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: 4.2-4.3, interesting. Concentrated cherry in color; quality cork. Aeration makes it better rounded. Plenty of chocolate and vanilla, plum, blackberry, traces of pepper, cherry and oak on the nose. Chocolate, bitter almond, plum, fig, licorice, barrel and lots of minerals on the palate. Complex. Medium bitter-sweetened finish. Hard to think of an ideal pairing but mild cheese “works” just fine. Rather than drinking it now, I’d suggest to keep this Bordeaux in a cellar for some 20-25 years.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: The 2015 vintage deep-garnet in color with profound nose of baked cherry, black plum, blueberry, earthy, mocha, candied orange plus a hint of licorice. Big full bodied n powerful with silky smooth and muscular tannins. Lovely wine. Tasted end of April 2019. 97/100
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: A very fine wine, complex, lots of pepper when first opened. For the nose we have: pepper, plum, blackberries, oaky, earthy, some chocolate, a bit of leather, and minerals. Dry and a bit acidic. Nicely balanced with a long, smooth finish. Would definitely drink again!
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Absolutely delicious silky smooth St Émilion worthy of its grand cru classe status. Goes down a treat with rich but restrained fruits, new leather, bamboo and velvety tannins. Worth the price? Not sure. Delicious? Absolutely.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Great balanced Saint-Emillion! Rather fruity. High acidity. Strong tannin feeling. Rather strong oak feeling. Hint of blackberry or chocolate. Full body. Long and balanced finish. Smooth. Easy to drink. It was great balance and quite enjoyable although it was young. Good berry-like taste with good floral aroma came in the first attack, and then its aftertaste was long and balanced with nice earthy feeling. Rich and round. Good pairing with Japanese beef steak.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
🌟🌟🌟🌟 3/4, Another amazing wine from this winery that we enjoyed in Bordeaux this would have been a 5 if not for the other wine from here. Decanted about 20 minutes. Deep inky red in color with medium viscosity. On the nose 👃 aromas of blackberry, black fruit, leather and tobacco. On the palate 👅 bold, dry, elegant with smooth tannins and excellent structure. Flavors of black fruit, plum, leather, oak, cassis and more. Long elegant finish calling for more. For $50 it has a great QPR.

SANTE'!!! 🍷👍🤙
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
Today I was advised to try this saint Emilion in order to decide whether to add it to my en primeur order of 2018 

Passed by the local butcher, got some ribeye 🥩
Baby potatoes Cooked in butter & rosemary on the side
A tasty meal with a heavenly wine 🍷 

Deep purple
Ripe red fruits, cherries 🍒 & plums 
Juicy, rich and luscious on the palate 
Medium acidity 
Beautiful texture and velvety tannins 

Yum 😋
Well... Virginie... you are gorgeous 🤩 

Tomorrow I will be visiting my 🍷 provider again 

Bring on 2018 🍷

Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: A delicious Saint-Émilion Grand Cru blend made from Merlot (65%), CF (25%), CS (5%), Malbec (4%) & Carmenère (1%) aged for 18 to 30 mos. in new French oak barrels. Deep crimson color with purple edges. Dry, soft but bold in body, restrained tannic structure with balanced acidity & long finish. The👃offers aromas of cassis, prune, allspice, nutmeg, violet, cocoa, leather, smoke & stone. The 👅 offers all of the previously mentioned as flavors as well licorice, coffee, black pepper & chalk. 14.5% ABV. 4.3 ⭐.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Heavy dark fruit in nose with plum majoring. Hints of oak. The Malbec just hit you straight away. Layers of plums, blackberries, black currant, fudge, vanilla and leather. A long aftertaste of sweet dark fruit in a good volume and well structured wine. A charming and a really, really good example of what less "famous" houses in Bordeaux delivers. Buy this and drink NOW!
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Although our 1st choice was chateau Kirwan, although we chose St Emilion Valandraud 2014 and instead were served this one from 2016, it was tres bien! Nice mix of complex notes, acid felt only from a distance. Nice catch. oak leather earthy @[1|56129246|Tanya]
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: A big, bold, inky right bank Bdx. Big nose of dark fruit, cassis, blueberry jam, cocoa and some wet stone. Blueberries, cassis, little bit of briar, and slight herbal and mineral essences. Finish is long with still respectable tannic structure. Lovely effort and a terrific QPR on this.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
Lovely right bank Bordeaux.
Elegant and tender, still with throbbing character, it starts with warm chocolate, cocoa and vanilla in the nose, followed by dry fruits, leather and tobacco in the taste, finishing with dry but still descent tannins and rounded long a bit spicy finish. Good to be back to these enchanting kids of Garona)
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: I chose this based on the excellent ratings for St Emilion in 2016 and it did not disappoint.  This was a fabulous Bordeaux with black raspberry, currants and cassis along with nice earthy notes.  It had a long finish with just enough acidity.  We went through 2 bottles of this with dinner. I would easily buy this for my cellar.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: 2016 vintage, we knew we would open it way too young: black cherry, cassis, liquorice, thym, leather, plum on the nose, herbs and oak on the palate, acidity and tannins level each other. An excellent wine but 14.5% alc is on the upper limit
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: This is a delicious Bordeaux blend from an incredibly able team of winemakers.  Fruit forward and yet restrained and respectful.  The nose is prune allspice cocoa and stone. Later you’ll taste all of the above plus coffee and a tight chalk line that gives balance and refinement to the fruits. Love this wine and this style of Bordeaux.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: This is rich and intense with blackberry aromas. Deep purple black colour with a fair bit of oak.  Sturdy tannins and a tinge of exotic spice
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Black fruits on the nose and palate. Full body, sweet spices and abundant acidity. Just enough oak and soft tannins. Jammy finish and overall a great saint Emilion.
