Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Rubis foncé aux reflets pourpres. Thick legs. Intense arômes. Cassis, violette, boisé. Black pepper.Après agitation, note florale prononcée( violette, rose) , cassis , myrtille, mure. Very intense and pleasant floral fruity nose. Complexe nose. In mouth, attaque franche, Black fruits and structured tannins . Astringence of Young tannins. M acidity. M+ body. Long length with grilled note. Very good Wine but too Young to drink. Need to let it breath for 30 minutes .In 5-10 years will be better.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: No doubt a fantastic wine, though for me too much tannins. Features all the classic St Emillion characteristics. Very nice ling finish. Must be really plausible with venison.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Pnp, sweet ripe grapefruit, almost a meursault with finely balanced oak.  Lovely acidity that blends seemlessly with fruits, medium finish, and a really good wine to pair with food.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Deep garnet pronounced coffee, chocolate, plum, blackberry, black currant, strawberry jam, leather, wood, red cherry, high acidity, medium + tannins, full body log finish. An outstanding wine.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Licorice, plum, leather, tobacco with some peppery note. Medium bodied with multi layers and depth. Great second wine from excellent vintage.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: 91 Points, drink now until 2024. Medium deep ruby colored, perfume scents of violet, bitter almond and red berries, a little lactic, vegetables and spices, complex, oaky, medium bodied, lacking a bit substance to balance acidity and loads of wooden tannins, but overall a very good St. Emilion for the vintage that is finishing medium plus and is worth it's price. Bought at Lidl online for €19 on promotion, what a steal!

Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Definitely not bad year for this kind of wine! Nose is powerful still young and bright a lot of black fruits, plummy, dark cherries, black berries, touch of French oak, nice elegant, leader, tobacco, strong influence of oak, roach of spicies, on the palate high tannins, high acidity, full body, big bold, still very fresh fruits, plums, cedar, iodine, a bit spicy also.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
4.2 ⭐️ Noble and elegant St.Emilion.
Deep ruby in glass. The nose is quite classic with hints of tobacco, earl grey tea, oak, blackberry, mushroom, forest floor, cherry, cassis. Full body, dry, moderate acidity, velvet texture. The taste is vivid but delicate with hints of cherry, cassis, chokeberry, earl grey tea, red currant, tobacco. Tannins seem a bit unripe, are lasting and moderately intense. Overall, being enjoyable right now already, this one is yet to reach it’s peak in 4-5 years.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Light and clear purple and more ruby colour. Nose is raspberries wrapped in hints of darker fruit like plum. Fresh red fruit on the palate with a finish slightly darker with nice acidity. Deeper richness in the finish not quite blackberry but has great depth. Nice wine and a good vintage.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
Deep, dark ruby red colored wine with violet hues.
With an intense nose of ripe blackcurrant, violets, exotic spices, roasted espresso and hints of licorice, black cherry essence and creamy dark chocolate truffle shavings.
On the palate with a refined feeling, displaying fresh acidity, vibrancy and a supple tannin structure.
The finale shows rich , with a pleasant spiciness and great length!
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Valandraud’s second label. Still their standard blend of 50 merlot, 20 cab sav, 20 cab franc, Malbec/Carmenere. Could age a little more but was ready to drink and great balance. Notes of black fruit, oak.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Deep garnet color with some brick color in the rim. Tastes of cassis, dark fruits, leather, earth and a bit of tar. Well integrated tannins. Oak in moderation. Well balanced. Very nice with a long finish.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Technical drinking today and the first 2015 Bordeaux for me to start holidays. Already now a very nice nose, espresso, leather, dark chocolate, red and black cherries. Creamy tannins, polished bit still enough grip and power at the end. A very young and great 2015 St. Emilion. Modern and close to a good Pomerol. Like it! 91+ GP
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
🏅Rating: 93/100 (4,3🌟)

Deep dark red w/ purplish hue. Black cherry, blackberry, chocolate, some red berries, rocky mineral. Round tannins, med+ body. Ready to drink now & for the next 10 yrs.

2nd wine of Château de Valandraud, from the founding father of "garage wine", Jean-Luc Thunevin. Promoted to Saint-Émilion 1er Grand Cru Classé B in 2012.

Blend of 70% Merlot, 30%CabFr, sometimes up to 5% of CS, Malbec. Matured in new oak for 18-20mo. The only difference from grand vin is younger vines - 30yrs
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: 4.3 - An elegant and opulent wine. Exuberant aromas of dark fruit with notes of oak, tobacco and vanilla. Medium to full bodied, silky and round tannins, rather complex and multilayered. Flavours of blackberry, plum, blackcurrant with hints of dark chocolate, tobacco, leather, toasted oak. A fabulous long persistent finish.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Fine SEGC made of mainly Merlot (65%) and CF (25%). Aged in new French oak barrels. Dark red colour with complex aromas of ripe blackcurrants. Tobacco, cedar, vanilla, some licorice and chocolate. Super structure, fine balance and great finish. 93+ pts.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Soft sweet blackcurrant and more blackcurrant with silky depth, plush beguiling fruit that is a wonderful indulgence that is plump long and lasting. Fruit driven and ultra ripe with feint oak……Merlot, surely not, Cabernet is doing all the work here which is unusual for St Emillion!
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
Great modern St Emilion with tannins and ripe punchy aftertaste.
Great value!
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
4.1 stars for our next right bank!💪🏻🍷
70% Merlot, 20% CF and 10% CS.
Aged for 18 months in new French oak barrels.
Great to drink now and over the next 5 years.
Powerful, a great depth and delicious!

A deep purple color with many thin legs.

On the nose medium+ intense aromas of blackberries, black cherries, black elder berries, eucalyptus, green tobacco leaves, oak, toast, hints of tar and dried herbs.

The red has a medium and juicy acidity, good integrated.

Note:
8/10 🚬☕🍷
20yr old St. Emilion.
Deep ruby color with a thin garnet rim.
It has well pronounced aromas, smoky notes of wood and tobacco, cigar, leather, black pepper, black currant leafs dried red/black berries
Jammy fruitiness on the palate, well integrated tannins, smooth yet huge. Soft but still structured acidity. Well balanced.
It's complex yet so elegant on the palate. Finishing with layers after layers, flavors after flavors, pepper, smoke, cinnamon and earthy tones
Bordeaux that shows true class!

Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
TRULY MAJESTIC!

The last bottle we shared before Mau left. Debussy in the background, a richness & finesse expected of this Grand Cru!

Aromas like a men's club: damp cedar, leather, cigar, dry red melon, boysenberry. Subtly served over a bed of black fruit with a hint of anise. MILES of finish w/ sweet cinnamon, constantly changing like a chameleon.

We savored the luscious coffee-red juice together as we celebrated our last night. Like the wine, it was perfect & bittersweet. And then they were both gone.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Bright purplish ruby.  M+ nose, gorgeous aromas of newly ripen mulberry and blackberry, lavender blossom, cedar, cigar box, leather and some gun powder.  Youthful and lively, M+ acidity, medium to M+ tannin, M+ body, dry with loads of mixed black fruits.  Nicely structured and balanced.  M+ finish, rich mouthfeel of blackberry and black cherry, cassis, sandalwood, pipe tobacco and tarmac.  What a beauty, can’t believe it’s a second wine.  Most enjoyable now but can be aged further.  Recommend.  28 September 2022.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
4.4 91p. What a nose! Lots of dark blackberries, dark chocolate and dollops of new oak. 

Still a young palate with blackberries, cherries and lots if new oak. Modern, almost international style. 

Cellar for at least 3-5 more years. 

2nd wine to Chateau Valandraud, St Emilion Premier Grand Cru Classé. 

The owner invented garage wine (garachiste in French) which had a serious impact on the world of wine. First vintage 1991. 

Bordeaux tasting w/Jesper Hedegaard.
10+
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
Aroma: blackcurrant, boysenberry, blackberry. Secondary notes of oak, wood, tobacco and earthy notes. 

Palate: smooth and fine. The oak is well integrated and  tannins and acidity creates a fine velvety structure. Good longevity. 

Verdict: found in a Lidl in France for 15 Euro. Last bottle unfortunately. 
It's nice and complex, and each layer is easily identified. What a value found for the price.

Note: So for me this was an interesting lesson in the difference between a top class Bordeaux blend that is less than 5 years aged (this was a 2017) and one that is 20+ years aged. Still good, but you can taste in every sip the tightness and restrain in the flavours that haven’t yet had time to unfold, leaving an overall somewhat dusty impression. Lesson learnt: go for the 199x.

Aged 18~20 months in 100% new barrel.

Note:
Maybe closer to 3.75 stars.  Decanted for 3 hours. Opened to a smooth mouth, yet what seems to be young.  My reaction is another 5 years if it can hold aging well. Overall a nice wine for the price

Nose is hot. Heavy berry.  Almost a forced (chips or staves) oak scent.  Maybe new or heavy toaster barrels.  

Forward taste is soft down the tip and center of tongue.  Dry along the sides.  Fairly complex but again, young.   plum oak leather blackberry and  tobacco. Finishes with  pepper.  Quite dry and fast.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
Merlot up front with cherry, leather, clove, and the cab franc takes over quickly with a big, grippy, chewy, tannic finish with a hint of minerality

Worked well with a rich steak and roasted vegetables, but fear Bordeaux just might not be my favorite, maybe with another 20 years the second half would harmonize more.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
Of three bottle two were in perfect condition and one was faulty (thin, acidic).

Big nose, very oaky. Vanilla, stems. 

Forbiddingly tannic. Very rich.

Should be kept for at least a decade.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Good second label St Emilion Grand Cru. Blackberries, tobacco, leather and liguorice on nose. Good acidity and bold savoury tannins with blackberries on palate. Medium plus bodied and medium spicy complex finish. Structured and elegant texture. Paired well with salmon pasta. Decanded half an hour. Benefits surely longer cellaring.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: 3.75 This is a big wine in a “modern” style. It means plenty oak. Tannic and long. I even guessed RSA or California. Balance and length is good but maybe I prefer more terroir and personality over new oak.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: 3.75. Barnyard at first, then some methol, then came the leather and tobacco scents. Black current with a very lively acidic streak than may need some taming. 70% Merlot & 30% Cab Franc.  Overall impression is that this needs time to harmonize.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Splendid wine 🍷!
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
2010 IS FANTASTIC...

This is the second time this week I've tasted a bordelaise grand cru (2010 vintage) and I've got to say I'm more and more impressed with 2010. This offering from the right bank was magic. Very moist/generous fruit that appeared to have been aged an additional decade. Props to the winemakers. Tannins are well integrated. Structure is excellent - the blending of alcohol and fruit is superb here. Powerhouse blend waiting to tell more stories in the coming years. But exceptional now.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Round, clean flavor of citrus, vanilla, pear, grapefruit, some minerals and a hint of honey. Crisp floral nose of citrus, honey and vanilla. Light straw color. Nicely balanced wine. Great with an artichoke.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Victory! Super wine, great smooth feel and taste: oak, tannins, cherries.  Thank goodness for the great team of Jean-Luc and Muriell! I soooo enjoyed this wine today with spicy Asian food, pasta with sausage, and peppered steak.  Legs? If you are the glass, this wine is squeezing you nice and tight.  If you are the wine, you are holding on and enjoying the party!  Instead of cheaper wines, buy this and use smaller glasses. Great experience! Decant 30m - hour.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Oak, tobacco, chocolate, blackberry, leather, cream, licorice. What a wonderful St. Emilion at this price point, and this 2009 vintage was perfect for consumption by 2020. Super silky and smooth texture on the palate. Luscious fruity aromas. Extremely well-balanced overall. Nice long finish. Tasted way more expensive than valued. Strongly recommended for aging and for frequent purchases.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
Very ripe black fruits on the nose (blackberries, plum, black cherries), oak (coffee, charred wood), a touch of dry fruits (figs, sultana).
Palate has fresh acidity, big concentration, firm tannins that are ripe and round. 
The wine is very elegant, concentrated and balanced. It will be perfect in 3 to 5 years. Great value for money!
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Very nice; opening up beautifully. Deep, ruby red with hints of anise and mineral.  Smooth, even tannins and good mouthfeel along with a medium finish. Easy to drink and enjoy after an hour or so of airtime.
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
3.8/5.0
2nd wine of Valandraud. In a good shape, ready to drink wine. Ripe black fruits, prunes, chocolate and coffee, smooth tannins, generally nice.
Resume: good options to meet with C.V. , more reasonable price then the top wine.
Garage meeting, Caudal tasting, 28.02.2017
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note:
Great St.Em at its peak... How else can ones rate it :)

Note: Wonderful, complex nose with matured notes: blackberry, currant, compote, coffee, leather, white pepper, cedar, mushrooms, some moss. Woody-spicy on the palate with medium acidity and surprisingly (2004!) present tannins. Dry finish. Nicely aged nose, followed by a characterful palate with some edges. Still in development. Stunning Bdx blend with 60% Merlot, CS and CF. (4+)
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: The Bordeaux equivalent of a summer romance/quick roll in the hay. I’ll explain why. A real leafy nose. A grenade of cherries and just as you’re thinking this is sweet it changes direction with a bit a acidity and mellows out. It’s all over pretty quickly. 🐺 score 7.5/10
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Note: Too early? Too late? Breathe enough? I'm no more than a Bordeaux neophyte but I really wanted more from this wine. Don't get me wrong, it's good. Great looking in the glass, had that earthy red of an aged wine. Dark fruit, on the tart side on the palate, with herb and spice on a lingering finish. A fine wine, that I found at an amazing price, but my expectations got the best of me. Maybe it's the Merlot, more likely it's me.

Classic elegance and excellence of a great vintage.

Note: This is a stunning example of the Right Bank! Smoke and earth and lots of dark red fruit on the nose. All of that, along with some tobacco and oak, comes through upon first taste and the fruit lingers in the mid palate. It has a long finish with good acid and tannins that might be just a little bit young. Overall this wine has the depth and complexity one expects from a great Bordeaux of this vintage (2016). I am very excited to come back and try this one again in a couple years!
Wine: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014

Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Cont'Ugo ha rubato il mio cuoricino 🥰

👁 d ruby w purple rim

👃bramble, smoke, oak, dark chocolate, black plum, red fruit, leather

👅 beautiful almost velvety texture
M+ acidity, full body, M alcohol (14.5%!), refined H tannins
Such looong long finish maybe minutes!

Definitely requires food and still very young.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Wow. Absolutely incredible. I get curried ketchup and allspice on the nose, but it still bursts with fresh red fruit. 

On the palate, it drinks like a much older wine, teasing the growth potential in a few years. Exquisite balance between fresh and tertiary, jam and plucked berry. Chalk, covering a slightly tannic clawing, with milk chocolate softening it. Raspberry, strawberry, and something a bit darker, maybe blueberry jam bringing it back to earth. 

I'd go back to this bottle in a heartbeat.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Beautiful merlot, divinely balanced smell and taste.  It glides down your throat with incredible pleasure and ease, while filling you with magical scents and fullness that complete maximum pleasure. 
4,3- 4,4 !
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: The nose shows intense notes of ripe cherries and blueberries well integrated with intriguing hints of candied fruit and sweet spices. On the palate, the wine is supple, balanced and long. Fruity aftertaste.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Dark crimson, pronounced black cherry, blackberries, cassis, vanilla, oak, lilac and some rose petals. Dry, high acidity, tannins and medium alcohol, full body with pronounced flavours of blafruit, smoke, tar and leather, earthy notes.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Nose: light cherry, faintest mossy note. Taste: smooth, cherry, touch of red fruit (?), full bodied, thick, well balanced, no acidity, long warming finish. Note: A unique 100% Merlot Bolgheri DOC from the inimitable Antinori. You must decant this wine after which it reveals itself as a velvety, medium-bodied Super Tuscan. But the other Super Tuscans in this storied winery’s portfolio are better, including the cheaper Bruciato.

Note:
Intense ruby red color. The nose is characterized by notes of such red fruit as cherries and raspberries along with aromas of sweet spices and earth tones.
The palate, strikingly supple in the texture of its tannins, and finishes beautifully.

Note:
Winally Friday part 2.
Dark ruby.  Blackberry, herbal, light dry earth.  Palate of of red cherry, earth, wet bark. Tannins are grippy.  Medium acidity.  Not as stellar, but perhaps some aging will help it along.  Some structure.  Decanted an hour.  Was disappointed with this.  Was expecting more of this 100% Merlot.  3.8⭐️

Note: 100% Merlot. Dark fruit on the nose. Full bodied with a smooth palate of plump cherry, oak and leather. Juicy and fruit forward. Long, sweet finish with fine grained tannins. Could use a year or two.

Note: 100% Merlot in this DOC Bolgheri from Antinori, winemakers since medieval times. Inviting nose of black currant, dark cherries, plum, leather, tobacco. Smooth and round on palate with a juicy finish. Drink 2022-2027

Note: This wine was a revelation. Not having drunk 100% Italian Merlot before this was fragrant, fresh, flavourful and lovely. We drank this before a bigger Super Tuscan and it was the perfect warm up. Almost has a new world slant to it.

Note: First sip without decanting was quite sharp, but after 1hr decanting the full flavour came out nicely, light cherry, blueberry, hint of pepper, cinnamon & earthy notes, strong tannins, but ready to drink. Had with roast duck and not overpowered.

Note: Deliciously voluptuous merlot with morello cherry and blackberries, silky smooth but persistent tannins lead the way to a long finish. Hints of tobacco leaf and a little earthiness in this young wine. A great buy in the Vivino sale.

Note: 2017 Bolgheri Merlot. Vanilla oak baking spice  cherry black fruit eucalyptus menthol beautiful nose.  pepper oak vanilla chocolate licorice black fruit on the palate. Tannins firm providing good structure. Medium to long finish. Good-great wine! Cheers!

4.0

Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Antinori is always so impressive, in flavour, texture, and in wine making. 

Being one of Italy’s largest wine producers, with vineyards in Umbria, Bolgheri, Tuscany, and Montalcino they always understand how to get the most of the terroir. 

The colour is a garnet red going slightly rust at the rim. Balanced, acidic, and plenty of tannin. 

The nose has a deep blackberry flavour, vanilla, and cherry. The palate is powerful notes of tobacco,  plum, and red fruit.

Hold or drink. I decanted for 1 hour.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Though only three years old you could be forgiven for thinking it is closer to 10 as it displays some tertiary notes and has integrated the oak influences quite well. The nose is of toasted wood and maybe a cedar quality. The palate is far more fruit forward than the nose would suggest with raspberry and blackberry playing a leading role. This is a truly impressive wine that shows what Bolgheri can offer in the hands of capable producers. Antinori is certainly that. Definitely recommend to drink now.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Solid wine and performance by Antinori. Not gonna repeat what others have already written. But can't really say that I was too impressed. Price quality okeish. But this one asks for the following prompt - keep your expectations moderate.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
It has beautiful deep ruby red colour & after 1 hour of bottle breathing the nose is still pretty muted as I can only picked up hint of oak with slight vanilla. It’s a very full bodied wine with intense acidity (dryness) with strong & masculine tannins. Palate-wise we have blackberries, blueberries, figs, licorice, cardamom with exotic spice. 
Will I buy again: No & I prefer #ilbruciato which I tasted recently more 😉

Note:
Picked this from Enoteca to use up the last of my credit from our last visit & to pair it with my duck.

Foreboding & actually aggressive notes of graphite alongside the newest of new leather and a prune jus infused with reduced violet petals. I thought it was a bit porty but maybe 15% Bolgheri Merlot is supposed to be?

It is not. I tasted it & summoned the (Italian) somm, he took my glass away, poured one of his own, compared them, then came back with a new one. 

Note to Enoteca users - keep it clean.

This is as pure expression of pomerol, in Italy, without a $500 price tag.Beautiful, elegant even in its youth.

Dense, but lively, coating the palate with drying tannins and stinging acidity.
5-10year and this heavy metal will become an orchestra

Note:
What a Merlot!! A big, bold, beautiful 💯% Merlot from Antinori’s Guado Al Tasso estate in Bolgheri 🇮🇹. Served blind by @Daniel Giacinti. The sheer size & concentration of the wine led me to Priorat 1st (I was profiling Daniel a bit as he loves Priorat). But it didn’t have the liquid rocks & heat of Priorat  

Intoxicating nose of crushed cassis, violets, creamy blackberry, new leather, cedar 🪵, cigar box 

Very approachable but will go a decade 

Thanks Daniel

It screams bbq rack of lamb!

Note: This was soooo good. I expected a level of quality as it’s from a very well known and respected winery but the balance of flavours was incredible. Heavily oaky, dark fruit on the nose. Hints of pepper, chocolate and ripe plum throughout. Just great. Will be buying again.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Cont’Ugo 2016 in an intense ruby red color. Its nose is compelling, rich in intriguing aromas of Mediterranean herbs, sweet spices and liqueur cherries. Velvety tannins on the palate are well sustained by bright acidity imparting freshness and pleasurable mouthfeel. Excellent length
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Another winner from Antinori, Cont’Ugo is produced entirely with Merlot 🍇s as a new interpretation of Bolgheri. Aged in oak barriques (one third of which were new) for 12 months then 6 months in bottle. @[1|4372591|Rock and Roll Wino] has got this one spot on (as usual) and has saved me from TN hassle. Please refer to his excellent note from 2 weeks ago. Paired with beef short rib casserole.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Great Bolgheri from Antinori with a dark purple color, the aroma and taste are dominated by dark fruit over red fruit notes of oak, earthy yeasty spice ageing .  Bolgheri is very well balanced with a velvety tannin, dry, expressive with a long fruity finish, great solo wine.  🍷🍷👍🏻😃👌🏻
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Lovely crimson color, and very differently bold style of Merlot! On the nose dark red fruit, plum, and then nice hint of wood, full body, drying tannin and stingy acidity, palate is chocolate milk, a bit sweet at the end. Long finish of more chocolate!!
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: From the people that brought you Tig, I found this unit. 100% Merlot. Pomerol meets Tuscany. Everything RB, with Italian flair. VSpin at 3 then wait 1 hour still grippy. Likely age well but delicious now.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Beautiful and intense ruby red color with stunning aromas of red fruit, tobacco, and sweet spices on the nose. Full-bodied coupled with juicy flavors of red cherry, blueberry, red currant, sweet vanilla, and touch of pepper on the palate. Dry with firm but not really smooth tannins, vibrant & just right acidity, and soft long finish. Very good balance of acidity and fruit flavors intensity. Love it.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Wow! Simply a great Bolgheri.
Guado al tasso is distinctly exceptional for this type of winemaking. Strong taste, dry from summer heat and wind from the sea. Tannins are beautiful and elegant. Some spice as well
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Another great wine from Antinori. Love their amarone, Sangiovese, this Merlot wine is no exception. I guess I'm becoming a fan... Anyways, it's a great bottle with some well balanced ripe fruit, black currant, blueberry, cherry, some hint of vanilla and pepper. Spicy yet elegant, full body with aloft tannins. The finish is quite long, just a right acidity, very easy to drink now... But I guess it will only get better. Getting a few bottles to hold))
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Very good expression of merlot that is reminiscent of Denis Durantou’s le petit eglise. Thankfully, fruit was not over extracted or too forward in the wine, probably also due to a moderate 2016 vintage where summer wasn’t plagued by heat spikes. Oak was very well integrated in this wine and presented nice vanilla notes. tannins were fine and smooth with just the right amount of plum, blackcurrant
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Second wine in the Guado Al Tasso degustazione and visit. Single variety Merlot with 12 months in barrique.
Intense red. The oak is more prevalent on the nose but still dark fruit. On the palate medium plus body with smooth tannins. The flavours are a mix of sweet plum like a plum sauce as well as sweet spice like licorice.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Hard to go wrong with Antinori, this 100% Merlot Bolgheri was fantastic! Dark ruby color, aromas of plum blackberry chocolate oak blueberry and licorice. On the palate, plum oak vanilla blackberry black cherry cassis licorice pepper minerals and some spice. Smooth and silky med+bodied and well balanced. Long dry fruit filled finish. Paired with rigatoni à la vodka w/chicken sausage and spaghetti with spinach shallots parmesan cheese and chicken sausage. @[1|10538791|Adele Rubin-Herzenberg] 
Photos on Instagram📸
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Loved this Tuscan beauty: dark ruby in colour and a world of flavours on a nose: vanilla, dark fruit, chocolate, old leather, smoke, herbs, camphor and liquorice. On a palate it was different world of oak, bell pepper, blackberry and blueberry, smoked plum, balanced acidity, full bodied, and long aftertaste with noticeable sweetness on Merlot. 4,1 here.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Somewhat Disappointing

Expected more at this price point and Antinori. At Pull n Pour it was hardly a 3*, but we also knew it needed some aeration. Aeration helped! Especially the nose improved, but it still come across a bit thin on the palate and with a sweet red cherry note dominating the fruit basket. Almost reminded me of a piss thin Pinot, which is a complete turn off. Luckily the nose is quite good and kinda saved the overall experience.

I see good reviews, so maybe I need to try a more aged one
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: @[1|47623479|Blind Faith] study, I tasted this final round after the reveal. This Antinori Bolgheri is 100% Merlot, with plenty of barrique influence. Deep ruby. Lovely nose, ripe plum, expensive French oak, spice and Italian herbs. The palate is smooth up front yet with plenty of grip, the tannins well managed so as not to dominate the wine. Concentrated fruit carries the 14.5% ABV with ease. Herbal finish, mocha and just a touch of bitterness. Medium(+) acidity. Delicious.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Region: Bolgheri
Grape Variety: 100% Merlot
ABV: 14%
Stopper: Cork

Full bodied red wine.
Deep red with purple reflections in colour, on the nose, aromas of plum and blueberries with notes of spices. Medium tannins. Well-balanced in acidity. Bold and structured red wine in style. On the palate, dry, oaky, delivers red fruits character, hint of spices and ripe fruits, lively, balanced, concentrated, touch of tobacco, smokey, silky and soft. It has long finish.

Pairs with roasted red meats.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

80/100

Med plus body

Note:
4.2

Note: Cherry, blackberries, tobacco, leather, flint. Rich and quite bold, but not too heavy bodied. High in alcohol but smooth drinking. Opens up nicely. Bought from Italasia.

Note:
Medium ruby color.

Aromas of cherry, blackberry pepper, licorice, tobacco, leather.

Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Rich, luscious, bramble nose. Plum, blueberry, blackberry, light, fine tannins. So enticing - then totally shut down. Is back for action on day two. Gotta get some with age on...

Note: Bolgheri, our new discovery from our last vacation in 🇮🇹. And what a sample we got here, excellent 🍷
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Smooth, velvety very complex red whine. Needs breath. Open at least 8 hours before drinking. Very pleasant, in that also the third glass is very good. We had it with a curry (not spicy) and it went very well. The spices in the curry seemed to enhance the flavors of the wine. 
The wine itself has hints of spices. A bit of cinnamon combined with other spices.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Hello again! Vivino doesn't like me... all my TN since May disappeared!!! So I try to make a new one. This wine was wonderful dark red and despite the high temperatures in Switzerland, with 14.5% a suitable wine with spaghetti. It has notes of berries and chocolate. Really great!
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: This 100% Merlot is drinking beautifully, deep burgundy color, nose of black plum, black cherry, raspberry, and garrigue, full body with velvety tannin and balanced acidity, drinking very well now, should last another decade if not more, tastes of black cherry, anise, clove, licorice, prune, and quince paste, finish with a bit of black pepper spiciness, long and layered finish, great price for the quality.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: The nose of the wine shows notes of plums and blueberries along with sweet spices and underbrush. On the palate, it is vibrant, long, and balanced. The harmony and the fullness of fruit on the finish and aftertaste are the characterizing traits of the wine.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Not a light Merlot at all, but very suitable as a wine with Pasta for example or meat appetisers. Overall it has a lot of character with a peppery taste and lots of berries. Given the price this is highly recommended!
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
"Toscane trip closing ceremony"
Let finish it up properly with my grape variety of predilection.. "Lord Merlot"!!
This 100% pure Merlot is the witness of the prolific Bolgheri terroir. Only the best grapes are selected to characterize this nectar. 
Its youthful exuberance perfume are charming you from the nose till the last caudalie. Expressing fragrances of raspberry, sour cherry, combined with mediterranean herbal note. The palate is vibrant and dynamic. Deep wine and complex as I love! 
Firework!!! :)
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Happy International Pinot Noir Day! We are drinking Merlot…Oopsie daisy! 

Deep ruby, pronounced notes of blackberry and black sweet plum, black cherry, cedar and cigar box, mint. Very approachable in its youth. I really did not expect that! Not bad at all
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Antinori and Bolgheri should equal success, and here it does. Still very young of course (2018) but already showing well. Quite a mild nose, but a well layered and developing palate which gives red & black fruit, smoke, raisins, with hints of chocolate and licorice on the finish which is also dry and grippy.
2018v
4.2

Note:
Hue of transparent medium ruby
Medium+ aromas intensity of rose petal, black plum, blackberry, blueberry jam, black cherry, red cherry, strawberry, licorice, white pepper, cinnamon, toast, vanilla, smoke, clove, leather
Dry with medium lively acidity, medium+ ripe tannin, medium alcohol, medium+ body. Medium flavour intensity of same as nose with hint of raisin and prune (due to passerilage??). Medium+ finish.

89 pts.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
100% merlot using 33% new barrels.

Nose offers dark cherries, peppery notes, sweet cherries, earth and spices. 

The palate is fresh and lively with good acidity and friendly tannins. It ends with a little warmth that should fade with age. +7/10
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: 14.5%. Deep purple. Notes of plum, cassis, faint leather, a bit of smoke, cigar box, coffee, dark chocolate, and oak on the nose. Palate confirms the nose. Full body, dry, medium acidity and medium plus tannins. Somewhat complex with a medium length finish that’s slightly tart. It’s a good, smooth wine.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
@[1|47623479|Blind Faith] s3w17, common region and grape, again Merlot, again (wrongly guessed 😂) Tuscany but there you go. Lovely ruby, clear and vivacious, med+ bodied. The nose is really interesting, plum and cherry, oak vanilla and pepper. Chocolate as well. 
Disclaimer: not 100% Merlot, some Shiraz and Cabernet Sauvignon in the potion. I really loved it, I found it had an interesting complexity.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Black fruit, plum... chocolate, tobacco, smoke... some dried herbs... dry but not scraping, smoother... definitely would not have guessed 100% merlot... solid and well made, just not super exciting, a little flat
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
I'm going to give this a solid 4.2...its really good. Decant if drinking now...I did for 6 hours....and have one sleeping 👍🏽😊

Deep purple in the glass. Nose of violet, oak and berries. Palate continues with dark berries (blackberry and cherry)  raspberry, dried herbs, new leather and tobacco on the palate. Long finish with firm tannins and superbly balance acidity... yum
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: 100% merlot may or may not still be from guado al Tasso estate. The 2015 was a blockbuster, the 16 is a bit more medium bodied though still quite compelling. Easily mistaken for a pomerol from a good year. Fruit forward with a solid but not overbearing tannic back bone. Very pleasant but not overly complex. Drink now.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
This is a delightfully nurtured and highly developed /extracted Merlot .....3 v spins and 1 hour, still was not enough time, recommend at least 3 hour decant, it took this long to start notes..
Rich cherries and mocha, dry herbs, racy tannins, smoky, oaky , wet iron , somewhere between Pomerol and Mayacamas,  yet distinctly Italian.
Several bottles left, going to hold tight for a bit, think they'll develop nicely. 4.3⭐🇮🇹
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: 4.0@BMW(Best Merlot in the world) project with blind, finding youth Petrvs from here. My guess was youthful Merlot from new world. Compared with other bottles, I could not identify depth & complexity, sweety aromas, relatively lighter color, quiet tasty to enjoy. Probably the best QPC of night. Wip.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
4,0⭐️ Nice (but young).👍

Note: Savoring this marvelous 100%Merlot, in their beautiful winery.  The garden facing the vineyards,  the round aroma,  delicacy that defines elegance.  The direct plum and cherry bond exalts the oak. A clean, premium finish
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Very nice! Beautiful nose of chocolate covered black cherries, dried fig, balsamic and hint of green herbs. Silky palate of chocolate and raisin. Mild but grippy tannins and tart cherry on the finish.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Deep ruby colour 
Medium (+) intensity aromas and flavours of  blackberry, blueberry, prune, cherry, strawberry, black olive, tomato, chocolate, cinnamon 

Dry, medium (+) body, medium (+) acidity, high alcohol, medium (+) tannin, medium (+) finish

Mellow, well developed, very good wine 4.2/5
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: A good Tuscan Merlot. Deep ruby. Slow tears. Newly woven velvet. Still young, hold it or give it a good aeration. Black cherry, dark plum, blackberry, coffee, dark chocolate, cedar, stalk, earth, tobacco, toast, clove. Complex and layered, food concentration and rustic velvety tannins, yet still needs time to integrate. Good level of acidity too. Has potential to age.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Medium ruby colour on its appearance. On the nose, blackberry, blueberry, plum, black cherry, prune, licorice, pepper, coffee, cream, chestnut, chocolate, and oak. On the palate, dry, full body, medium (+) acidity, medium (+) and polished tannins, smooth, balanced, quite fruit-forward, rich, and long finish. Nice quality Merlot indeed.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
I just love that Merlot , not a big one yet a friendly and very tasty one - excellent value for a Boulgari too grape.
Black fruit (plum), red fruit (raspberries), meat and leather , chocolate and vanilla.
A text book modern Super Tuscan
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Merlot blind tasting with the masters, 12/03/2021: We do drinking that f..antastic Merlot!

#7/7

🍷Deep garnet purple.

👃Fruity style but shallow and boring. Burnt sugar, tobacco and violet.

👄Sweet and spicy tannic body with bittersweet finale. Nothing is wrong but too shallow.

Still better than #3. This is just a bit better than my least preferred one.

🤔My guess: Cont’ Ugo 2018, or some new world entry Merlot.

NB: Their 2016 is very special.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Dry red wine, ruby red with watery rim, intensive aromas of vanilla, chocolate, black cherry,  plum, ripe strawberry. Straight and clean aromas. Silky mouthfeel, with clean fruit presence in mid palate and aftertaste. Mediums acidity and tannins. Nice example of a “round wine”
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: #blindfaith #17S. Very late indeed. Rating only. Plenty of good reviews elsewhere! Actually I enjoyed all 3 of these. Got Merlot but wouldn't have got Italy as all 3 regions are new to me for Merlot.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: @Blind Faith study S3W17 Tastes like a Bordeaux Blend ❌, which confirmed my Tuscany ✅ guess after the previous Chianti ❌. Two wrongs do make a right in this instance 😂. I really liked this & felt it would be even better with age as 2018 is so young. Deep purple 🎶 in colour with pronounced aromas of smokey oaky vanilla. Flavours of plum, blackberry & cherry with medium acidity, tannin & body. Well balanced with rich creamy tannin & sweet vanilla that I didn’t notice the high alc (14.5%) level. Delicious 4.1⭐️
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
This one took A LOT of time to open up. Opened very young (2018 drank in December 2021). 
100% Super Tuscan Merlot, which normally I enjoy a lot, even young. No notes taken this time though, as it was borderline impossible..
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
A complex, bold, confident Merlot that sets a standard far above the norm...can be aged another 5-10 years.
Dark color, clear rim, luscious intriguing aromas led by eucalyptus.
Full-bodied, medium tannins for long finish, balanced acidity.
Notes of spicy black pepper, leather, smoke, dark chocolate, vanilla, cassis, blackcurrant, black cherry, strawberry compote
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
8.0/10
Another good bolgheri; medium ruby colored and medium body; notes of plum, cherry and chocolate on the nose and on the mouth. Finishes elegantly. Paired it with beef fillet with souce morilles and matched super nicely.
Bought this wine from Vivino for 38.90 CHF on December 2020.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Pretty weak on the nose. Dark chocolate and dark berries on the nose. A bit sour on the palate. It’s complex and enjoyable though. Some raspberries and a balanced finish. A very nice merlot in my book. Will grow over some years. Will keep it in the cellar for a while.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
A young Toscana Merlot that has been talked about a lot among my Vivino friends. Opened a bottle today in a quick family dinner and paired with Korean grilled meat.

Deep purple color. Fruity nose. Dry, fruit forward and full-bodied yet not too over powering. Easy drinking. Smoky, oaky and black fruit flavor.

Quite good balance with decent finish. Moderate complexity and intensity. Good QPR. Yummy and not to strong. Gone in a short time.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
4574th rated wine. Bolgheri rarely disappoints, brunch with friends 🇮🇹 🍷 

🟥: deep garnet 
😶: earthy smoke, vanilla & black fruit
😋: as above with a nice warm full body 
🍇: Merlot
🖊: Bolgheri is where France meets Tuscany in a good way. Only relatively recently has this region gained its current notoriety. The Bordeaux grapes find an excellent expression here. This one single vintage. 14%
💶: unknown
🌟: 4.2
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Dense, almost impenetrable ruby-red color in the glass! On the nose rich aromas of cherries, raspberries, mon chéri, herbs, black bread, toast and some vanilla! On the palate a pithy start, the acidity is present, lively and perfectly integrated tannins, strong body with a long, persistent finish! Cheers!
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Blind faith study finale and I didn’t like this. I think far too young to show its best and would have benefitted from being left alone in the glass for a while. I’m sure I would be more impressed having a bottle and giving it a proper decant. Another I would not have guessed Merlot on. My notes show not much typicity so probably worth relying on others!
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Antinori's 100% Merlot from Bolgheri, 15 months in oak. A big quality structured wine that drinks well now with a good decant. Impressive concentration. 

Deep garnet. Dark fruit, oak, cedar, black earth on the nose. Dry, full body , med+ acid, with juicy forgiving tannins. Stewed black fruit, black cherry, plum, spices, toasted oak. Wonderful long finish. Rounding down this time to average it out. 4.2 🏍😎
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Catching up on some Blind Faith tastings from the last series. This was week 6 and after a couple of decent weeks of guessing, we were back to normal!

Red fruit nose, sweet fruit on the palate. Maybe pushing me towards some grenache here. Long finish. Tannins soft and felt on roof of mouth. Miles out with my guess of Languedoc GSM. Three lovely wines this week
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
BMW Best Merlot in the World Project tasting in Feb 2021. Blind tasting 7 bottles of Merlot to find the best of the best. I gave this bottle the lowest point next to Petrus.

My rank: 6th out of 7 (Blind tasting with 12 Vivino friends and this one was ranked 7th out of 7)

My humble note: orange tea, dried rose could be a Bordeaux. 

Gave this one a 3.5 ⭐️ from its price comparing to other bottles (2016 is better than 2018)
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Definitely a Merlot, and a good one. Fruity (mid dark and red) and not so herbally. Tertials. Well balanced and round, with a full body that ends in elegance rather than being sticky or jammy. 

Acid very well managed for an Italian, tannins well integrated. 

Although Merlot is currently not my favourite, I could se myself getting this again, it just needs to be well paired with the food.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Vivino was totally wrong about this one. A 23% match? This is a beautiful, elegant old world wine with deep red and dark fruit flavors. Offers a little bit for everyone. The bottle just disappeared… 😮
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: @[1|47623479|Blind Faith] catch up S3W17, common region and grape(s). Clear favourite of the 3. Med ruby. Med+ intensity vanilla, coconut, ripe black plums and cherries, chocolate. Dry, med+ acidity, med+ (fine, ripe) tannins, full bodied, long finish. Rich, black fruited, chocolate, the most oak influence. Quite a Rolland-y style.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
4.25 - My wine senses were tingling when I decided to open this bottle and sure enough @Rock and Roll Wino also had it on the exact same day. 

This will likely be 4.5⭐️ once it gets enough age, with enough oxygen on day 2 it was quite impressive, with a great bouquet and some power on the palate. A great expression of Merlot. 

Nose: black fruit, mocha, vanilla, woodsy, chocolate, cigar box 

Palate: blackberry, black cherry, oak-spice, high alcohol, licorice, some grippy tannins, though not unapproachable
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
My 60th bottle of 2021
"BMW Project" on 12th
This one ranked last...

"Best Merlot in the World Project".. event on March 12th, all 7 Merlots Blind Tasting!!
This bottle ranked 7th out of 7, no surprise.

🍷: Nice fragrant of red fruit, easy to drink and enjoy, while lacked of depth and complexness. Medium-bodied with aroma of red berry, along with fine tannins, with moderate length aftertaste.

Under USD40, this one was really nice and someone still guessed it as Petrus...
Deserved "Baby Petrus" nickname!!
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Thick ruby red in the glass. Pepper, earth, minerals, and a tone of freshness on the nose. On the palate it is full bodied with a balanced variety of dark fruits to the point where they are barely individually distinguishable: dark plum and cherries. Decent acidity and barely noticeable tannins. This is a fairly discreet wine, it doesn’t make your mouth pop, yet you want more of it. 

Paired amazingly well with lamb racks.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
NEW YEARS EVE DINNER!

I love the Antinori wines and this one was on my list for some time. Finally I had the chance to try this 100% Merlot from Bolgheri. 

Deep purple color with aromas of dark cherries, currant, ripe raspberries and plum. Complete with spices, mocha and light tar notes. 

Med- acidity, powerful body, and smooth tannins. Ended in a long finish. 

Not complicated but multilayered. Enjoyed it a lot.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Deep ruby, sweet med+ intensive nose, black fruits, cherries, cassis, plum, hint of violet and other flowers, sweet spices, liquorice, pepper, oak flavors, chocolate and vanilla. Mouth dry, med+ body, crispy acid, med+ tannins very well balanced with body and acidity, med+ flavor intensive with med+ finish. Very good Bolgheri, well structured, balanced, great acidity, sweet and hot mouthfeel and good price.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Produced entirely with Merlot, from grapes sourced from Antinori's Guado al Tasso estate. Deep ruby red color. The nose delivers intense aromas of small ripe red fruit accompanied by fresh balsamic notes of Mediterranean scrub and sweet spices. On the palate, soft, balanced and persistent, a wine that is characterized by elegance, harmony and pleasantness until the long fruity aftertaste. Good now, surely better in 2023 and beyond. Could easily cellar for five-plus years. Provide enough air upfront.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Tasty Merlot from Bolgheri. This one was a dark sanguine red. The nose showed ripe cherry, boysenberry, cherry candy, jolly rancher, and leather. It showed moderate acidity and moderate, soft, tannins that led to a nice and very dry finish. Very nice. Cheers!
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
100% Merlot
Bolgheri DOC
14.5% ABV

The new born baby of Antinori Fortfolio,

The vision to create this wine was to make different and high quality Merlot from Bolgheri than other producers

14 month oak aging

Lots of fruity and feminine wine with creame di Cassis and black cherries, with silky and Elegant finish.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Typical but non the less intriguing Merlot from Antinori. F body, M+ velvet tannins, dry.
Grape 🍇 Merlot
Aroma👃🏼 vanilla, jam, black cherry, tobacco.
Palatte 👄 jam, vanilla, black cherry, plum, dark fruit, black fruit, oak,  cherry, chocolate, blackberry, leather licorice, clove.
Cheers 🍷
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Lovely Merlot from Antinori, Tuscany, Italy!🍷🍇 well balanced with well defined pronounced fresh and ripe flavours of black and red fruit.  Complex structure, long lingering finish. Recommended!🍷

Appearance m intensity, ruby, clear, tears. On the nose m(+) intensity aroma of black cherry, red cherry, oak, cedar. 

Palate m acid, m(+) tannins and body. Dry with a whiff of sweetness, ABV high, flavours intensity pronounced, finish long. Flavours of black cherry, black plum, red cherry, oak, cedar. More in comments⤵️
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Incredible value here. This is such a steal for the quality of this wine. Good
concentration, balanced, smooth, wonderful mouthfeel. Black cherry, plum, blueberry, sweet tobacco, leather, chocolate, truffle.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
drank 05/2019 vintage 2015
invitation from a friend to taste a new wine from Antinori.
Very pleased with the Merlot focuses Italian.
The nose was very sexy, a mix of black currants, some marmalade, cherry, wood scents, ...
On the plate, it repeats the nose with very mouth filling fruits and velvet tannins. 
An absolute alternative to the Tignanello which became way too expensive over the last years.
Give it a try!
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Made the mistake of drinking at a fire pit by a lake in New York in January, which dulled the wine's characteristics. Before it got too cold the nose had wood and dark fruit.  The palate had oak, chocolate, raspberry, and leather. Smooth tanins and finish. Will be warming this one up the next time.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Dried raisin, chocolate, rose. Satisfying level of condensation. Some say it’s a ‘crowd pleaser’. Fine. Count me in! (But I’d vote for a Washington Merlot for sukiyaki.)

4 hours after opening. Spices, freshly ground pepper. A hint of Chinese star anise. I would have guessed Syrah. Enjoyed this one a lot!
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Ruby-red color in the glass.
Raspberry, raisins, oak, plum, leather, forest floor, coffee and hints of cassis.
Medium in body acidity and tannins.
Overall, a great Bolgheri.
Wonderful complexity, structure and balance. (4.1)
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Definitely too young, but opened up gradually with time in the glass. Some bright acidity and berry flavours mixed with some more nuanced meaty notes. Lots of tannins, quite drying towards the finish. Feels like a bit of a shame drinking it now - it's perfectly enjoyable, but feels tannic and a little disjointed Vs the potential it clearly has
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: 4,0 of 5 for me. How I grade; 5 If only I could stock up my cellar. 4,5 Stock up my cellar! 3-4 Yes please, any time. 2,5 I'll have one glass. 2 Thanks for offering, but I'll go for something else. 1 Faulty wine.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: First time to try this Guado al Tasso 100% merlot based red. It is a real power wine but with great finesse. Very black color in the glass this develops greatly with some air. No doubt good storage potential in this. Dark fruit and cedar and oak.

Note: Outstanding!! What a great find! Such inviting notes of dark fruit licorice and vanilla on the nose. It mellowed out as it breathed but still so wonderful. I’m the palate such beautiful flavors of cherry and tart plum. I get a little chocolate and a dry oak at the finish. First sips had a little bit of earthy dirt, but that smoothed out as i let it breath a bit. I thoroughly enjoyed this. Just amazing! 4.6-4.8 on QPR. So good!!

Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Med ruby, pronounced intensity, forest floor, wet leaves, coffe, tobacco, prune, dried blackberry, blackcurrant leaf, black pepper, eucalyptus, blackcurrant, blueberry, black cherry, violet. Dry, high acidity, high tannin, high alcohol, med+ body. Long finish. Very good wine
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: A very good red, that is lighter than many, but is still deep, balanced and full of character. It is a fruit forward wine, although a lot going on besides that. Tannins are soft, but clearly present. Sweet notes don't prevail. They have managed to get much more out of a merlo than many would expect. Red fruit, dark fruit, vanilla, chocolate, some earthy notes.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
4.2 — Big bold and intense cherry nose, followed by dark notes and huge chocolate explosion on the palate. Big, bold concentrated merlot, too young to fall before 2025... Served to me blind by the amazing @[1|2420436|Ernestas W9LT], @[1|43077715|Stasys W9LT Slava Ukraini!], @[1|33495479|Vytas R W9LT] ❤️🙏🏻💪🏻😎

N: black currant, black cherry, liquorice, charred oak, vanilla
P: very bitter chocolate dusted with cocoa, black cherry, touch of pepper

Full body, some sweetness, high acidity, huge tannins, medium finish.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Tasted blind with shocking revelation, I was destroyed… thought I was ok by distinguishing my favourite Italian region flavour profile, but this… didnt even taste like old world. Intense aroma of lush ripe and jammy blackcurrants, blackberries, cassis, clove, pepper, sweet spices, medicinal hints. Full body, opulent, bold, lactic fruit bomb heavily sedated with overpowering cedar and even coconut explosion, scented with cacao and topped with liquorice, coated with silky tannins, lots of going on here.
88
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Little bit expensive one for me. But I thought it will be new experience and good chance to learn something when I bought this because its grape was merlot from Italy. It was very soft and feeling silky, long finish and very detailed wine. I couldn't catch all of its charateristics but finally I thought this one is not my cup of tea. Next day I tried one more but it totally changed and lost all of its attractiveness. Classic wine but not mine.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: An intense ruby red colour. The nose is characterised by notes of such red fruit as marasca cherries and raspberries along with aromas of sweet spices and Mediterranean brush. The palate is strikingly supple in the texture of its tannins.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
It's a super good wine. However, the taste is quite short. But the short experience you get is filled with dark fruits, cherry, and some minerals. Round character and not too edgy. 
Might have pass best before date.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: 3.8 with good potential to have 4. Ripe plum, black cherries, blackberry jam, chocolate, sweet spices. Full bodied, velvety, well balanced and structured, round , elegant, delicious chocolate aftertaste.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Cedar. Vanilla. Expensive oak influence. Black pepper. Acidity m+. Tannin m+. Meaty. Length m+. Phyrazine. Big bold style Merlot based Super Tuscan. Still youthful and developing. Better ageing long further
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: had this wine during our wine tour at antinori. All you can expected from a super Tuscan wine, full bodied, dark fruits on the nose, with a hint of chocolate and nuts. A bit too early to drink 2018 wine. Would be better if keep for 5 more years
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: The nose is very beautiful: ripe strawberries and mild tobacco. In mouth it shows a slightly harsher character (stronger tobacco, prominent tannins) that perhaps needs a couple of years to tame, but it shows much promise. A slow drink that needs a lot of aeration.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Stunning. Especially for that price
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: 100% merlot, aroma of jammy fruits followed by some earthy tones of leather and sea salt. Good merlot but not good value at the price point
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Gorgeous particularly after some air. Nose palate and mouthfeel all follow through with great fruit flavours from blackberry etc. Finish is long and true.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: This is a sumptuous merlot! Full body, intense and complex; plum, tobacco, vanilla; fortunately lots of tannines, so the wine remains somewhat balanced
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Blackberry and cure ate off the nose. Soft, velvety mouth feel. Good legs and structure. Slightly tight on opening, but opened up fairly quickly and standing strong an hour later.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Initially raspberry jam and red fruit on the nose but flat on the palate. After opening up it changed completely. Vanilla and chocolate make an appearance with peppery notes on the finish.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: It’s merlot they said. I dislike merlot I said. Then I tasted this one. I love merlot now. Rich aroma with black berries, currant. Some leather and oak. Really intense and interesting taste.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
smooth and rounded merlot-dominant bolgheri

full body, medium(+) intensity, medium(+) acidity, medium(+) tannins, medium alcohol, medium(+) finish

black cherry, black plum, sage, tobacco
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: A wine with generous fruit, dark fruit, plum and ample oak, although did little to excite me and tasted beside some more local styles lacked in acidity and distinctiveness.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Very smooth, fragrant but soft on the palate. Very nice in Siena with a rare filet of beef cooked in pork fat and sauteed chard. I chose it because we were in Tuscany, and my wife is generally not a Sangiovese fan - this reveals the softer fruit side of Tuscan wine.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Cont'Ugo, such a name creates the imagination of a wine standing in the tradition of generations, a wine served at the last supper? All wrong it's "just" another quite recent family member of Antinori

* dark ruby red
* a bouquet of black current, ripe plum, spices like pepper, clove, anis, hints of leather and mocha 
* the taste dominated by power and decent sweetness, all accomplished by fine tannins indemnifying a long finish

Whoever Cont'Ugo was, he for sure missed a great wine
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Very good red Tuscan from Antinori :)) nice ruby red coluor,nose cherries, plums, raspberry, blueberries, sweet spices and herbal aromas. Very good harmony, long finish and nice pairng with Fiorentina steak.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: We went to this winery long before I joined Vivino. Had this bottle in the cellar. Deep vivid colour, ruby with garnet to the rim. M+ nose cherries, plum, then earth and vanilla. M+ finish, M acid, M+ tannins, very nicely integrated, not grippy at all, just slides right down
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: As you can see, I was at Antinori tasting :) and yes, it was great. All the wines we tasted are either very good or excelent. This one is very good. Dark fruits, hint of earthinest, full body. Rich wine.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: 2013 and then a 2015 both pop n pour. Drinks pretty well and a classic vintage. Everything you’d expected from a merlot in this price bracket from a good producer. Round and fruity. A flash of blueberries and mocha add richness to the palate. Bright enough in youth and medium everything means it’s an easy crowd pleaser.  91pts.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
Wow! This 100% Merlot from Bolgheri is a bold wine with aromas/flavours ok blackcurrants and cherries, earthy notes, licorice and a long spicy finish. Great wine now but has potential for evolution 
4.3pts.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note:
3.5 or 4.0 or ??? Difficult!
100% Merlot from Bolgheri. Very seductive nose like a fruit cake, ripe red berries and backing spices - maybe because Christmas is approaching. But on the palate a bit weak, short and with smooth tannins. But then after a while it becomes better. Disclosing more flavors. As said difficult and the price? Anyway I’m maybe to picky - 4.0!
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: wonderful color.  very little hue on the edges.  fell flat in the delivery in taste from what I was expecting.  I tasted this directly from the winery, but didnt buy a bottle.  I saved my cash for another heavy hitter.  this is a good wine and if someone serves it - DRINK IT!  you will not be dissatisfied.  but if you are shopping for a good wine, keep strolling.  that's my take on it.
Wine: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2017

Note: Not connecting with most reviews on this wine. Bought it because of the praise but I do not share the love. Dry and chalky and does not redeem itself on the finish as its not as refined as you’d expect. Perhaps some more time in the bottle?

Note:
What a pleasant surprise. You’d never say by the label that this book is actually a romantic drama. 
The first chapter made me curious, the second grabbed my attention...and the third made me fall into a deep cathartic state of adoration. 
Vague ambiguity on the nose, lustful delight on the taste buds and utter sexual daze down the trachea. 
When you go to the book store buy 50 Shades Of Grey. It’s not THAT bad, it’s actually legendary. 
Like this Wine. With a capital “W” for Win.

3.9 - a really nice and properly aged barbaresco, although a little thin on the finish. I bought this wine 2-3 years back and I’ve been wanting to open it several times. Paired with scallop, rocket leaf and dried tomato.

Super sexy hallmark Nebiollo nose spiked w a peculiar fresh mint scent. Really open after 3 hr decant. 

Palate has black fruit ripeness as if it was bottled last week. It does give way to a gorgeous dusty, gravelly, petally, eastern spice complexity. The more I taste the more I get from this.

Body seems weightless but it's dense + chewy w youthful concentration + poise. Headonistic traits. Evidence that Piedmonte produces living, breathing wines. 

Decades of potential. I should have aged longer.

Tasted alongside the Faset at the winery. A beautiful perfume nose of rose and herbs. Red fruit & mineral palette with leather finish. I think this one will be better again for more years evolution in the bottle. Great potential.

Light, red/orange color. Raspberries and sweet strawberries, leather, tobacco and herbs on the nose. Medium bodied, elegant, fresh acidity and a bit grippy tannins. My kind of wine!🍷
It starts with a delicate wooden hint at nose. In mouth it's clean, savoury, fmedium(+) body and for my taste is too extracted to be a Barbaresco even if it's well done.
Very tight and acidic for 3 days, after that got a bit soft and savory but I personally didn’t enjoy this bottle. Maybe already tired?

OMG! I've said it before, the more expensive an Italian wine is, the better it is. Not snobbish, just honest. It'd proved to be correct over & over again.
This is a wonderful Barbaresco (well, Nebbiolo).
The rather strong nose is a complex mix of dark berries & cherries, licorice, forest floor, leather, balsamic & tobacco. Haven't sniffed such a strong nose for quite a while. 
Dry, full body, good acidity and steady tannins. With dried cherries, red and dark berries, oak and spice on the palate. A must try!

Light ruby orange brick color showing some aging.. notes of strawberry, cherry, cranberry, blackberry, earthy, cedar. Medium body, soft tannin, complex flavor, medium long finish....

Revisited. Floral, herbal, and red fruit nose. Earthy and minerally crisp palate. It opens up to reveal red fruit element among the mix. Clingy tannin. Pretty mushroomy long. Some orange peel bitterness. Another subtle complexity kind that grows on me.

The Piedmont terroir and buff minerality really shine through on the palate, complemented by tart strawberries and a hint of ripe dark olives.  Seamlessly integrated tannins build up, plateau, and then soften into an ethereal finish.

"Tenue de soirée"
Today, "spicy date" with this charming & elegant Barbaresco!
She was a little shy at first glance, showing up with garnet red & bright reflections. Her aristocratic virtues replace gracefully her shyness and express an ample body, silky & ethereal. She get self confidence blossoming on crispy huckleberry, violet and delicately spicy. I'm slowly convinced, I really like her, and I think she does, because she lingers long with a compelling and seductive aftertaste :) 
Time for the bill ;))

Wine is clear, brightness is day bright, pale ruby, edge is pale pink, no gas, no sediment, viscosity high. 
Aroma is clean, red cherry, violet, fresh rose, mineral, farmyard aroma. 
Dry, medium + body, high acidity, medium tannin, medium + alcohol, finish is moderate +.

Another wine I had a few nights ago without the opportunity to rate it without being rude. Reminded me of a fine pinot noir. Light and refreshingly fruity. Motivated me to switch from the shiraz' that I love to the pinot noir variety for the next few months after I clear out my small cellar.

Pale ruby, orange rim, great nose reminds of violets and decaying fruit develops after 30min clove, cherries and blueberry aromas. Medium plus acidity and tannins, very smooth and surprisingly round. Long finish. Great barbaresco

This youthful, full- bodied Barbaresco wine is restrained but slowly reveals flavors and aromas of crushed violets, raspberry essence, baking spice and luxury tobacco scents.
The tannins are tightly packed so this cries for food and will certainly improve with some more cellaring time!
Dark cassis coloured Nebiolo with some bright acidity. Flavors of plum and prune come out. Tannins are well structured with graphite ans spice. Finishes with finesse and notes of chocolate and clove.

Shows beautiful feminine side of Nebbiolo grapes. Plenty of red fruits aroma, especially mixed berries hint of spices, velvet silky tannin until difficult to detect, high and lively acidity. When it bottle decant for few hours fully evolved and reached its maturity. More earthiness and liquorices. Enjoyed it with Cantonese cuisine and also nice to drink on its own.
Very good Barbaresco despite the fact hat I'm not a huge fan of the wine because I feel it doesn't have the body and the structure I look for in my reds.

3.7/3.8. This was still a bit closed. I like Chiarlo especially as I've been following their wines for some time.  The nose is led by tar and balsamic although some freshness of strawberries do come through. I think the palate is a bit rough at the moment and more structured than other Barbarescos of same vintage.  It's finish is long.  I think this is nice but needs more time in bottle or air to balance out.  One to try in 5 years
Beautiful body, well rounded with flavors of pepper, tobacco. Had with veal osso bucco and paired very well.
Red fruit - strawberry with a hint of cranberry. Smooth and long finish. A very elegant and lovely wine.
Floral aromas, elegant, good acidity with mild tannins
Light maroon color. Aromas of red berry with raspberry and currants on the tongue. Medium to light. Silky soft tannins. Seems to have reached its peak. Minus half star due to high price
Decant 2hrs. Taste leather at beginning. Clove at body. Nice aroma. Ruby red color.

Dried rose nose. Red fruit, clove notes. Breathing makes licorice arise. Old style barbaresco always delights me with the silky palute and berries' tastes. Someone might think they are frugal, but I believe it is etiquette and formality for the good wine.
I was expecting this required 1-2 hrs of decent but i was wrong. Its immediately ready perhaps its modernist approach. Sweet snd fine tannins. Easy but not simple!

M intensity ruby colored wine fading to a clear rim.  A slight bricking has begun.  Nose is m+ intensity with dark cherries, camphor, dried rose petals, spun sugar. A cherry, rose, violet oak juice bomb! The only thing that is palatable on this wine is it's acidity. Otherwise the harsh bitter oak tannins remain in your mouth making this wine impossible to drink. Such a pity for a wonderful Cru like asili in Barbaresco.

Open and perfumed, with aromas of sandal wood, sour cherries, plum, toasted wood, black olives, smoked meat, medicinal & stems.
The palate has sharp acidity, great concentration and tannins that are ripe, firm but fine grained. Medium bodied, and extremely complex with a long length.
This wine is ageing perfectly well and I believe this is at the peak. It should keep for another 3-5 years and start declining. A great example of tannin extraction with enough fruit to support the long ageing.

2018 vintage - 4.5 or 95/100 - I absolutely love this wine! Yeast and buttery blueberry sugared pastry on the nose with vanilla and light toasted sweet oak. Earthy clay and gravel on the palate. A bit of salty brine at the beginning of the sip, immediately followed by some milk chocolate, very bitter blackberries and light tobacco. Tannins are surprising fine for a young vintage. Finish of cigar, bitter oak, rubber and mineral with lasting tannins. This is a home run for $50. Will absolutely buy more!
Definite hints of graphite in this young wine. Fruit needs time to develop.
Phenomenal wine - so much flavor! strong notes of oak and cherry . Love love love!
Black fruit, leather and oak. Wine to impress! Really good after taste.
Blackberry earthy and robust.
wonderful bouquet with blackberry and dark cherry. great finish

A good complex wine with a delicious flavor and goes very well with pretty much any food. A little on the light side which is very nice.

Deep purple in color. Aromas of  dark fruit, blackberries, minerals, and smoke on the nose. Very smooth on the palate with notes of  black cherry,  plum,  blackcurrant, chocolate and oak. Tannins and acidity balanced along with a succulent finish. Decant for 1 hour and experience the journey!

Deep purple with aromas of oak, vanilla and dark berry. Blended tannins, earthy and rich and flavorful with a long smooth finish. Be bold and try with grilled salmon. Will pair with many different entrees
4.2 much younger than the L’oratoire plus not enough time to breathe BUT still very well structured promising a lot for the next hour to come. Cheers

Dark ruby with a purple hue. Fragrant and floral nose of violet, cassis, dark berries and discreet oak. Still young but highly potent. 
92/100
Cedar, caramelized black fruit, silky, elegant and lovely integrated tannins.  This is my fav vintage Fomplegade so far.

I love merlot based wines and this left banker is a winner. Dark purple with medium heavy legs. Aromas of darker fruits with hints of cola and cherry. The texture is full and long lasting... loved it
Clear, but deep red.  Aroma of slate, chalk, some herbal notes and oak.  Dry, tannic, full bodied.  Sharp flavors of stone, pepper, blackberry, wherbs/flowers and clay.

This and the 2010 are drinking great right now. Pretty red fruit floral and anise nose. Wood tannin spice and mocha frame mostly light dark fruit flavors. It has a bit of youthful red fruit flavor as well. Overall very consistent label between multiple vintages. Full body and smooth tannins.

Outstanding wine! It’ still young and has great potential. Well balanced, full body, perfect acidity and velvety tannins. Distinct oak notes in palate. Fruitiness will still develop in years to come. In 5 years the wine will develop into a great Saint-Emilion, worth a five star rating.

4.3 - One hour decant. Very deep ruby color. Blueberry, sweet magenta mushroom, and subtle oaky baking spice on the nose. Smooth, super tongue drying palate. Firm, full tannins on the longish finish.

I was pleasantly surprised by this bottle. Lots of room for further improvement. Great QPR here. Longer decant is advisable (2-3 hours).

Appearance: ruby red, medium intens, clear. 
Nose: developing, clean condition, medium intens. Aromas of cedar, vanilla, jammy, cassis, red currant, vegetal tone.
Palate: dry, medium intens, high acidity, high tannins, medium (+) body. 
Assessment: outstanding wine.  Potential for aging.  Consistent over the years.  90% Merlot, 10% Cabarnet Franc.  Stéphane Derenoncourt.

Wow. Bone dry. Lots of tobacco. Not too juicy. Exactly what I expect from a fine Bordeaux. 

Dramatically less expensive than the site here suggests. Maybe $22 at Costco?
Black fruit, vanilla, leather and earthy notes. Deep ruby with soft mouthfeel and gentle tannins. Pleasant but not exciting, a straightforward Bordeaux with fair value.
Solid right bank bordeaux, deep purple. Not quite as good as the cabernet dominated left bank bordeaux I had tonight. Nevertheless a great great wine!
Gorgeous st emilion grand cru oozing with style and finesse - touches of tobacco, red cherry & plums finished with vanilla and soft berries - lovely wine

4.3- outstanding. Will try again when 20 years old for sure ! 

- deep ruby

Although the fruit notes are more subtle, the wine itself is assertive with good presence.  Smooth, lasting finish with light acidity.  4.20.18

94 pts. Tried the 14’ vintage of this wine before but the 15’ vintage really takes a step up form that. So classic St. Emillion with good fruit character. Just very well balanced with the power of the fruit and the notes from the cask. Good amount of round and juicy tannins.
Drink now or hold for 10+ years.

Bought 2 bottles 3 years ago and tried the first bottle 3 years ago.  Didn't like it much, gave it a 3.5.  Opened this one, not expecting much and it knocked me over it was so good.  My bad for drinking the first one so young.  So smooth, balanced, luscious,and elegant.  Great intensity of flavors and complexity. Complimentary and well integrated oak, blackberry, tobacco, cassis, and red fruit.  95% Merlot and 5% Cab Franc.  Just ordered 4 bottles of the 2016.

On the nose raspberries, minerals and coffee.

On the palate medium bodied with silky tannins and a chocolaty finish.

Liked this so much, had to get another bottle. Almost all Merlot with about 5% Cab Franc, aromas of berry fruits with floral herb notes and earthy tones. On the palate blackberry and blueberry flavors with licorice and cedar notes. Fine ripe tannins, medium finish ending with toasty earthy notes and mineral character. Nice now but give it a few years. Good value for a wine that will reward with aging.
