This is one of the better Bordeaux’s that I have enjoyed.  It went very well with a Fathers Day ribeye!
Still a bit on the tannic side. Medium dark fruits, smooth wood, bit of light tobacco but not much. Acid slightly high maybe. Deep colour and weight

Scent: Medium intensity. Plum, vanilla, blackcurrants, dark chocolate, raw meat, artificial raspberry candy, green bell pepper & butterscotch. Very fruit forward.

Looks: Medium dense red/purple.

Mouthfeel: Dry. ABV: 14,5%. Medium plus acidity. Medium plus tannin level. Medium plus body. Overpriced in my opinion.

Grape varieties: 95% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Franc. The average age of the vines equals 30 years. Fermentation in oak barrels. Maturation for 19 months in French oak barrels of which 60% were new.

I was lucky enough to enjoy this after a tour of the beautiful biodynamic vineyard in St Emilion. A merlot and cabernet franc blend, made from a mosaic of 27 parcels of land on limestone and clay soils. Dark fruits, cassis and plum with good tannic structure - and it's only going to get better too. Shame I couldn't bring any bottles home. A very welcoming chateau, well worth a visit!

4.3. This is a powerful Merlot with a tiny parcel of Cab Franc. Dark inky color, concentrated, full bodied and with structure to age for decades. Very impressive. Intense and tasty,  well balanced, with aromas and flavors of black ripe fruits, chocolate, oak, and beginning to present slight mature notes as leather and tobacco. The finish is long and with mineral hints (crushed stones).

Delightful Saint-Émilion, by the super consistent Château Fonplégade!
Lovely dark & earthy notes - cherry, blackcurrants, plum with hints of red berries! Background of earthiness, oak & air cured tobacco with touch of herbs & pepperiness.
Great flavour profile& amplitude - cherries, berries & earthiness on the palate with solid finish.
Dry, med+ body & acidity with med complexity & slightly grippy tannins.
Overall, delightful wine with great character & plenty more years to delight! 4.2🌟

Happy valentine's day aka my first date and engagement anniversary with my wife (got married in 2010).   Big black and blue fruits with charcoal,  mint, eucalyptus,  and cedar along with tannins that are still showing fairly well.  No rush, easily have a decade plus to go.

Smooth and delicate on the palate.  Rich notes of ripe cherry and earth on the nose.  Fruit forward with a vanilla finish and gentle tobacco and leather on the finish.  Overall, just a delight of a wine to be paired with a meat or savored on its own.

A very interesting Saint Emilion. Intense, bold and elegant. After 10 years, this wine is still very much alive, but starting to show mature notes. On the nose, it shows some balsamic, dark fruit and jam aromas. In the mouth, it's a full bodied red, with nice tanins, good acidity and notes of cassis, blackberry , vanilla, chocolate, leather, tobacco and stone.
This is an amazing Merlot with a touch of Cabernet Franc, with great aging potential.

Decanted this wine about an hour before serving and it did not disappoint, strong berry flavours followed by a dark chocolate smoothness. I paired this with a lovely Duck Confit with roasted vegetables and it went perfectly.
I feel this wine does require food however so we did follow up with something less robust afterwards.

Ruby colour, complex nose with warm notes of Cherry, Plum, Cassis and Baked Apple, transitioning from green Laurel notes for sweet Licorish, Oak and Vanilla aromas. The mouth is dry, high in acidity and quite spicy. There is a bit of oxidation but nothing alarming for a 2011 vintage. It finishes very long with some dry notes and medium to soft tannins. This wine feels young and old at the same time, but I would still wait a couple more years to let the aromas dominate.

Deep garnet color from core to rim. Might seem like a young wine but it isn’t quite. Aromas of red fruit, fig, truffle, pencil lead. Vibrant mouthfeel with a fleshy, velvety texture that shows this wine has more aging potential—perhaps one or two more years—, though it is already opening. Quite a marvelous bottle! Must repeat.

When a bottle of GCC has reached its prime, it just becomes an aged GCC 😀 

Some say it has pasted it peak. I find this very interesting and enjoyable, a delicious ensemble of Merlot and Cab Franc, indeed.

🍷 Med garnet soupy body.

👄 Smooth, soupy, well balanced and still very complex. Delicious with clear stamp of a great right bank. Enjoyable drop that withstands the test of time. 

Thanks to @[1|2197491|Teerawut Intaramongkol] 🙏

Super earthy on the nose! Wow! Old old old!! Powerful! Lots of substance. Smooth and grainy old tannins. Very good. Summer likes it! This is one of the few right bank Saint Emillion wines that Summer likes. Still lots of presence and texture.

Very good wine, with room to develop further over the next few years. Blackberry, black cherry, plum, vanilla, leather and earthy notes on the nose. On the palate the wine has well integrated tannins, medium+ acidity and is moving towards full bodied with a long finish. Benefited from an hour of aeration before drinking. 4.3⭐️

As anyone reads my profile it is obvious I love French wine, and 2010 is within budget of best year for me. Also Saint Emilion terroir..always a hit. This bottle will be bought again and (hopefully) put away to save.

1H breathing. 10y5m.
C: Med ruby
N: Intense vanilla, cocoa, plum, blackcurrant, sweet tobacco & smoke. Med+ complex, oak & black fruit heavy.
P: Black fruit -> baking spices, pepper, tobacco -> plum & smoke. Med+ conc, length & acid, med bod, light soft tannins. In sweet spot, an elegant & soft right bank. Balanced b/ tert & fruits. Pretty, easy going & great qpr @ £25. By 2025. 91p.

Very nice St Emilion Grand Cru, not as well known as some other popular Chateaux but equally good in a great vintage 2006. Smooth yet a little tannic which promises a few more years of aging potential, it’s pleasant on the palate now. It’s has both Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon markers, with dark fruit, plum, venison, pepper, chocolate, leather and vanilla aromas.

Having been impressed with its second wine, we searched and found this beauty from a wine shop in UK a few years ago. Excellent delicate wine worth the price and expectation. Still a bit young in early ‘19 but drinkable. Bold and a bit fruity, right-bank style. Will open another bottle in a few year’s time.

This is a wonderful Bordeaux. It comes from the 2012 reclassified grand Crus from Bordeaux. Full body, balanced, great minimality, soft tannins, and moderate alcohol. I loved it. Excellent price for a high end Bordeaux.

Deep ruby colored, translucent wine (despite 10 years of age). Strong aroma intensity of intense earthy notes - animal dander, sawdust, musk, soil, funky cedar; hints of dill. Really no fruity notes stand out. Palate confirms the metallic earthy character. Structure of puckering medium plus tannin, medium minus acid, medium body (13.5%).

Rich herbaceous and floral aromas with an homogeneous red carmine color impart an extremely pleasant preamble for what is about to come. A touch of juiciness at first  followed by an extraordinarily smooth dry tenure with just a tiny bit of acidity that persists throughout an everlasting sweetness beyond compare. A beautifully crafted St Emilion.

A grand wine from a famous chateau, of the right bank of Bordeaux. 
Ruby - brown color. 
This wine is in his downhill this year. 
Aromas of blackberries and vanilla. 
Round pleasant taste in the mouth. 
Full body, enough tannins. 
13%vol. You must drink it this year.

Magnum special of this wine. Great wine with afternoon BBQ on the river with sausages and onions. Just wonderful. Wine was deep red mahogany crushed berry aroma and dark berry flavor with moderate tannins. Long finish. Wish I had more.

I rarely review wines on the spot, but when I do, it is a sign that the thing pleased me beyond measure. The good thing here is when a bottle tells you that wine hierarchies are relative and often futile. This was a wine that started as a stupid overcooked Cabernet Sauvignon that ended up being one of the best St Emilion I ever had with a majestic combination of Merlot and more importantly, Cabernet Franc!!! Amazing!

This is really improved on its last showing - a little softer, which has allowed a beautiful cherry fruit to come forward. Great tannin & balance, smooth, silky, and easy to drink - but with a really sophisticated poise.

I uncorked this bottle, last tasted 4+ years ago (see note) for Woman's day.
Dark red colour, cherry ring.
Nose of strawberries, cassis, cigar box, leather and tobacco.
Powerful attack with prominent but round tannins, beautifully structured.
Flavours of red fruits, plums, leather and cedar with a mushroom background.
Very long caudalies of red fruits and cedar, nice tannic final.
Patience pays: This wine evolved beautifully as expected. 
Can be drink now but it shall improve in the next 5-10+ years.

This is a true grand cru French wine from the house of Chateau Fonplegade. Color dense purple
The nose blueberry, black raspberry and flowers. The tannins are sweet the palate is berries, spices, herbs and plum.

This is a rich, full body velvety textured Bordeaux paired w a grilled Ribeye and steamed broccoli
Very good but not blown away.
I like this. Stole it from my boss. Good come up.
Bold and dry. Tobacco, leather, blackberries and oak. Very good.
Great price / value
Nice combo of oak leather earthy plum plum vanilla tobacco in tour hands 🍷🍷🍷
Very oaky on the palate and nose, high tannis, not my favorite
Not powerful but pure and pretty. Cherry layered over earth and leather.
Acidity, medium tannin
Beautiful. Smooth. A perfect wine for dinner on New Year’s Eve.

中文酒評在迴響欄
Farewell party for my friend who has assigned by his company to China deal a big project, this incense red shows our feeling and we already miss him- intense perfume with creamier aromas of vanilla/dark chocolate on the nose, full bodied with round tannins that sticky on your tongue with ripe plum/ black raspberry, warm spicy lingering with slightly tobacco that made this gem sparkle and shine!

4.2! This Saint Émilion GCC is far from peak, but shows plenty of finesse and potential. When compared to the other SE we opened, this one is much earthier, less jammy, and a bit more refined.

Color is very deep ruby with minimal rim variation.

Nose with medium intensity of black fruit, vanilla, sandy dust, cocoa, and tobacco.

Dry, full bodied, with dusty tannins, slightly edgy acidity, and a moderate to long finish.

—->

Remarkable vintage.  This wine is still young and yet the fruitiness and freshness fills rhe nose.  On the palate, you can feel the tannins, earthy,  smoky flavours and it last quite a while.  Still young and will be better to decant for 2 hours for the aromas to open up.

Tannins grippy up front but with a smooth end. More tannins than acid; more florals than sweet. Honeydew, grapefruit, orange, honeysuckle, black currant, tomatoes, petroleum, olive, date, dragon fruit.

Château Fondplégade Saint-Emilion Grand Cru Classe 2016

🏆 Plush, rich, utterly satisfying. Great wine hitting its prime!
Disclaimer: the rating might be slightly impacted by my fondness for St Emilion 😂

🍇 Merlot, Cab Franc

👁 Dark ruby

👃 Ripe plum, creamy chocolate blueberry tart, tobacco leaf, nutmeg

👅 Dry, med+ body w med tannin, med+ alc at 14.5%, med acidity. Notes of plum, cherry, blackberry, leather, mocha w hints of dried herbs, ripe red fruit, bramble & cedar. Such an amazing treat!
Fantastic left back beauty. Love the red cherries and strawberry on the nose.  Great tannin structure.  Love it.  Great value 👌
So nice and fruity! And long finish!
94 pts
Beautiful wine to finish of a great evening with friends. The wine is a heavy boy with nice tones of blackberry, plum and some leather. All in all a smooth wine with a velvety drink. Lovely.
Deep ruby, dry, concentrated, aromas of ripe dark berries, cassis, pencil shavings, smoke, cedar, and oak. A tight and powerful wine with slightly gritty tannins and a long aftertaste.
Magnificent. Everything I hope for in French wine. Amazing with mint chocolate and fatty salami
This has changed my opinion of Merlot.  Awesome example from a fantastic winemaker.   Black fruit, red fruit, vanilla, earthiness.  Complex, balanced, and delivers on the aromas.
Been drinking too much Napa wine lately so opened this French wine tonight. Still very tannic and young. Lots of blackberry and plum on the nose. Some minerality but long lasting finish.
3.7. The hit of this vertical. Very light vanilla & sweet cherry nose. A touch bitter; by far the best integrated of the 3. Rich caramel. Soft leather finish.
One of our favorites! Super bold Bordeaux
Beautiful.  Ink nose.  Black cherry.  Vanilla.  Smooth.  This Is why you need to ignore these wines for a decade+

awesome fruity, massive flavor profile, toasty oak 94pt robt parker
Drinking beautifully now in 2021!!!
Fat rich full bodied. Very delicious and still a ways to go.  Long finish with great character and strength. Will evolve.

An excellent young wine from the Right Bank! 
Floral and earthy. Decent for at least an hour and enjoy!
Stunning complexity, oxidative characters of stewed red fruits, prunes and distinct minerality. Stunning drink!
Powerful Bordeaux. Great to see it developing the luscious sweet fruitiness over the years. Still one of my favorites.
Really big, really dry. Crazy interesting nose where I got bacon, chocolate and leather. A ton of wood on the palate.
Wonderful aroma:  blackberry, currants, leather, earth.  Blackberry upfront, full body, light acidity, ripe tannins.  Dry, chalky finish.  Nice food wine.

Tobacco, green pepper and mushrooms together in a tight little package. 
Tannins are still a little sharp so a few years in the cellar will only improve the impression.
Picked up for $59, yummy dark fruits.  Recently moved, so haven’t had anything worth mentioning for a couple months.  Would buy again.
Good

A delicious wine. The wine is very earthy and you can smell the oak, leather and minerals. It is full of plum, cassis, and dark fruit flavours. Decanted this for about 30mins. I still it may have been better if we waited another day 2 years for this but I felt the wine had a fairly short finish.

Sight alcohol nose which I’m sure will turn to a softer Aroma..beautiful deep red color, dry and bold.. tannins are strong and muscular.. dark cherry chocolate, tobacco, leather,, as I mentioned dry , substantial minerals.. this needs time then attention.. oh man.. 10 minutes later .. a softer power house..softer by the minute, richer deeper fuller , complex fruit, substantial..

This is a delightful Emilion. From the great 15 vintage early in the window but already a triumph. Deep purple, pronounced aromas of red cherry raspberry and redcurrant. On palette, dry, medium + acidity, medium + tannin, cherry and blackcurrant big primary fruit with spice and hints of vanilla. Loads of development and improvement awaits already impressive. 4.25

4.2 - Bouquet jumps out the glass! This wine comes from great dirt and winemaking pedigree (Rolland & Derenocourt). Biodynamic farming leads to an earthy and pure fruit experience. Creme de cassis, fresh dark berries, vanilla, and hints of mineral rich soil make for a beautiful nose.

This wine has depth, concentration, and true to its terroir. Pure fruits, excellent tannin structure and length. Love the espresso, tar, and gravel on the finish. Slightly oaky. Black cherries showcase the long finish. 92+ pts

A sneaky look at a sixer I decided to open on a cool Friday night... we loved Chateau Fonplegade when we visited in 2017, and couldn’t resist buying their best from the blockbuster 2015 vintage. Clearly young, but a powerful precursor to what this will be in 8-10 years... fresh blueberries, a whiff of white chocolate (Lindt balls?), then overtaken in the palate by sandalwood, lead pencil and a lick of birchwood... still so early... still tannic... but potential? Yes!

🍇 Merlot,  Cabernet Franc 
👁 Ruby red with grenade shades 
👃 Oak, leather, blackberry, vanilla on the nose 
👅 Nice sourness,  velvet tannins but a touch of rouch tannins,  medium-long persistence. 

4.1 / 5.0 Nice Saint Emillion Grand Cru.

Glass service at home 120ml

4.2. Great right bank probably mostly Merlot to finish the week. Pronounced  cherry, black fruit and  blackberry on the palate, with structured oak,  earthy and to bocci notes. Full body and long mineral finish. Deep Bordeaux color with a rust/brownish edge. Drink now

It’s a big wine. Lots of new oak. Lots and lots of new oak. Deep dark garnet red. Big ripe dark as night cherry and plum, some vanilla, hints of tabacco and tar when it open up. It’s aggressive on the palate, like most good 2015 Red Bordeaux tend to be. It needs time. Feels a little syrupy in the mouth. Lots of good tannic structure. I feel like the tannins should be greener than they taste, so it has probably seen a nice amount of oxygen. I’d like to try this again in 8 years.

Perfectly balanced. Great earthy notes of tobacco and vanilla with plenty of red fruit on the palate. Cherry, plum, red apple. All come to life with a medium to long finish that leaves you longing for the next sip. What a gem!!!

The nose, very floral and oaky. On the palette, very dark berries, cinnamon, silkily texture. This was drunk without decanting, should show even more if done so. Very well structured wine, lots of tannins.

Blackberry, cassis, flowers, dried herbs, and wet earth on an alluring nose. Medium plus body; loads of big, sticky, and young tannins; light plus acidity; medium viscosity; plenty of black fruit and an anise like flavor on the mouth but missing a bit midpalate, like Fonplegade is wont to do. Finish is long with a clean minerality. This vintage is a major improvement over the 2012, the last vintage I had that nearly turned me off of Fonplegade entirely. Very good wine that needs a lot of maturity.

Lovely, but still a bit young. Tannins a bit harsh maybe, but so fresh and smooth, yet with power and a noticable body. Oaky, blackcurrant dominate at first but opens up more flavours with air-time. Lots of lyers I cant really get a hold on here. 4,2!

2014
Dark purple 
Mint. Forest floor.  Herbal. Blue fruit
Palate is a burst if dark blueberry. Oak. Cedar. Some tobacco. Opens up with time. A complex wine. Slight sherry Brandy finish. 
Nice tannins are grippy. Full. Great long finish.   92 pts. 4.2
A lighter brighter style of Saint Emilion compared to others I have tired. Loads of red cherry and floral notes. Very young but can be enjoyed with Long period of aeration.
94 pts
Plum, vanilla
A nice and powerful Bordeaux.
Dirt, earth, grippy tannins. Excellent wine.
Full of secret, very well aged.
Smooth. Lovely with steak.
Dominant merlot blend with all the characteristics. Full bodied with big round fleshy mouth feel. Nice acidity for food pairing.  Delightful.

4.4
Slight hint of acity otherwise really great
On the second trial, alongside a lovely cut of Scottish fillet beef, this is the business. Lovely complex flavours and powerful tannins.
Rich full body

91 p.
 
On the way down. 

No notes
Aging nicely! One bottle left…
Sooo tannic! Barely even full bodied but so over the top in the teh tarik department.
Very good Saint Emillon with great elegance and fruit from difficult hot year.
91. Masculine, chewy, ripe, dark plum, nice cf tone.  Wait 5+ years.  Even with 4 hours air, not smoothed out.  Will be better
Truffles. Red berries. Spicy. Smokey. Smoother taste. Soft tannins. Good to drink. Warming.
90/100. Paired with Cote de Boeuf. Best pairing out of USA (Jordan Cab. Sauvignon 2011) and Spain (Superius Quod 2012 from Bodegas Hispano+Suizas).
Excellent balance of black and red berries, little ew barrel, a delight

4.0 stars
No notes taken
Very good St Emilion

93+/100.
Earthy, mushrooms.
Definitely good under all aspects.
Medium body, oak and fruity, smooth and silky
Good value, little bit spicy, acid, bit oak, earthy. Very long after taste. Special.
Fruity & Oaky, Fresh, Bright, full body, vanilla, caramel, red fruit, citrus, fine tannin.
Fuml bodied, yet easy drinking. Complex nose and mouth. Loooooooong finish.
Fantastically smooth and rich
An excellent Bordeaux, developed nicely after 6 years.
Still a baby, let it open up for an hour or so
The fruit is still fantastic on this one! Cherry and pomegranate with leather and brown sugar. Some deeper tobacco violet notes.
Wow. Nice second try of the region.
oak earthy blackberry
Rather tasty! Bold and Oaky very smooth. Perfect for a Braai

A very bold wine that needs to breathe 15-20 or use the aerator but opens nicely and we enjoyed a charcuterie board. The group found it strong at first but by the third sip the pallet adjusted and was liked. I rated it higher than normal as it was our first bottle of the evening. Wanted to open up something different for Xmas Eve.
Great nose. Dark fruit plum and oak. Classic Bordeaux. Could do with ageing another couple of years. A little sharp initially but softened and opened up after about 30 mins. Very pleasant
Big licorice on the nose and palette. Cassis, black currant, blackberry, flowers, cedar, oak. A little heat but suspect would integrate. Very very young, lots of potential.
What an amazing wine! Softly textured, medium bodied wine, with a fresh spicy character to its, black raspberry and plum fruits. Still celebrating my birthday with this great wine 🍷
red cherry, plum, cassis, violet? Some oak, vanilla. High tannin full body med+finish
Tannin, leather, citrus, oak
Amazing wine.. Expensive but worth it
Can’t wait for this to mature for a few more years.  Had a bottle to celebrate, complex, earthy, big, beautiful
Dense tannic encased cassis oozing power but needs time to gain balance and restraint. Wait 2 years before trying again.
Unexpectedly good French wine for less than $40!  Make sure you decant it for no less than 2 hours.....
Excellent. Nice dark red. Well balanced tanin and acidity. A good dry finish.  A full mouth feel. Will buy again
Big bold and full of dark berry/plum flavors. Decanting necessary allowing wine to be more welcoming. Long dry finish

Day one - tannins still blanketed the palate after three hour decant. Returning rest to bottle. 

Day two - This was significantly better. The tannins softened to allow the dark fruits, oak and hints of dark chocolate and vanilla to emerge. 

Would recommend decant for significantly longer (5-6 hours) or giving this one 2-3 more years to age in bottle.

Cab Merlot 6/8
Impressive SE grand cru classé. 95/5 Merlot/CF. 
Intense dark cherry. Aromas: intense, black fruit, plum, herbs, tobacco, chocolate, vanilla. 
Flavours of cherry and more wood. Balanced with prominent tannins. May become smoother with another year or two. Or with decanting. This was a little too hurried.

4.25. Not quite ready for drinking but great potential. Solid structure with plenty of intensity and complexity. Plum, cherry, violet, cigar box, and a hint of chocolate. Would love to try this again in a few years.
Blackberry, leather, fresh mud - earthy, tobacco oak, funk and good tannin. I waited a long time. There is a lot going on. Nice to have a great bottle on. Monday night!
Needs few hours to open up but a beauty once it does. Can feel the hot summer, loads of licorice
Eye: dark violet ruby, long legs. Nose: plum, blueberry, licorice. Palate: bold, mouthful and juicy. Enough powerful and acidic, almost in balance. 4.2
Nice velvety deep dark fruit with hints of plum, vanilla and a little smoke.  Nice big fruit and followed by a smooth finish.   Good for evening drinking
Maybe a little biased, since I visited this winery a few years ago.  This is one of the few worth the extra money. Great balance, red fruits and just enough oak.
Smell of mint and deep red colour on the eye and a lovely nose then cigar box followed by vanilla cedar and stewed fruits and balance of tannin ma and sweetness
Tastes very good to me.
One of the finest wines I’ve had in recent memory. Full bodied and complex but not heavy. Perfect acid/tannin balance, lovely mouthfeel and long finish.
7/2018: good wine, but not my preference. Plums to much present, tastes a bit singulier, even after 5h open and decanted. Not sure, but probably over the top.

Intense red colour. 
Aromas of blackcurrant, blackberry, soft spices.
Smooth texture with ripe tannins.
91% Merlot, 7% Cabernet Franc, 2% Cabernet Sauvignon
Derenoncourt Consultants 2017 Tasting
Nice St Emilion, youthful and bright with firm tannins and good balance.  However, overshadowed in the tasting next to the 2015 Fleur Cardinale which was superb.  Fonplegade gets a 91/100.

Surprisingly big wine for being a 95% Merlot 5% Cabernet Franc blend. Very dense ink like core. Nice mature fruit with a freshly rolled cigar finish girded by pervasive tannins and a long finish. This wine will age wonderfully. Can't wait to try my other 5 bottles in 3-5 years!

Black cherries, dry herbs, chocolate and hint of leather on the nose.  Tart cherries and plum on the palate.  Medium-plus body.  Bone dry and tight, strong tannins.  Would go well with heavy, creamy red meat dishes.

3.8. Greatly maligned by the group. I initially rated it higher but then dropped it a bit. However, upon tasting hours later it seemed to have once again improved. Well balanced, nicely integrated, solid acids. Quite feminine and elegant.

Wow wow - this is young hence the bags of flavour - blackberries plum cherry 
Slightly harsh still in the mouth - tannin heavy - oak and tobacco - plenty of depth and stacks more to come. To be woken up again in 5 years I feel. 90 points - yes I believe it is

Deep burgundy color, accessible already and drinking nicely, nose smells of eucalyptus, cacao, cigar box, black plum, black cherry, star anise, clove, leather, hibiscus and mineral, balanced acidity with resolves tannin and full body, tastes of black cherry, blackberry, dark chocolate, licorice, clove, anise, hazelnut, cedar, Nutella and brie cheese, creamy and round.

Fonplegade translates to “fountain of plenty,” founded in 1852 by legendary wine merchant Jean-Pierre Beylot.

The aroma is super rich of cherry and blackberry with a touch of licorice and wet stone (probably from the concrete aging). On the palate I get notes of plum and blackberry with subtle leather and oak.

Full bodied with concentrated, mouth coating tannins. I could see this becoming a stunner in only a couple years, the great advantage to purchasing right bank Bordeaux.

A rather massive wine, especially compared next to its 2013 bottle! It's rather a good sign, cellarmaster was wise enough to adapt vinification to the vintage.
There's concentration and creamy tension, I'd love to taste it again in 10 years.

What a joy this claret has been! Now open for over 5 hours and the glass on glass development has been a treat. Stunning nose of coffee, pencil shavings and liquorice. Bold mouthfeel with delightful grip and warming treacle and winter fruit. Finish is long and multi layered. I like this a lot and will go longer! 4 stars.

4.5 stars for helping me get through Dry January. 
Thank you Bordeaux for all that you do.
Splendid.  Very powerful nose.  A little sour up front but very full bodied. Well-balanced and slightly dry like a wine like this should be.
Top top top...
Yumm cherry crisp clean
Subtle hints of blackberry, black cherry overshadowed by a more dominant earthy, leathery, oak counterparts. Merlot heavy and characterizes old world wines.
Dark fruit, leather, maybe a bit too tannic
Flavors of plum and strawberries.  Spicy finish with a hint of pepper on the tongue.  Must breath 1 hour  (2 better). I have a 2012 I am going to drink tonight!
Really nice. Nose has hints of tart berry with forest floor and cedar. Palate with tart cherry, graphite, vanilla, tobacco.
A little harsh even after decanting. Lots of earthiness, and red fruit. Still developing, give it some time.
Good Bordeaux. Mine had a little cork taint I think. But despite that, deep purple in color, and lots of dark berry fruits
White pepper and cedar nose, medium body, bell peppers, plum, medium tannins, herbs at the end. Tobacco in finish.
Smooth, dry, and somehow refreshing

An ancient vineyard
Bent fountains and twisted springs
Youthful, fruity, fresh
88 - feminine nose and less concentrated fruit.
Solid, but not worth $40-45; plenty of other great options in the $30 range
Great fruit and smooth tannins. Drink now!  If you love the Right Bank, this is why!
outstanding wine for the price
Fine right bank Bordeaux. Hints of cherry and cola.
Cherry and blackberry on the nose smooth and dry in the mouth with vanilla and black pepper on the finish. Minerals and earth linger
Subtlety and class!
Earthy, young but lots of potential. Nice and soft.
Really nice and fruit forward Blackberry is dominant. Also mushroom leather flavors
4.1. Needs a few more years in bottle but is developing well.
Gorgeous wine. Deep berry taste.

Still young 🍷 
Pairing well with veal medallions
oak blackberry earthy leather plum

Tried as part of a tasting. Rich, full, smooth. Noticed a darker chocolate note.
Nice, nice. Very well balanced
Smell of Dried Fruit, Vanilla, Ripe Plum, Eucalyptus, Tobacco

Very ripe aromas of black plum, plum, blackberry and black currant. Hints of red fruit. Earthy tones along with leather, cedar, anise and oak. 
Medium acidity, ripe dry tannins.
89-90
Earthy on the nose. Mushroom and soil. Absolutely beautiful in the glass. The deepest purple I have ever seen. Balanced and thick dark fruit on the tongue. Plum and blueberries.
Strong blackberry and black cherry on the nose with earthy and oak. Smooth. The fruit is carried to the incredibly smooth finish. You get the complex notes on the end that is just delicious.
Blackberry plum and dark fruit complemented by light oak and leather. Tending to be bolder but still incredibly smooth finish
Good stuff.
Tasting
Its Bordeaux!
Fantastic!

3.7 Score probably because I had too many excellent wines.  This 2015 Fonplegade is a nice daily or table wine to enjoy with family or guests.  I bought them from Costco.  Typical right bank Merlot characters.  Aromas include oak leather, plum, blackcurrant, and lots of earthy.  Medium to high bodied, balanced acidic and tannic, approachable and good finished.  Opened this second bottle on 1/17/2022.
Deep ruby colour, full body. Oak and leather notes plus dark fruit. Very pleasant and well balanced.
A fantastic, smooth, dark yet elegant wine. Plum and blueberry hits you and then a smooth leather and slight hints of tobacco finishes it off
Very young. Deep color, nose is pushed back with smokines of oak, same as palate. Very dominant oak, very young, but soft with good tanin.
Black fruit: black currant, plum, bramble. It’s all black and it’s full bodied and bold. I prefer my clarets a little softer with a mixture of red/black fruits so I’m giving this 3.5.
3 years later, still tight, tannic, tart cherry with noticeable barnyard notes on the nose and palate. Maybe in another few years it will open a bit but this may be a hold for a while!
Very smooth, especially at 14.5 % alcohol.

Beautiful deep ruby with powerful aromas of red fruit, mushrooms, cooked plums, toast, cedar box, cured meat. Wine is developing. Palate: dry, extremely smooth and pleasant tannins, full body, medium alcohol, pleasant flavors of minerals, blackberries and vanilla. Finish is pleasant and medium. Very good wine to enjoy now or can be aged for probably 10 more years.

The nose is fruity, elegant and finessed .
It reveals notes of blackberry fruit, cassis essence and savory scents of plum preserves and blueberries associated with discrete touches of violets, mocha , Szechuan pepper and mild spice tones.
The palate shows fruity, well defined and in overall balance and offers a mineral frame and a pleasant silky matter.
The mouthfeel expresses flavors of cassis , crunchy wild strawberries, tobacco leaves and a whiff of creamy milk chocolate .
Tannins are refined, good length!
Great, easy but still full bodied French.

Plums on the nose, blackberries and pepper on the palate, black fruits on the after taste with hints of Indian spices (garam masala mix actually). Needs air and cooling down to at least 12-14 degrees. Organic in conversion.

I firstly smell a strong alcohol in the wine, it’s 15% abv. Then I decanted for 30min, it’s deep ruby-garnet colour, black berry, black currant, oriental herbal, forest floor, earthy, leather. It’s really nice tannin, good acidity, good flavour intensity. But the fruity does not stay for long while the tannin is still here, although the tannin is relatively soft, I would say that the wine is not perfectly balance. Nevertheless, the price of the wine is considered to be good enough if compared to the quality

Tasted April 2022.  Still young!!!  Lovely nose with vanilla, blackberries, and plum. Still showing some grippy tannins with black cherry, mushroom, and earth.  Could easily lay down another 10 years.

Very fruity with black cherry, blueberry and plum aromas. A beautiful wine with great mouthfeel and well integrated tannins that tingle the tongue on a long finish. Celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary with this wine!

From biodynamically grown grapes, this flagship wine is Chateau Fonplegade's ultimate expression of its clay & limestone rich terroir. Although still young, it has impeccable balance showing the finest attributes of the vineyard to create a complex & complete expression of St. Emilion winemaking. Color was a deep red; It opened to a refined nose of plums, raspberries & sophisticated minerality with initial sweet tannin soft, velvety mouthfeel changing to voluptuous black fruit notes & fine tannic structure.

Brick colour at the edge and on disc. Nice aroma with spicy note like black pepper. Palate. Autumn leaves. Charming acidity. I may sound odd, but I felt it was sleek. Nicely aged Saint-Émilion from one of my favourite VT. 2 hours decanting necessary. But I must agree with those who say a wine of Michel Rollin tastes similar wherever it is from. Bio is a plus, but not a must. I have stewed some wagyū and root vegetables.

Had this a couple of weeks ago, but it was corked. This the last and second bottle was not! 😀 
Brown / brick red edge. Needed a couple hours of air to wear of some irregularities and wake up. 
Decanted to separate from sediments. 
Well balanced, with good fruit and acidity. Shows plenty of secondary & tertiary aromas. 
 black fruit plum oak earthy leather tobacco cassis cedar minerals graphite mushroom cigar box forest floor slightly fig.
Had with horse steak. Good pairing. Will buy again! 4.2!

Love this one ... never seen this before at any duty free shop ... tried this at a wine tasting cellar ... gave it 30-40 mins to open and was beautiful ... very strong nose and wxtremry good palate .. very earthy and true to the right bank .. love it

Deep dark purple color. Just a bit of sediments. Very intense nose displaying amazing fruit purity. Some pepper, ripe black fruits and also oak in there. The palate is plummy and very lush. Outstanding.

A surprisingly bold right bank, a nice surprise for a left bank lover. Robust, full bodied with tannins rounding up after a few hours of decanting. Needs to age more and will require less airing. Despite an unremarkable vintage, the wine shows depth and complexity, nice raspberry and strawberry jam notes linger in mouth. A decent value.

Decanted 45 mins. Pretty smooth. Lots of wet soil and dried fruit and plum. Smooth and medium plus tannins with good finish. Not a ton of fruit or explosion but just solid and tasty. Would show better with meat

Not a label I was familiar with and thought it would be fun, and it was! Good amount of fruit, cassis, blueberries and strawberries on the nose, also slight cedar and slight mint, less structured on the palate than i would expect, tannins were soft and quite round for this young a wine. The sweetness of the fruit held in check on the palate by good acid balanced with slight mineral. Medium finish. Overall pleasant on an unusually cool night!

American-owned chateau committed to biodynamic farming. 

🍇 95/5 Merlot, Cabernet Franc, matured for 16-20 months in mainly (85%) new 🇫🇷 oak.

Deep ruby. Med(+) aromas, fresh plum, cassis, iris, cedar, smoke, nutmeg, mint, bacon.

Dry, high acidity & alcohol, med(+) tannins & body. Med(+) flavours, plum, blackcurrant juice, clove, chocolate, peppery med(+) finish.
 
Too young, will develop w/ further cellaring & has the structure to last another 10+ years. Went well w/ beef fillet steak & red wine jus. 3.8🎄💫

3.8@Homey place, with blind tasting. Obviously Bordeaux, but at the beginning, I could not detect right or left bank, probably due to lack of aromas by stage of off peak. Quiet mild and shy at 1st stage. In terms of age, my guess was 2001-2004, coming from the reason that this bottle looked like later stage of peak or off peak at this age. It displayed aromas of blackfruits, smoke, oak, cedar, leather, earth, a dash of mint. Very mild & smooth tannin & acidity. Fenale lingering smoke & slight mint.

French red wine from the Bordeaux area, Saint-Emilion Grand Cru. Full bodied, deep red. Fully matured after 15 years. Second wine of Chateau Fonplegade. Blend from Cabernet Sauvignon. Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Blackberry, cassis, strawberry, cedar, pepper, oak

BA lounge wine #58: This estate is one of the oldest in the region, with its ruins going back to 400AD. The chateau was beautifully and fully restored in 2015 by the owners Denise and Steven Adams. 95%Merlot and aged for 24months in 85% new French oak give this wine a very smooth and velvety texture and taste. 2009 is a vintage you can hardly go wrong anyway with wines that are easy to approach already in younger years but have the strength to last very long as well. Convincing 94 points by Robert Parker.

Clear, deep ruby, persistent legs. On the nose dark fruits like black currant, blackberry, black cherry, and dark chocolate, tobacco, and leather.  On the palate dry, medium plus acid medium plus alcohol, full body, long finish, medium plus tannin.  Rich instructed wine with flavors of black cherry, blackberry, cigar box, dark chocolate, cedar, and leather. Very good quality, drink now, suitable for further aging.
Bold currant with spice and smoke.  Has tannin.  Less impressive than pomerol
vanilla, medium acidity, medium body. wset level 1  certification (sept 7 2019)
Bright, clean, assertive. The color is brilliant, but overwhelmingly bitter tannins predominate.
Blueberry, dark fruit, tobacco. Very silky and round tannins.
Good wine with potential. Needs to age. For now it lacks the body i so crave.
Tried it for a second time. Might not buy it again.
Good but won’t buy again for this price.
My favorite Bordeaux
Blackberry and dry oak. Wonderful flavor.

£45
Amazing.  
Beautiful.  Silky. Smooth.
Wonderful balance between Jammy-ness & tannins 
Red fruit
Leather

The 2014 chateau fonplegade grand cru classe is soooo much nicer than the 2012 fleure de fonplegade grand cru
Of course that is reflected in the price £49 vs £28
Wonderful saint emilion grand cru, a little young but still really quaffable
Went excellently with NY steak, and a nice Bordeaux, easy to drink with a pleasant finish
Blackberry, plum, tobacco, smoke and pepper.
Oak, vanilla, dark cherry,
(4,2) Fruity. Spicy. Nice balance, with good structure and subtle spiciness.

Great wine and nice visit.  Is still very young.  Would like to try again in a few years.

I thought this was a really nice wine. In terms of value, it was great.

Purchased for 
Napa Wine Academy class.
Plums and cherries on the nose with some toast and cream. On the palate those red and black fruits come through with black berrry, butter and some earthy notes.
Structure, elegant and long finish. Blackberries and leather. I tasted at the winery, lovely Chateau in St Emilion and impressive production refinement.
Shame it was not a great bottle or past it’s best but it had a look and taste to it that told me it was passed it’s best and I had no reason to drink it.

Delicious Bordeaux, a true and decent wine. Rich, sophisticated nose with a taste to match. Brings the rogue gallery of all those well-marketed but cheesy American Cabernets and Merlots into focus and to shame.
2020 - easy drinking, rich rim, elegant blend of vanilla, leather, and dark fruit notes, with a light hint of spice.
Fruity not heavy but with delicious fruit color seductive. Overall good but thought bio but not labeled as such, why?
2016 vintage. Classic merlot. Deep purple, strong cherries on the nose. Still young, overall full bodied, fragrant with strong tannins with spices on the finish.

5 hour decant:  tanins settled and this really opened.  Smoke and cured meats.  Drinks light despite being a big wine.  Wish I had more to try in five years.

Fifteen minutes decant: Tanins are still so aggressive that the secondary flavors are awfully hard to discern.  Hopefully tanins soften in a few hours or this will be mainly a wasted drinking experience.  What fruit jumps through is fresh and it drinks fairly light given the alcohol content.

A gorgeous medium ruby in the glass, this 14% ABV exploded with ripe fruit aromas, especially dark cherry, blackberry, violet, oak, and even barnyard funk. 

Similar taste profile, sans the funk, but I found it overly tart, so acidity is quite prevalent. The integrated tannins makes it smooth and capable of a few more years in the cellar. 

Overall, just not my favorite.

An earthy nose nit some black cherries with hints of ash from the cab franc. Deep purple color with garnet hues from the aging, concentrated, high body, low rounded tannins, low acidity, dry, drinkable, and with a medium finish. A solid Bordeaux, overpriced, but enjoyable to drink.

I bought this in Bordeaux itself.. indeed very very nice great color nice nose and lots of berries. Paid about 100€
But worth while. Would buy it again
Black cherry , blackberry, some vanilla and oak. Very smooth and acid with their round tannins. Superb.

Pencil led and currants on the nose. Beautiful fruit but with a nice hint of old world French terroir....think earthy in a young and vibrant way.
Great wine keeps all aromas after 18 years.
Right from the beginning, strong notes of black cherry. A smooth, consistent wine with a big (somewhat smoky) finish.
Nice smell with  plum blackberry in the nose. Great taste with  plum blackberry leather on the tounge. Medium plus tannins.
Fruity & medium bodied. I love the 2007 which we always have when we are in Ke Grand in Bordeaux. Love the tannin finish.
At or very close to its peak, this wine has the perfect hint of sweet strawberry balanced with peppery notes. Absolutely perfect with a nice steak.
Juicy and fruity on the nose. Once you dig in it is the earthy Bordeaux you want. Great wine and drinking fantastic. Drink immediately.

Tasted upon opening, very intense, too intense actually and we gave him some time to open. Dark red robe, nose of blackberries, a bit woody and leathery. Powerful wine, very concentrated with hints of cocoa on the finale and a nicely controlled acidity.

Very light fruit structure slightly overwhelmed by prominent tannin and acid. Some herbaceous notes in there too. Felt like this must have been a cooler year on the right bank because ripeness was lacking. Decent food wine though - would go quite well with some fatty meat.

Really solid Bordeaux to pair with our ribeye, artisan mac & cheese and l’artusi mushroom dish. 

Full bodied with notes of red fruit that weren’t overshadowed by the fullness of the wine. 

Very much marina / hunter style cab sauv- like vibe but with a Bordeaux twist- and also affordable as far as Bordeaux wines go.

Like other 2015 Bordeaux’s I’ve tried, this one is sadly not ready to be enjoyed. It needs at least a decade to cellar but at this price point one may wonder if its worth it. That’s up to you. In its current state, the wine appears black in color and has black and blue fruit aromas and harsh/overpowering tannins and acid on the palate. I see some potential but this won’t present as well as some other grande cru classés. You’ll have to wait and see!

/5 ⭐️ Broad, slightly green and okey

🍷 Appearance: clear; deep ruby

👃🏻Nose: clean; pronounced intensity; aromas of black fruit (blueberry), oak (coffee); developing

👅 Palate: dry; medium+ acidity; high (oak) tannin; medium alcohol ( %); full body; pronounced flavour intensity; flavours of black fruit, oak (dark coffee); long ok bitter finish
Intense complex wine decant smooth up font with interesting cofee fruit n spice  aftertastes.  Great buy
Delicious and oh so smooth... outstanding!

This was my DON’T (dog o’ night) although in a line up of six 2005 BDX that is very far from a disgrace 🤣 
Juicy with high acidity, I couldn’t quite find the balance here. I also found my mind wandering, and then wondering why an American owned Château wouldn’t produce something more voluptuous and approachable. Less graphite, more lead in the pencil please. 😆

This 2010 vintage certainly needed time to open up. Once that happened you taste smooth, red fruity and Woody flavours. A great character wine to share with friends and family on a special occasion. Definitely grand cru classé worthy.

Bought this wine in Carrefour Saint-Egreve in Grenoble. Quite old wine, although not the best vintage, at very affordable price - what else could one want? On nose ripe cherry, dried plum, blueberry, chocolate, smoke, oak. Palate is soft, with rounded tannins and balancing acidity, cherry, plum, blueberry, nice aftertaste. Nice wine, but it doesn't posess the proper complexity of aged Bordeaux. Maybe due to "irregular" vintage, unreliable winery or the wine was aged not enough. We were disappointed. 🤔 3.7.

Classic Bordeaux nose, dark and earthy. Actually quite a bit of structure for a right bank Bordeaux. Medium tannins. Acidity is touch to high for proper balance. I think this is simply too early for this wine. It has ageing potential. I'll buy another bottle and bury it in the back of the cellar for the next 5 years. But it is not great right now.

Exactly what I want a St Emilion to be on the nose, this is lovely and rich. Fruity wood, cherry, and light raspberry abound, and I think this would be delicious even after another decade or so. Smooth and pleasant, if a little lacking in complexity, I would happily drink this again, but wouldn’t rush back to it.

Oufff. Very, very heavy. Cedar, cigar box, tobacco — a little bit of vanilla. Plum, blackberry: dark, sticky, way too much for me ☺️

(Parmentier)
Great!! Fruity and excellent

Nice easy wine to drink.  Not overpowering, but has staying power and did not change much once opened and left in bottle.  Will have to try aerating next time. Drank with Kathy, Guibert, Dan, Ellen and Evan.  Wine & cheese night.

39 years old, after working on the cork for a bit I didn't want to air this one out to long.  After short time this came up in classic grand cru fashion.  St Emilion has such wonderful flavors and soft tannins.  This was a real joy and i am so lucky to have been asked to be part of sharing with friends. Thank you !

(3.8) ‘Retirement home tasting: I received a collection of old wine bottles, bought in the 80 - 90’s from a winetrader in Waspik. Mainly Bordeaux left&right and some Burgandy. The first four went down the drain, but this St. Emillion is still alive and drinkable. Okay, it is a little sleepy in the nose, but while drinking the red fruit is still fresh with forrest floor and vanilla aroma’s. There is nothing that stops me from taking another sip. I will keep the rest for the Sunday evening steak.’

That's pretty much a 3.8-star rating, but when in doubt, I go with the accused and give it 4 stars

Tasting enoteca regionale del Barolo part III Serralunga/Monforte area (clay) - #2:
Appearance: ruby/garnet red, medium intens, clear. 
Nose: developing, clean condition, medium (+) intensity. Aromas of red fruit, strawberry, cassis, rose petal, marzipan, candied cherry.
Palate: dry, medium (+) intens, medium acidity, medium (+) tannins, medium (+) body, medium (+) finish. 
Assessment: outstanding wine. Potential for aging.

Only made in exceptional vintages

Worth 4.3, +0.2 for the great value. Clear garnet with an orangey rim. Vintage 2013 is mature enough to drink immediately at below 20’C room temperature without decanting. Soothing and round. Full-bodied, soft tannins and medium dry. Leather, smoke, salmon, fresh cherry on the nose. The latter carries onto the palate together with some eucalyptus and herby notes. A long minty zesty aftertaste. Even better sat after an hour. The kind of red that is refreshing as white and got better as the bottle went on.

A lot of tart cherry. Very little terroir. Pale garnet color. High acid (seems like 9 years is a good time to sit) low tannins.

Maybe you like your wines like that but I would say that this will definitely benefit from 10-15+ years resting.

On the palate, the wine is dry, med+ acidity, high tannins, high alc, med+ body, med intensity, and med+ finish.
The wine ia very good.

It offers ripe aromas with red cherry with earthy edge, and dense flavors with wild strawberry, tangy orange peel underlying dusty tannins. Oak accents of cinnamon, vanilla and spice stay in the background to exude savoriness, while giving grip with chewy texture for powerful grace yet elegantly restrained in feel. 4.1
Surprisingly concentrated and fresh. Good value, with spices and sweet red fruits. Well structured with high acidity and ripe, round tannins. Finish is medium plus.

Nose is wonderfully vibrant. Old school pencil shavings. Rose petals. Tea leaves. Five spice. Hint of mint. Dark cherry

At Pull n Pour the tannins are not too grumpy, but a little mouth-drying. Further ageing will definitely improve this Barolo. High acidity. M+ body. I’d have guessed alcohol to be high, but it’s ‘just’ 13.5%. Pronounced flavours similar to nose aromas, but not very fruitful. Seems older than 7yr

Nebbiolo Wednesday.   A comfort wine to soothe the soul after Tuesday 🇺🇸.   Nice floral / cherry start.  Palate follows thru with expected gritty tannins but still nice red fruit.  Medium finish.   This entry level young Barolo did its job.

This is the entry level Barolo for Boroli.
At nose wild strawbery, flowers dried sweet tomato, red fruit in general with an elegant aroma.
In mouth it is an "easy"wine thanks to smooth tannins, with a good roundness and a well managed acidity that "cleans the mouth".  Medium high persistency.
It needs some years more to reach its peak especially in texture and harmony but it is not so far.

Red fruit, cherry, high acidity, decant for 4 hours to soften up for this young vintage to reveal the lovely and vibrant fruitiness.

This was wonderful. The wine from that night which I wanted to keep drinking. It’s  leather oak cherry but somehow refreshing/mineral at the same time.
Cherry, plum and earthy. Smooth and balance. It takes about 1 hr to breath and up to its best after 3 hrs.  A bit sad is the wine is a bit over its peak.
Slight bellow 4*, smooth, medium bodied, bit too acidic, and not much else. Doesn’t really show barollo character, its a good wine but falls short from expectation (and price)..
Leather and floral notes on the nose and lots of cherry on the palate. The wine has a good amount of acid, and the tannins has mellowed out quite a bit with age. Very nice!

Pretty red berries and florals on the nose that give way to leather and forest floor with hints of smoke. Palate lovely with acid. Lots of spiced leather, dark berries, savoury and earthy flavours, liquorice, tarry chewy tannins. Savoury spice led lingering on the palate. Colour of the wine suggests more age than palate shows, but everything is really well integrated on this wine. Tannin, oak, acid and flavours all in good balance. Very good at regular pricing and excellent for the price i picked this up at

Classic Barolo, very refined and well made.
Nose plum, marrasquino cherry, dry rose, and stems. No noticeable new oak influence.
The palate has fresh acidity, good concentration, a noticeable salinity, tannins that are ripe, firm
and very elegant. Not extremely dry, or chewy, just well extracted. 
This is an impressive effort from Boroli who’s producing better wines every year.
Drinking well now, but it can be kept for another 5-8 years.

Beautiful structure and balance of sweet red fruits and acidity + tannin. Caramel and milk chocolate notes with that strawberry & balsamic-like dessert flavour.
Packs a big tar and petrol punch for a 15 year old wine. Mellows in the glass, with some strawberry and mocha flavors coming through.
Red fruit and acidity on the nose. full body red currents and leathery finish. medium tannins but a bit high on acidity. long balanced aftertaste .

Entry level barolo. It is owned by lvmh group. Seems to be more modern style hence it is approachable even though I drinking it when it is 7 years old.  Notes of red cherry, licorice, chewy  tannins. High alcohol and long finishing. Still can keep in cellar for five to seven years more. Had it with German pork sausage with French mustard.

Great Barolo. Aromas of red fruits, rich with flavors, pulms, red & black berries, smooth, well balanced wine. A nice long after taste.

Special large glass at the Limewood to pair with the pigs cheeks. I wasn’t disappointed, heavy, heavy tannins with extra tannins. Bosch and boom. Lovely light yet heavy cherry. Light in colour but packs a punch. Dry and delicate and yet heeeeaavy. Love it

First time trying these in several years.  Pale color, very earthy and varied aromatics.  On the palate this is highly traditional, a stark, acidic and tannic wine that is very challenging.  But challenging now in the service of future improvement.  For now, have with cheese and charcuterie.  Otherwise hold for a decade or more.

The bright, burgundy colour suggests a simple, light wine but it is anything but. Smooth earthy, plums give way to another layer of richer olives and end with a chocolately finish. Gentle tannins. Good wine.

At restaurant in town of Barolo. They had ran out of the older Barolo vintage by coravin. Was offered their Barbaresco coravin, but seemed wrong not having a Barolo given where I am!

So choice of two younger offerings, started with this 2017.  Pale garnet hue, vanilla pepper licorice blackberry. Nice balance, good acidity. Not up to recent ones tried, but been a bit spoilt, and would be very happy having a bottle of this back home!
Leather and plum. Sold barolo. Hot finish.
As light and smooth as a Barolo can be. Super thin on the mouth with tons dark cherry vanilla and spice. Lovely wine with age. Had in Castiglione Falleto in Piemonte.
Musty cellar, wet leather, black pepper and spice on the nose. Tart cherries, luscious plum and pepper on the broad palate. Complex. Lasting finish. Despite it's 2008 vintage, it has years left.
Well this went down very well. Quite lovely!
Dense, but not too intense. My first Nebbuilo.
Ok
Full bodied as a Barolo should be... Yet lacking the refinement. Complex characteristics but somewhat unfulfilled to the last drop.

A nice Barolo that is a bit softer than most I have tried.  The color is a touch lighter and more of a red garnet.

Produced from the Nebbiolo grape, the nose displays elegant red fruit, earthy leather and tobacco.  The palate reveals flavors of black cherries, licorice, earthy spices and cassis.

The body is medium to full and is well balanced with distinct mineral notes.  This wine has well integrated mild tannins while displaying a nice soft texture and feel along with a lingering finish. Enjoy!

Hard to rate this wine. It isn't bad but certainly shouldn't be in this condition after 5 years.

The  nose displays dried fruits, jammy plums, and roast bacon. Balanced on the palate but got quite aged character. Might be the result of reductive wine making and/or less quality cork or simply storage problem. 3.6
Ruby red colour. Floral aromas. Red cherry flavours with medium tannins. Good QPR (at least for Barolo in Australia). 3.9 from me. 2010 vintage tasted 03/08/2016
Chinese 5 spices, speculaas on the nose. Cinemon and baileaves...georgeus. soooo elegant and belanced its fantastic. This is an amazing price / quality!
2010 drank in 2017. Exhibits enlivening acidity typical of Barolo and nicely restrained tannins. Flavour profile: rose, cranberry, clay, aniseed, licorice.

Med garnet with an orange hue. Intense aromas of ripe red fruit, herbs, earth and a hint of oak from two years of aging in oak barriques and casks.  Dry, but with surprising amounts of sweet red cherry. Med (+) acidity and medium, polished, resolved tannins. The alcohol is high (14%) but seems lower. Full-bodied yet elegant, with med (+) flavor intensity and length. Smooth as silk and drinking beautifully, probably at its peak. A remarkably good showing, after 12 years, for an entry-level Barolo.

Dark rusty brown. Smells acidic and intense, a lot of blackcurrant leaves. Easier and fruitier after a while. Dry, no question about it from the beginning. Bird cherry, pomegranate, sour cherry, blackberry, leather, oak, thyme. Tannins are strong but round and controlled  Nice and elegant companion for a fancy beef dinner.

classical red garnet color
100% Nebbiolo, named for the ubiquitous autumnal fog called nebbia in Italian,
beautiful bouquet on the nose, flowers of violet, orange, peach, pear, banana tart, roasted coffee, cinnamon pasty, hints of smoke, oak and herbs, autumn leaves, rosemary and thyme,
powerful structure on the palate, black berries, earthy forest floor, oak, leather, tobacco, ripe dark cherry, chocolate, hits of spice and black pepper, notes of licorice,
silky, structured tannins
long figgy, pruny finish

Initial bouquet of banana pudding and initial burst of floral notes on the palate... Light bodied-ish... Pleasant sanguine blood red... Cinnamon nose with lots of red plums... Some light leather with fair tannins... Goes well with black truffles and French pigeon with chicken liver, peach and dried persimmon... Very structured and polite wine...

Enjoyed this wine again. A wonderful bouquet on the nose. In comparison with the 1998, it still smoothing out with great acidity. It also flatted out towards end

Original review At first thought this Barolo turned but over time it changed and years of being btl opened up to a fine delicate wine
Fruity initially but dry, earthy finish. Great burgundy color. Terrific birthday wine. 31

Tannic but not big and powerful like a Barolo should be. Light in color and body, with aromas of sandalwood and tobacco. Fruit is not fully ripe or the acid and tannins kill it. Maybe this needs a couple more years in the cellar to soften the tannins and let some fruit out.  87 points.

Barolobrunello, first time to try wine from this producer and was not that impressed. Not open, too young and hard to imagine what will happened with it in few years.
Light ruby red color.
Medium intese nose and kind of closed, minty, fresh but not too deep, rapsberry and red currant.
On palate astringent, acidity high, body medium, tannins medium, minty, red fruity flavor with medium finish.

A fruity blend with super high acidity with hint of slight floral note. A rather light body, medium tannin, medium intensity. Finishing is medium as well. Lack serious complexity even at this age. Abit of disappointment.

Fruity aromas reminiscent of cherry and plum. The gentleness here is just one aspect, not a leitmotif thanks to renewed fruity notes, this time with an acidic blend of pomegranate, currant, raspberry and bitter orange. Here and there spicy nuances ....

NEBBIOLO TOP DOG

This PUPPY continues to perform! After a break, my first wine in over a week and worth the wait! Just enjoyment here so quick & dirty notes...

Tons of dark fruit, spicy vanilla & forest path. Fine razor edged tannins are so integrated here, they have silk padding. Stealthy flavors sneak up like ninjas, swamping the palate! Throw in the crazy $35 sale price and you can't lose!

If this was a 3 Musketeer it would be Porthos the Pirate! Swashbuckling, debonair, cocky, charming!

Quiet New Year’s Eve dinner at home after a big night out - just the way I like it. 

Perfumed aromas of red fruit and clove, light-medium body of cherry, licorice, leather, pepper and star anise. Finish is dry and quite high in acidity and tannins suggesting more potential with further aging. 

To be honest, I like my wines fuller bodied hence my rating is subjective. 

Happy New Year my friends! Glad to be part of your wine journey and happy to share mine as well. May 2022 be better for all. Cheers! 🍷

BUY! High tannins and high acidity in this elegant Barolo! It could use a year or two more in the cellar, but it's certainly ready to enjoy now with a meal that's got plenty of fat. Duck Confit anyone?! Tobacco and green peppers on the nose with tobacco, leather and cherries on the tongue. It's got a loonngggg finish that I'm SUPER into! It's balanced, complex, dark, and firm in tannins that are just starting to mellow out and get silky - a FANTASTIC example of an Italian Barolo!!

Very interesting variety that I can't recall having before. Medium-to-heavy bodied with a strong nose full of red fruit. Lovely tannins. Nice round finish that reminds of the nose. Very slight sweet aftertaste.

Clean clear. Mild Brick meniscus.

Nose  explodes of dried smoked herbs, rich and vibrant high tone dark fruits and caramel touching port aromas.

My first Barolo and I'm very impressed. Aged for 7 years has given this wine more time to develop the flavours and aromas. On the nose I got rose, rose hip, cherry, star anise, clay pot. On the pallet lots of acidity but in perfect harmony with the tannins which do not over power (perhaps that's due to the ageing). Nice long finish with a hint of spices. Medium alcohol sitting at 13.5%.

By the color you would say it's pretty weak, but you would be wrong. It's mighty and nice. My opinion is that it will be even better in 2 or 3 years, but this wine is one of the proofs why Barolo is so popular all around the world.

Beautiful Barolo color, I could stare at that for days....pepper and dried herb aromas.  Some raspberry and a lot of leather evens out the heady astringency.  Good wine although I'm not sure this one will develop anymore in the bottle.

We have moved on to Italy and had a very nice Barolo.

I have not reviewed italian wines for some time and this has been a good one to start again. In the eye it goes from garnet to brown, with an almost orange rim. Intensity that goes from medium to low.Light legs. Wood in the nose with mineral tones of graphite; a background of vainilla and bread. 
Fruit in the mouth: raspberry and strawberry; soft, persistent tannins.  High acidity but surprisingly pleasant. An ending of smoked wood... An italian wine to go back to. For sure.

Tasting the 2010 (In mid 2021). Maybe it’s too late to taste this wine, I expected better. It has a pale ruby color, very pretty. In nose, it’s very good, smells beautiful, very fresh; there is strawberry, cherry, raisins, leather, oak, floral; very elegant and pleasant smell. In mouth, a bit disappointing, not balanced, bold; light acidity, strong tannins; a bit more on the dry side; medium finish. It’s not a bad wine, but I think that it’s golden days already passed.

Fine but is missing the fruit and some structure. Good floral flavour in the nose but this is missing a bit in the taste. Very hard to evaluate the potential if stored for some years or if it will not develop further

Cherry on the nose that is softening well with age. Tannins are bigger that expected. Slight brown tinge to the wine as it is showing obvious age. This is a good wine! Structure is fantastic and fruits is becoming more pronounced as it opens up in the bottle

Final effort at Barolo after working up through the price range. I just don’t like Nebbiolo. As usual, a bit thin, a bit astringent, not quite satisfying. Nice secondary aromas and flavours but I can think of 10 better wines even near this price range.

This has a nice aroma and flavour profile - classic Barolo. This is apparently made in the modernist style which imparts more floral and spice flavours. Lovely fresh roses, cherry, mint, and sweet baking spices. Should be great in a few years. Perhaps a bit aggressive still in the tannins to be enjoyed without food.

The nose offers smokey aromas of leather, tobacco and sweet flavours of blackberry, raspberry and roses. In the mouth tannins are plentiful, the acidity is quite high and the alcohol too. It is indeed a very powerful wine, but it is held together thanks to its perfect balance. The attack feels sour with fruits at first, but then a cloud of smoke and musk with the warm feel of acolhol adds itself to end up with a very tasty complex long lasting finish. Excellent wine ! Needs to be decanted at least 2 hours.

I'll be missing tomorrow's Nebbiolo Monday so here's my contribution on a Sunday night Ken. 
A Barolo with a bit of age and in my opinion it needed it. 
There are bold aromas here of macerated cherries, tobacco, cinnamon bark, liquorice and a very slight damp oaky hint. 
On the palate it has an initial Foxes blackcurrant boiled sweets sensation, tart black fruits and dusty teeth coating tannins. Long finish. 
It fared well against my slow cooked lamb, prune and chickpea tagine with pine nut cous cous.

A bit closed nose, but some notes of Cocoapeal is present. The mouth is more fenolic, deep dark and spicy. Dried sour dark berries. Tannic dryness all the way from start to end. Some Vanilla oak which I am unsure if i like. But all In all a decent Barolo which can still be kept for years.

This is my usual bottle at the local Italian joint. Tart cherries and dusty tannins leave the wine as a relatively acidic red that is fantastic with a meal. Not a tremendous amount of body nor a long finish I prefer in a red, but highly drinkable. Peppery ceasar salad, fontina arancini, and gnochetti with an herbaceous lamb ragu felt like the perfect dishes for this Barolo. (Disclaimer: I went without lunch and was stupid fungry...)
